verses.ar_en: It will happen when the Egyptians see you that they will say: This is his wife. They will kill me and let you live.

verses.ar_he: אִמְרִי כְעַן אֲחָתִי אָתְּ בְּדִיל דְּיֵיטַב לִי בְּדִילָךְ וְתִתְקַיֵּם נַפְשִׁי בְּפִתְגָּמָיְכִי
verses.ar_en: Please [Now] say [therefore] that you are my sister, so that it will go well with me for your sake, and my life will be spared because of you [through your words].

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה כַּד עַל אַבְרָם לְמִצְרָיִם וַחֲזוֹ מִצְרָאֵי יָת אִתְּתָא אֲרֵי שַׁפִּירָא הִיא לַחֲדָא
verses.ar_en: And it was when Avram was entering Egypt, that the Egyptians beheld the woman, because she was very beautiful.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲזוֹ יָתַהּ רַבְרְבֵי פַרְעֹה וְשַׁבָּחוּ יָתַהּ לְפַרְעֹה וְאִדַּבָּרַת אִתְּתָא לְבֵית פַּרְעֹה
verses.ar_en: Pharaoh’s officials saw her and praised her to Pharaoh. The woman was taken to Pharaoh’s house.

verses.ar_he: וּלְאַבְרָם אוֹטִיב בְּדִילַהּ וַהֲווֹ לֵהּ עָאן וְתוֹרִין וַחֲמָרִין וְעַבְדִין וְאַמְהָן וְאַתְנָן וְגַמְלִין
verses.ar_en: He treated Avram well for her sake. He thus acquired sheep, oxen, donkeys, male and female slaves, female donkeys and camels.

verses.ar_he: וְאַיְתִי יְיָ עַל פַּרְעֹה מַכְתָּשִׁין רַבְרְבִין וְעַל אֱנַשׁ בֵּיתֵהּ עַל עֵיסַק שָׂרַי אִתַּת אַבְרָם
verses.ar_en: Adonoy afflicted Pharaoh with severe plagues [brought severe plagues upon Pharaoh], and also his household, because of Sarai, Avram’s wife.

verses.ar_he: וּקְרָא פַרְעֹה לְאַבְרָם וַאֲמַר מָה דָּא עֲבַדְתְּ לִי לְמָא לָא חַוֵּיתָא לִי אֲרֵי אִתְּתָךְ הִיא
verses.ar_en: Pharaoh summoned Avram and said: What is this that you have done to me? Why did you not tell me that she is your wife?

verses.ar_he: לְמָא אֲמַרְתְּ אֲחָתִי הִיא וּדְבָרִית יָתַהּ לִי לְאִתּוּ וּכְעַן הָא אִתְּתָךְ דְּבַר וְאִיזֵל
verses.ar_en: Why did you say, She is my sister, so that I should take her to myself for a wife? Now here is your wife, take [her] and go.

verses.ar_he: וּפַקִּיד עֲלוֹהִי פַּרְעֹה גּוּבְרִין וְאַלְוִיאוּ יָתֵהּ וְיָת אִתְּתֵהּ וְיָת כָּל דִילֵהּ
verses.ar_en: Pharaoh assigned men to him and they escorted him and his wife and all that was his.

verses.ar_he: וּסְלֵיק אַבְרָם מִמִּצְרַיִם הוּא וְאִתְּתֵהּ וְכָל דִּילֵהּ וְלוֹט עִמֵּהּ לְדָרוֹמָא
verses.ar_en: Avram went up from Egypt; he, his wife, and all that he had, together with Lot into the south.

verses.ar_he: וְאַבְרָם תַּקִּיף לַחֲדָא בִּבְעִירָא בְּכַסְפָּא וּבְדַהֲבָא
verses.ar_en: Avram was very wealthy in livestock, silver and gold.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲזַל לְמַטְלָנוֹהִי מִדָּרוֹמָא וְעַד בֵּית אֵל עַד אַתְרָא דִּי פְּרַס תַּמָּן מַשְׁכְּנֵהּ בְּקַדְמֵיתָא בֵּין בֵּית אֵל וּבֵין עָי
verses.ar_en: He continued on his travels from the south to Beis-Eil, until the place where he originally had [set up] his tent, between Beis-Eil and Ai.

verses.ar_he: לַאֲתַר מַדְבְּחָא דִּי עֲבַד תַּמָּן בְּקַדְמֵיתָא וְצַלֵּי תַמָּן אַבְרָם בִּשְׁמָא דַּיְיָ
verses.ar_en: To the site of the altar which he made there at first; and there Avram called [prayed] in the Name of Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וְאַף לְלוֹט דְּאָזִיל עִם אַבְרָם הֲוָה עָאן וְתוֹרִין וּמַשְׁכְּנִין
verses.ar_en: Lot who accompanied Avram also had sheep, cattle and tents.

verses.ar_he: וְלָא סוֹבָרַת יָתְהוֹן אַרְעָא לְמִיתַב כַּחֲדָא אֲרֵי הֲוָה קִנְיָנְהוֹן סַגִּי וְלָא יְכִילוּ לְמִיתַּב כַּחֲדָא
verses.ar_en: The land was unable to support them that they might dwell together, for their wealth was so great that they were unable to dwell together.

verses.ar_he: וַהַוַת מַצוּתָא בֵּין רָעֵי בְּעִירֵה דְאַבְרָם וּבֵין רָעֵי בְּעִירֵה דְלוֹט וּכְנַעֲנָאָה וּפְרִזָאָה בְּכֵן יָתִיב בְּאַרְעָא
verses.ar_en: There was a quarrel between the herdsmen of Avram’s flocks and the herdsmen of Lot’s flocks. The Canaanites and the Perizzites were then living in the land.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר אַבְרָם לְלוֹט לָא כְעַן תְּהֵי מַצוּתָא בֵּינָא וּבֵינָךְ וּבֵין רַעֲוָתִי וּבֵין רַעֲוָתָךְ אֲרֵי גוּבְרִין אַחִין אֲנָחְנָא
verses.ar_en: Avram said to Lot: Please [Now], let there not be strife between me and you, and between my herdsmen and your herdsmen, for we are kinsmen.

verses.ar_he: הֲלָא כָל אַרְעָא קֳדָמָךְ אִתְפָּרַשׁ כְּעַן מִלְוָתִי אִם אַתְּ לְצִפּוּנָא וַאֲנָא לְדָרוֹמָא וְאִם אַתְּ לְדָרוֹמָא וַאֲנָא לְצִפּוּנָא
verses.ar_en: Is not all the land before you? Please [Now] separate from me, if [you go] to the left [north], I [will go] to the right [south], and if [you go] to the right [south], I [will go] to the left [north].

verses.ar_he: וּזְקַף לוֹט יָת עֵינוֹהִי וַחֲזָא יָת כָּל מֵישַׁר יַרְדְנָא אֲרֵי כֻלַהּ בֵּית שַׁקְיָא קֳדָם חַבָּלוּת יְיָ יָת סְדוֹם וְיָת עֲמֹרָא כְּגִנְתָא דַיְיָ כְּאַרְעָא דְמִצְרַיִם מָטֵּי לְצוֹעַר
verses.ar_en: Lot raised his eyes and saw the entire Jordan Plain, that it was [an] abundantly watered [place]; before Adonoy destroyed Sedom and Amorah, it was like Adonoy’s garden, like the land of Egypt, going towards Zoar.

verses.ar_he: וּבְחַר לֵיהּ לוֹט יַת כָּל מֵישַׁר יַרְדְנָא וּנְטַל לוֹט מִלְקַדְמִין וְאִתַּפְרָשׁוּ גְבַר מִלְוַת אָחוּהִי
verses.ar_en: Lot chose for himself the entire Jordan Plain; Lot journeyed from the east [before], and they separated one from another.

verses.ar_he: אַבְרָם יָתֵיב בְּאַרְעָא דִכְנָעַן וְלוֹט יָתֵיב בְּקִרְוֵי מֵישְׁרָא וּפְרַס עַד סְדוֹם
verses.ar_en: Avram lived in the land of Canaan; and Lot lived in the cities of the Plain, setting up his tents as far as Sedom.

verses.ar_he: וֶאֱנָשִׁין דִסְדוֹם בִּישִׁין בְּמָמוֹנְהוֹן וְחַיָבִין בִּגְוִיָתְהוֹן קֳדָם יְיָ לַחֲדָא
verses.ar_en: The people of Sedom were wicked [with their property] and sinful [with their bodies] towards [before] Adonoy, exceedingly.

verses.ar_he: וַיְיָ אֲמַר לְאַבְרָם בָּתַר דְאִתְפָּרֶשׁ לוֹט מֵעִמֵהּ זְקוֹף כְּעַן עֵינָךְ וַחֲזֵי מִן אַתְרָא דְאַתְּ תַּמָן לְצִפּוּנָא וּלְדָרוֹמָא וּלְמַדִינְחָא וּלְמַעֲרָבָא
verses.ar_en: Adonoy said to Avram after Lot had separated from him: Raise your eyes and look about from the place where you are, to the north, to the south to the east and to the west.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי יָת כָּל אַרְעָא דִי אַתְּ חָזֵי לָךְ אֶתְּנִנַהּ וְלִבְנָיךְ עַד עָלָם
verses.ar_en: For all the land that you see I give to you and to your descendants forever.

verses.ar_he: וֶאֱשַׁוֵּי יָת בְּנָיךְ סַגִיאִין כְּעַפְרָא דְאַרְעָא כְּמָא דִי לָא אֶפְשַׁר לִגְבַר לְּמִמְנֵי יָת עַפְרָא דְאַרְעָא אַף בְּנָיךְ לָא יִתִּמְנוּן
verses.ar_en: I will make your descendants [numerous] as the dust of the earth; so that if a man can count the dust of the earth, then your descendants too will be countable [just as it is impossible for a man to count the dust of the earth, so too your descendants will not be countable].

verses.ar_he: קוּם הֲלִיךְ בְּאַרְעָא לְאָרְכַּהּ וְלִפְתָיַהּ אֲרֵי לָךְ אֶתְּנִינַהּ
verses.ar_en: Rise, walk through the land—its length and breadth—for to you I will give it.

verses.ar_he: וּפְרַס אַבְרָם וַאֲתָא וִיתֵב בְּמֵישְׁרֵי מַמְרֵא דִי בְחֶבְרוֹן וּבְנָא תַמָן מַדְבְּחָא קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: Avram set up his tent, and he came and settled in the Plains of Mamrei which are in Chevron, and he built there an altar to [before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה בְיוֹמֵי אַמְרָפֶל מַלְכָּא דְבָבֶל אַרְיוֹךְ מַלְכָּא דְאֶלָסָר כְּדָרְלָעוֹמֶר מַלְכָּא דְעֵילָם וְתִדְעָל מַלְכָּא דְעַמְמֵי
verses.ar_en: This happened in the days of Amraphel, king of Shinar [Babylon], Aryoch, king of Elasar, Kedorlaomer, king of Ailam, and Tidal, king of Goyim [king of peoples].

verses.ar_he: סְדָרוּ (נ''א עֲבָדוּ) קְרָבָא עִם בֶּרַע מַלְכָּא דִסְדוֹם וְעִם בִּרְשַׁע מַלְכָּא דַעֲמֹרָה שִׁנְאָב מַלְכָּא דְאַדְמָה וְשֶׁמְאֵבֶר מַלְכָּא דִצְבוֹיִם וּמַלְכָּא דְבֶלַּע הִיא צוֹעַר
verses.ar_en: They waged war against Bera, king of Sedom, Birsha, king of Amorah, Shinav, king of Admah, Shemeiver, king of Tzevoyim, and the king of Bela, which is Zoar.

verses.ar_he: כָּל אִלֵין אִתְכְּנָשׁוּ לְמֵישַׁר חַקְלַיָא הוּא אֲתַר יַמָא דְמִלְחָא
verses.ar_en: All these joined together [assembled] at the valley of Siddim [the plain of the fields], which is [now] [the place of] the Salt Sea.

verses.ar_he: תַּרְתֵּי עַשְׂרֵי שְׁנִין פְּלָחוּ יָת כְּדָרְלָעוֹמֶר וּתְלָת עֶשְׂרֵי שְׁנִין מְרָדוּ
verses.ar_en: [For] twelve years they had served Kedorlaomer, and for thirteen years they rebelled.

verses.ar_he: וּבְאַרְבַּע עֶשְׂרֵי שְׁנִין אֲתָא כְּדָרְלָעֹמֶר וּמַלְכַיָא דְעִמֵהּ וּמְחוֹ יָת גִבָּרַיָא דִי בְעַשְׁתְּרוֹת קַרְנַיִם וְיָת תַּקִיפַיָא דִבְהֶמְתָּא וְיָת אֵמְתָנֵי דִבְשָׁוֵה קִרְיָתָיִם
verses.ar_en: In the fourteenth year, Kedorlaomer came together with the kings that were with him and they defeated the Rephaim [the mighty ones] in Ashteros Karnayim, the Zuzim [the powerful ones] in Ham, the Aimim [the ones that incite fear] at Shaveh Kiryasayim,

verses.ar_he: וְיָת חוֹרָאֵי דִי בְּטוּרְהוֹן דְשֵׂעִיר עַד מֵישַׁר פָּארָן דִסְמִיךְ עַל מַדְבְּרָא
verses.ar_en: And the Chorites in their hills of Seir, as far as Eil [the Plain of] Paran which borders [is next to] the wilderness.

verses.ar_he: וְתָבוּ וַאֲתוּ לְמֵישַׁר פִּלּוּג דִינָא הִיא רְקָם וּמְחוֹ יָת כָּל חֲקַל עֲמַלְקָאָה וְאַף יָת אֱמוֹרָאָה דְיָתֵיב בְּעֵין גֶּדִי
verses.ar_en: They turned back and came to Ein Mishpat [the plain of compromise] which is Kadeish [Rekem], and they struck all the territory of Amaleik, as well as the Emorites who lived in Chazazon Tamar [Ein Gedi].

verses.ar_he: וּנְפַק מַלְכָּא דִסְדוֹם וּמַלְכָּא דַעֲמוֹרָה וּמַלְכָּא דְאַדְמָה וּמַלְכָּא דִצְבוֹיִם וּמַלְכָּא דְבֶלַע הִיא צוֹעַר וְסַדָרוּ עִמְהוֹן קְרָבָא בְּמֵישַׁר חַקְלַיָא
verses.ar_en: The king of Sedom set out, along with the king of Amorah, the king of Admah, the king of Tzevoyim, and the king of Bela, which is Zoar, and engaged them in battle in the Valley of Siddim [in the plain of the fields].

verses.ar_he: עִם כְּדָרְלָעֹמֶר מַלְכָּא דְעֵילָם וְתִדְעָל מַלְכָּא דְעַמְמִין וְאַמְרָפֶל מַלְכָּא דְבָבֶל וְאַרְיוֹךְ מַלְכָּא דְאֶלָסָר אַרְבְּעָה מַלְכִין לָקֳבֵיל חַמְשָׁא
verses.ar_en: Against Kedorlaomer, king of Eilam, Sidal, king of Goyim [king of peoples], Amraphel, king of Shinar [Babylon], and Aryoch, king of Elasar; [there were] four kings against the five.

verses.ar_he: וּמֵישַׁר חַקְלַיָא בֵּירִין בֵּירִין מַסְקַן חֵימָרָא וַעֲרָקוּ מַלְכָּא דִסְדוֹם וַעֲמוֹרָה וּנְפָלוּ תַמָן וּדְאִשְׁתָּאֲרוּ לְטוּרָא עֲרָקוּ
verses.ar_en: The Valley of Siddim [The plain of the fields] was [full of] mortar pits [pits from which they raise up mortar]; [and when] the Kings of Sedom and Amorah fled they fell there [into the pits], while the remainder fled to the mountains.

verses.ar_he: וּשְׁבוֹ יָת כָּל קִנְיָנָא דִסְדוֹם וַעֲמוֹרָה וְיָת כָּל מֵיכָלְהוֹן וַאֲזָלוּ
verses.ar_en: They took [captured] all the wealth of Sedom and Amorah and all their provisions and they went on their way.

verses.ar_he: וּשְׁבוֹ יָת לוֹט וְיָת קִנְיָנֵהּ בַּר אַחוּהִי דְאַבְרָם וַאֲזָלוּ וְהוּא יָתֵיב בִּסְדוֹם
verses.ar_en: They took [captured] Lot and his wealth. [Lot was] Avram’s nephew. Then they went on their way. He had been living in Sedom.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲתָא מְשֵׁיזָבָא וְחַוִּי לְאַבְרָם עִבְרָאָה וְהוּא שָׁרֵי בְּמֵישְׁרֵי מַמְרֵא אֱמוֹרָאָה אֲחוּהִי דְאֶשְׁכּוֹל וַאֲחוּהִי דְעָנֵר וְאִינוּן אֱנָשֵׁי קְיָמֵהּ דְאַבְרָם
verses.ar_en: The one who had escaped came and told Avram the Ivri, who was living in the Plains of Mamrei the Emorite, the brother of Eshkol and Aneir. They were Avram’s allies.

verses.ar_he: וּשְׁמַע אַבְרָם אֲרֵי אִשְׁתְּבִי אֲחוּהִי וְזָרֵיז יָת עוּלֵמוֹהִי יְלִידֵי בֵיתֵהּ תְּלַת מְאָה וְתַמְנֵי עֲסַר וּרְדַף עַד דָן
verses.ar_en: When Avram heard that his kinsman was taken captive, he armed his trained servants [lads] who were born in his household, three hundred and eighteen [men], and he pursued [them] until Dan.

verses.ar_he: וְאִתְפְּלֵג עֲלֵיהוֹן לֵילְיָא הוּא וְעַבְדוֹהִי וּמְחוֹנוּן וּרְדָפִנוּן עַד חוֹבָא דִי מִצִפּוּנָא לְדַמָשֶׂק
verses.ar_en: He divided [his men] against them at night, he and his servants and he attacked them. He pursued them until Chovah, which is to the left [north] of Damascus.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲתֵיב יָת כָּל קִנְיָנָא וְאַף יָת לוֹט בַּר אֲחוּהִי וְקִנְיָנֵהּ אֲתֵיב וְאַף יָת נְשַׁיָא וְיָת עַמָא
verses.ar_en: He brought back all the property. His kinsman [His brother’s son] Lot and his possessions he also brought back, as well as the women and the people.

verses.ar_he: וּנְפַק מַלְכָּא דִסְדוֹם לְקַדָמוּתֵה בָּתַר דְתָב מִלְמִמְחֵי יָת כְּדָרְלָעוֹמֶר וְיָת מַלְכַיָא דִי עִמֵהּ לְמֵישַׁר מַפְנָא הוּא אֲתַר בֵּית רֵיסָא דְמַלְכָּא
verses.ar_en: The King of Sedom went out to meet him after his return from defeating Kedorlaomer and the kings that were with him, to the Valley of Shaveh which is the King’s Valley [to the barren plain, which is the place of the racetrack of the king].

verses.ar_he: וּמַלְכִּי צֶדֶק מַלְכָּא דִירוּשְׁלֶם אַפֵּיק לְחֵם וַחֲמָר וְהוּא מְשַׁמֵשׁ קֳדָם אֵל עִלָאָה
verses.ar_en: Malki Zedek, king of Shaleim [Yerushalayim], brought out bread and wine. He was a Kohein of [He was serving before] the Most High Almighty.

verses.ar_he: וּבָרְכֵיהּ וַאֲמָר בְּרִיךְ אַבְרָם לְאֵל עִלָאָה דְקִנְיָנֵהּ שְׁמַיָא וְאַרְעָא
verses.ar_en: He blessed him and said: Blessed be Avram to the Most High, Almighty Possessor of heaven and earth.

verses.ar_he: וּבְרִיךְ אֵל עִלָאָה דִמְסַר סָנְאָיךְ בִּידָךְ וִיהַב לֵיהּ חַד מִן עַשְׂרָא מִכֹּלָא
verses.ar_en: And blessed be the Most High Almighty Who has delivered your enemies into your hand. [Avram] gave him a tenth of everything.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר מַלְכָּא דִסְדוֹם לְאַבְרָם הַב לִי נַפְשָׁתָא וְקִנְיָנָא (סַב) דְבַר לָךְ
verses.ar_en: The King of Sedom said to Avram: Give me the people, and take the possessions for yourself.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר אַבְרָם לְמַלְכָּא דִסְדוֹם אֲרֵמִית יְדַי בִּצְלוֹ קֳדָם יְיָ אֵל עִלָאָה דְקִנְיָנֵהּ שְׁמַיָא וְאַרְעָא
verses.ar_en: Avram said to the King of Sedom: I have lifted my hand [in prayer] to [before] Adonoy [before] the Most High Almighty, Possessor of heaven and earth.

verses.ar_he: אִם מִחוּטָא וְעַד עַרְקַת מְסָנָא וְאִם אֶסַב מִכָּל דִי לָךְ וְלָא תֵימַר אֲנָא אַעְתָּרִית יָת אַבְרָם
verses.ar_en: Neither a thread nor a shoelace! And I will not take anything of yours, so you will not [be able] to say, I have made Avram wealthy.

verses.ar_he: לְחוֹד (בַּר) מִדִאֲכָלוּ עוּלֵמַיָא וְחָלָק גֻבְרַיָא דִי אֲזָלוּ עִמִי עָנֵר אֶשְׁכּוֹל וּמַמְרֵא אִינוּן יְקַבְּלוּן חַלָקְהוֹן
verses.ar_en: I am excluding myself; only what the lads have eaten, and the portion of the men who went with me, Aneir, Eshkol and Mamrei, they may take their portion.

verses.ar_he: בָּתַר פִּתְגָמַיָא הָאִלֵין הֲוָה פִּתְגָמָא דַיְיָ עִם אַבְרָם בִּנְבוּאָה לְמֵימָר לָא תִדְחַל אַבְרָם מֵימְרִי תְּקוֹף לָךְ אַגְרָךְ סַגִי לַחֲדָא
verses.ar_en: After these events, the word of Adonoy came to Avram in a vision, saying: Fear not Avram, I am your shield [My Word is your strength], your reward is very great.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר אַבְרָם יְיָ אֱלֹהִים מַה תִּתֶּן לִי וַאֲנָא אָזֵיל בְּלָא וְלָד וּבַר פַּרְנָסָא הָדֵין דִבְּבֵיתִי הוּא דַמַשְׂקָאָה אֱלִיעֶזֶר
verses.ar_en: Avram said: My Master, God, what will You give me since I continue to be childless, and the manager of my household [this supplier who is in my house] is Eliezer of Damascus.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר אַבְרָם הָא לִי לָא יְהַבְתְּ וְלָד וְהָא בַר בֵיתִי יָרִיתּ יָתִי
verses.ar_en: And Avram said: Behold, You have not given me children, and thus one of my household will be my heir.

verses.ar_he: וְהָא פִּתְגָמָא דַיְיָ עִמֵהּ לְמֵימַר לָא יִרְתִינָךְ דֵין אֱלָהֵין בַּר דְתוֹלִיד הוּא יִרְתִינָךְ
verses.ar_en: Suddenly the word of Adonoy came to him, saying: That one will not be your heir; only he that will come from within your body [a son that you will beget] will be your heir.

verses.ar_he: וְאַפֵּיק יָתֵהּ לְבָרָא וַאֲמַר אִסְתְּכִי כְעַן לִשְׁמַיָא וּמְנֵי כּוֹכְבַיָא אִם תִּכּוֹל לְמִמְנֵי יָתְהוֹן וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ כְּדֵין יְהוֹן בְּנָךְ
verses.ar_en: He [then] took him outside and said: Look towards the heavens and count the stars if you are able to count them. He then said to him: So [numerous] will your descendants be.

verses.ar_he: וְהֵימִין בְּמֵימְרָא דַיְיָ וְחָשְׁבַהּ לֵיהּ לְזָכוּ
verses.ar_en: He believed in [the Word of] Adonoy, and this He accounted to him for righteousness.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לֵהּ אֲנָא יְיָ דְאַפֵּקְתָּךְ מֵאוּרָא דְכַשְׂדָאֵי לְמִתַּן לָךְ יָת אַרְעָא הָדָא לְמֵירְתַהּ
verses.ar_en: He said to him: I am Adonoy who brought you out of Ur Kasdim, to give to you this land as an inheritance.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמָר יְיָ אֱלֹהִים בְּמָה אִידַע אֲרֵי אֵרְתִנַהּ
verses.ar_en: And he said: My Master, God, how will I know that I will inherit it?

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לֵהּ קָרֵב קֳדָמַי עֶגְלִין תְּלָתָא וְעִזִין תְּלָתָא וְדִכְרִין תְּלָת וְשַׁפְנִינָא וּבַר יוֹנָה
verses.ar_en: He said to him: Bring Me [Sacrifice before Me] three heifers, three goats and three rams, a dove, and a young pigeon.

verses.ar_he: וְקָרֵב קֳדָמוֹהִי יָת כָּל אִלֵין וּפַלִיג יָתְהוֹן בְּשָׁוֶה וִיהַב פַּלְגַיָא פִּלוּג לָקֳבֵיל חַבְרֵיהּ וְיָת עוֹפָא לָא פַּלִיג
verses.ar_en: He brought [sacrificed] all these to [before] Him; he split them in the middle [into two equal parts], and placed each piece opposite the other. The bird, however, he did not split.

verses.ar_he: וּנְחַת עוֹפָא עַל פַּגְלַיָא וְאַפְרַח יָתְהוֹן אַבְרָם
verses.ar_en: Birds of prey [vultures] descended upon the carcasses, but Avram drove them away.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה שִׁמְשָׁא לְמֵיעַל וְשִׁינְתָא נְפָלַת עַל אַבְרָם וְהָא אֵימָתָא קְבֵל סַגִי נְפָלַת עֲלוֹהִי
verses.ar_en: As the sun was setting, a deep sleep fell upon Avram; and behold, a dread of deep darkness fell upon him.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לְאַבְרָם מִדַע תִּדַע אֲרֵי דַיָרִין יְהוֹן בְּנָיךְ בְּאַרְעָא דְלָא דִילְהוֹן וְיִפְלְחוּן בְּהוֹן וִיעַנוּן יָתְהוֹן אַרְבַּע מְאָה שְׁנִין
verses.ar_en: And He [Adonoy] said to Avram: Know for sure that your descendants will be foreigners in a land that is not theirs. They will enslave them and oppress them [for] four hundred years.

verses.ar_he: וְאַף יָת עַמָא דְיִפְלְחוּן בְּהוֹן דָיִין אֲנָא וּבָתַר כֵּן יִפְקוּן בְּקִנְיָנָא סַגִי
verses.ar_en: But also that nation whom they will serve I will judge; afterwards they will leave with great wealth.

verses.ar_he: וְאַתְּ תֵעוֹל לְוָת אַבָהָתָךְ בִּשְׁלָם תִּתְקְבַר בְּסֵיבוּ טָבָא
verses.ar_en: You will join your fathers in peace; you will be buried at a good old age.

verses.ar_he: וְדָרָא רְבִיעָאָה יְתוּבוּן הָכָא אֲרֵי לָא שְׁלִים חוֹבָא דֶאֱמוֹרָאָה עַד כְּעָן
verses.ar_en: The fourth generation will return here, for the sin of the Emorites will not be complete until then [now].

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה שִׁמְשָׁא עַלַת וְקִבְלָא הֲוָה וְהָא תַּנוּר דִתְנַן וּבָעוּר דְאֶשָׁתָא דִעֲדָא בֵּין פַּלְגַיָא הָאִלֵין
verses.ar_en: The sun set and it became very dark; and behold, a smoking furnace and a flaming torch had passed between these pieces.

verses.ar_he: בְּיוֹמָא הַהוּא גְזַר יְיָ עִם אַבְרָם קְיָם לְמֵימָר לִבְנָךְ יְהָבִית יָת אַרְעָא הָדָא מִן נַהֲרָא דְמִצְרַיִם וְעַד נַהֲרָא רַבָּא נַהֲרָא פְרָת
verses.ar_en: On that day Adonoy made a covenant with Avram, saying: To your descendants I have given this land, from the river of Egypt as far as the great river, the Euphrates.

verses.ar_he: יָת שַׁלְמָאֵי וְיָת קְנִזָאֵי וְיָת קַדְמוֹנָאֵי
verses.ar_en: [The lands of] the Kenites [Shalmites], Kenizites, Kadmonites,

verses.ar_he: וְיָת חִתָּאֵי וְיָת פְּרִזָאֵי וְיָת גִבָּרָאֵי
verses.ar_en: The Chittites, Perizites, the Refa’im [the mighty ones],

verses.ar_he: וְיָת אֱמוֹרָאֵי וְיָת כְנַעֲנָאֵי וְיָת גִרְגָשָׁאֵי וְיָת יְבוּסָאֵי
verses.ar_en: The Emorites, Canaanites Girgashites and Yevusites.

verses.ar_he: וְשָׂרַי אִתַּת אַבְרָם לָא יְלִידַת לֵהּ וְלַהּ אַמְתָא מִצְרֵיתָא וּשְׁמַהּ הָגָר
verses.ar_en: Avram’s wife Sarai had not borne him children. She had an Egyptian handmaid whose name was Hagar.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַרַת שָׂרַי לְאַבְרָם הָא כְעַן מַנְעֲנִי יְיָ מִלְמֵילַד עוּל כְּעַן לְוַת אַמְתִי מָאִים אִתְבְּנֵי מִנַהּ וְקַבִּיל אַבְרָם לְמֵימַר שָׂרָי
verses.ar_en: Sarai said to Avram: See now, Adonoy has restrained me from having children; pray [now], come to my handmaid perhaps I will be built-up through her. Avram hearkened to the voice of Sarai.

verses.ar_he: וּדְבָרַת שָׂרַי אִתַּת אַבְרָם יָת הָגָר מִצְרֵיתָא אַמְתַהּ מִסוֹף עֲשַׂר שְׁנִין לְמִיתַּב אַבְרָם בְּאַרְעָא דִכְנָעַן וִיהָבַת יָתַהּ לְאַבְרָם בַּעֲלַהּ לֵהּ לְאִנְתּוּ
verses.ar_en: Sarai, the wife of Avram took Hagar the Egyptian, her handmaid, at the end of ten years that Avram had lived in the Land of Canaan and gave her to Avram her husband to be his wife.

verses.ar_he: וְעַל לְוַת הָגָר וְעַדִיאַת וַחֲזַת אֲרֵי עֲדִיאַת וּקְלַת רִבָּנְתַּהּ בְּעֵינָהַהּ
verses.ar_en: He came to Hagar and she conceived. When she realized that she was pregnant, her mistress became slighted in her eyes.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַרַת שָׂרַי לְאַבְרָם דִין לִי עֲלָךְ אֲנָא יְהָבִית אַמְתִי לָךְ וַחֲזַת אֲרֵי עֲדִיאַת וּקְלֵית בְּעֵינָהַהּ יְדִין יְיָ בֵּינִי וּבֵינָךְ
verses.ar_en: Sarai said to Avram: The insult against me is your fault [I have a judgment against you]. I gave my maid to you and when she saw that she had conceived, I became slighted in her eyes. Let Adonoy judge between me and you.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר אַבְרָם לְשָׂרַי הָא אַמְתִיךְ בִּידִךְ עִבִידִי לַהּ כִּדְתַקִין בְעֵינָיְכִי וְעֲנִיתַהּ שָׂרַי וְעָרְקַת מִקֳדָמָהַהּ
verses.ar_en: Avram said to Sarai: [The fate of] your maid is in your hands, do with her as you see fit. Sarai dealt harshly with her, and she [Hagar] ran away from her.

verses.ar_he: וְאַשְׁכְּחַהּ מַלְאָכָא דַיְיָ עַל עֵינָא דְמַיָא בְּמַדְבְּרָא עַל עֵינָא בְּאָרְחָא דְחַגְרָא
verses.ar_en: An angel of Adonoy found her by a spring of water in the desert, at the spring on the road to Shur [Chagar].

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר הָגָר אַמְתָא דְשָׂרַי מְנָן אַתְּ אָתְיָא וּלְאָן אַתְּ אָזְלָא וַאֲמַרַת מִן קֳדָם שָׂרַי רִבָּנְתִּי אֲנָא עֲרָקָא (עֲרָקַת)
verses.ar_en: And he said: Hagar, handmaid of Sarai, from where have you come and where are you going? She said: I am running away from my mistress, Sarai.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לַהּ מַלְאֲכָא דַיְיָ תּוּבִי לְוַת רִבּוֹנְתִּיךְ וְאִשְׁתַּעְבְּדִי תְּחוֹת יְדָהָא
verses.ar_en: The angel of Adonoy said to her: Return to your mistress and submit yourself to her.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לַהּ מַלְאֲכָא דַיְיָ אַסְגָאָה אַסְגֵי יָת בְּנָיְכִי וְלָא יִתִּמְנוּן מִסְגֵי
verses.ar_en: The angel of Adonoy said to her: I will greatly multiply your descendants that they can not be counted because of their great number.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לַהּ מַלְאֲכָא דַיְיָ הָא אַתְּ מְעַדְיָא וְתֵלְדִין בַּר וְתִקְרִין שְׁמֵהּ יִשְׁמָעֵאל אֲרֵי קַבִּיל יְיָ צְלוֹתִיךְ
verses.ar_en: The angel of Adonoy said to her: Behold you will conceive, and give birth to a son. You shall name him Yishmael, for Adonoy has heard [accepted] your prayer.

verses.ar_he: וְהוּא יְהֵא מָרוֹד בֶּאֱנָשָׁא הוּא יְהֵא צְרִיךְ לְכֹלָא וְאַף כָּל בְנֵי אֲנָשָׁא יְהוֹן צְרִיכִין לֵהּ וְעַל אַפֵּי כָל אֲחוֹהִי יִשְׁרֵי
verses.ar_en: He will be a wild, uncivilized man [rebel against people]. His hand [will be] against everyone [He will need everyone] and everyone’s hand will be against him [and everyone’s hand will need him]; and in the presence of all his brothers he will dwell.

verses.ar_he: וְצַלִיאַת בִּשְׁמָא דַיְיָ דְמִתְמַלֵל עִמַהּ אֲמַרַת אַתְּ הוּא אֱלָהָא דְחָזֵי כֹלָא אֲרֵי אֲמַרַת הַבְרַם הָכָא (נ''א הַאַף אֲנָא) שָּׁרֵיתִי חַזְיָא בָּתַר דְאִתְגְלִי לִי
verses.ar_en: She called [She prayed in] the Name Adonoy Who had spoken to her: [She said] You are Almighty Who sees [everything], for she said: Have I also seen here [a vestige] after my having seen? [Have I also began to see here [a vestige] after it was revealed to me?]

verses.ar_he: עַל כֵּן קְרָא לִבְאֵרָא בְּאֵרָא דְמַלְאַךְ קַיָימָא אִתַּחֲזִי עֲלַהּ הָא הִיא בֵּין רְקָם וּבֵין חַגְרָא
verses.ar_en: Therefore the well was called: Be’er Lachai Ro’i [the well at which a living angel appeared]; it is between Kadeish [Rekem] and Bared [Chagar].

verses.ar_he: וִילִידַת הָגָר לְאַבְרָם בָּר וקְרָא אַבְרָם שׁוּם בְּרֵיהּ דִילִידַת הָגָר יִשְׁמָעֵאל
verses.ar_en: Hagar bore Avram a son and Avram named his son, that Hagar bore him, Yishmael.

verses.ar_he: וְאַבְרָם בַּר תְּמָנָן וְשִׁית שְׁנִין כַּד יְלִידַת הָגָר יָת יִשְׁמָעֵאל לְאַבְרָם
verses.ar_en: Avram was eighty-six years old when Hagar bore Yishmael to Avram.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה אַבְרָם בַּר תִּשְׁעִין וּתְשַׁע שְׁנִין וְאִתְגְלִי יְיָ לְאַבְרָם וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ אֲנָא אֵל שַׁדַי פְּלַח קֳדָמַי וֶהֱוֵי שְׁלִים
verses.ar_en: When Avram was ninety-nine years old, Adonoy appeared [became revealed] to Avram and said to him: I am Almighty Shaddai, walk [worship] before Me and be perfect.

verses.ar_he: וְאֶתֵּן קְיָמִי בֵּין מֵימְרִי וּבֵינָךְ וְאַסְגֵי יָתָךְ לַחֲדָא לַחֲדָא
verses.ar_en: I will give My covenant between Me [My Word] and you, and I will multiply you[r descendants] exceedingly.

verses.ar_he: וּנְפַל אַבְרָם עַל אַפּוֹהִי וּמַלֵיל עִמֵהּ יְיָ לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: Avram fell on his face. Elohim spoke with him, saying:

verses.ar_he: אֲנָא הָא (גְזַר) קְיָמִי עִמָךְ וּתְהֵי לְאַב סַגִי עַמְמִין
verses.ar_en: As for Me, here is My covenant with you; you shall be the father of a multitude of nations.

verses.ar_he: וְלָא יִתְקְרֵי עוֹד יָת שְׁמָּךְ אַבְרָם וִיהֵי שְׁמָךְ אַבְרָהָם אֲרֵי אַב סַגִי עַמְמִין יְהָבִתָךְ
verses.ar_en: No longer shall your name be called Avram, but your name shall be Avraham, for the father of a multitude of nations I have appointed you.

verses.ar_he: וְאַפִּישׁ יָתָךְ לַחֲדָא לַחֲדָא וְאֶתְּנִנָךְ לְכִנְשִׁין וּמַלְכִין דְשַׁלִיטִין בְּעַמְמַיָא מִנָךְ יִפְקוּן
verses.ar_en: I will make you exceedingly fruitful and I will make you into nations [assemblies]; and kings [who rule over nations] will descend from you.

verses.ar_he: וַאַקֵים יָת קְיָמִי בֵּין מֵימְרִי וּבֵינָךְ וּבֵין בְּנָךְ בַּתְרָךְ לְדָרֵיהוֹן לִקְיָם עָלָם לְמֵהֲוֵי לָךְ לֵאלָהָא וְלִבְנָיךְ בַּתְרָךְ
verses.ar_en: I will sustain My covenant between Me [My Word] and you, and between your descendants after you throughout their generations as an eternal covenant, to be a God to you, and to your descendants after you.

verses.ar_he: וְאֶתֵּן לָךְ וְלִבְנָיךְ בַּתְרָךְ יָת אַרְעָא תּוֹתָבוּתָךְ יָת כָּל אַרְעָא דִכְנַעַן לְאַחֲסָנַת עָלָם וְאֱהֶוֵי לְהוֹן לֵאלָהָא
verses.ar_en: I will give to you, and to your descendants after you, the land of your temporary residence, all the land of Canaan as an eternal possession, and I will be a God to them.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ לְאַבְרָהָם וְאַתְּ יָת קְיָמִי תִטָר אַתְּ וּבְנָךְ בַּתְרָךְ לְדָרֵיהוֹן
verses.ar_en: Elohim said to Avraham: And as for you, you must preserve My covenant, you and your descendants after you throughout their generations.

verses.ar_he: דָא קְיָמִי דִי תִטְרוּן בֵּין מֵימְרִי וּבֵינֵיכוֹן וּבֵין בְּנָיךְ בַּתְרָךְ מִגְזַר לְכוֹן כָּל דְכוּרָא
verses.ar_en: This is My covenant which you must preserve between Me [My Word] and you, and your descendants after you: every male among you shall be circumcised.

verses.ar_he: וְתִגְזְרוּן יָת בִּשְׂרָא דְעָרְלָתְכוֹן וּתְהֵי (נ''י וּתְהֵא) לְאָת קְיָם בֵּין מֵימְרִי וּבֵינֵיכוֹן
verses.ar_en: You shall circumcise the flesh of your foreskin. This shall be the sign of the covenant between Me [My Word] and you.

verses.ar_he: וּבַר תְּמַנְיָא יוֹמִין יִתְגְזַר (יִגְזַר) לְכוֹן כָּל דְכוּרָא לְדָרָתֵיכוֹן יְלִידֵי בֵּיתָא וּזְבִינֵי כַּסְפָּא מִכֹּל בַּר עַמְמִין דְלָא מִבְּנָךְ הוּא
verses.ar_en: At the age of eight days every male among you must be circumcised, throughout your generations; he that is a house-born [slave] or one that was bought with money from any stranger who is not your descendant.

verses.ar_he: אִתְגַזָרָא יִתְגַזְרוּן (נ''י מִגְזַר יִגְזַר) יְלִיד בֵּיתָךְ וּזְבִין כַּסְפָּךְ וּתְהֵי קְיָמִי בְּבִשְׂרֵיכוֹן לִקְיָם עָלָם
verses.ar_en: Your house-born slaves must be circumcised, and also those bought with your money. This shall be My covenant in your flesh as an eternal covenant.

verses.ar_he: וְעָרֵל דְכוּרָא דִי לָא יִגְזַר יָת בְּשַׂר עָרְלָתֵהּ וְיִשְׁתֵּיצֵי אֱנָשָׁא הַהוּא מֵעַמֵּיהּ יָת קְיָמִי אַשְׁנִי
verses.ar_en: An uncircumcised male, who will not circumcise his foreskin, that soul [man] shall be cut off from its people; he has broken [changed] My covenant.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ לְאַבְרָהָם שָׂרַי אִתְּתָךְ לָא תִקְרֵי יָת שְׁמַהּ שָׂרָי אֲרֵי שָׂרָה שְׁמַהּ
verses.ar_en: And Elohim said to Avraham [As for] Sarai your wife, do not call her by the name Sarai, for Sarah is her name.

verses.ar_he: וֶאֱבָרֵךְ יָתַהּ וְאַף אֶתֵּן מִנַהּ לָךְ בָּר וֶאֱבָרֲכִנַהּ וּתְהֵי לְכִנְשִׁין מַלְכִין דְשַׁלִּיטִין בְעַמְמַיָּא מִנַהּ יְהוֹן
verses.ar_en: I will bless her, and I will also give you a son through her. I will bless her, and she will be [a mother] of nations [assemblies], kings of peoples [who rule over nations] will descend from her.

verses.ar_he: וּנְפַל אַבְרָהָם עַל אַפּוֹהִי וַחֲדִי וַאֲמַר בְּלִבֵּהּ הַלְּבַר מְאָה שְׁנִין יְהֵי וְלַד וְאִם שָׂרָה הֲבַת תִּשְׁעִין שְׁנִין תְּלִיד
verses.ar_en: Avraham fell on his face and laughed [rejoiced]. He said in his heart: Can a hundred year old man have children? Shall Sarah, who is ninety years old give birth?

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר אַבְרָהָם קֳדָם יְיָ לְוַי יִשְׁמָעֵאל יִתְקַיָּם קֳדָמָךְ
verses.ar_en: And Avraham said to [before] Elohim: May it be granted that Yishmael live before You.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ בְּקוּשְׁטָא שָׂרָה אִתְּתָךְ תְּלִיד לָךְ בָּר וְתִקְרֵי יָת שְׁמֵהּ יִצְחָק וַאֲקִים יָת קְיָמִי עִמֵּהּ לִקְיָם עָלָם לִבְנוֹהִי בַּתְרוֹהִי
verses.ar_en: Elohim said: Indeed, your wife Sarah will bear you a son, and you will name him Yitzchok. I will establish My covenant with him as an eternal covenant to his descendants after him.

verses.ar_he: וְעַל יִשְׁמָעֵאל קַבֵּלִית צְלוֹתָךְ הָא בָּרֵכִית יָתֵהּ וְאַפֵּישּׁ יָתֵהּ וְאַסְגֵּי יָתֵהּ לַחֲדָא לַחֲדָא תְּרֵין עֲשַׂר רַבְרְבַיָּא יְלִיד וְאֶתְּנִנֵּיהּ לְעַם סַגִּי
verses.ar_en: And as for Yishmael, I have heard you [I have accepted your prayer]. I have blessed him, and I will make him fruitful, and will increase him exceedingly. He will become the father of twelve princes, and I will make him into a great nation.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת קְיָמִי אָקִים עִם יִצְחָק דִי תְלִיד לָךְ שָׂרָה לְזִמְנָא הָדֵין בְּשַׁתָּא אָחֳרַנְתָּא
verses.ar_en: But I will establish My covenant with Yitzchok, who Sarah will bear to you at this time next year.

verses.ar_he: וְשֵׁיצֵי לְמַלָּלָא עִמֵהּ וְאִסְתַּלַּק יְקָרָא דַיְיָ מֵעִלָּווֹהִי דְּאַבְרָהָם
verses.ar_en: And when He finished speaking with him, [the Glory of] Elohim ascended from Avraham.

verses.ar_he: וּדְבַר אַבְרָהָם יָת יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרֵהּ וְיָת כָּל יְלִידֵי בֵיתֵהּ וְיָת כָּל זְבִינֵי כַסְפֵּה כָּל דְּכוּרָא בַּאֲנָשֵׁי בֵּית אַבְרָהָם וּגְזַר יָת בִּשְׂרָא דְעָרְלָתְהוֹן בִּכְרַן יוֹמָא הָדֵין כְּמָא דִי מַלֵיל עִמֵּהּ יְיָ
verses.ar_en: Avraham took his son, Yishmael, and all those that were born in his household, and all that he had bought with his money, every male member of Avraham’s household, and he circumcised the flesh of their foreskin on that very day as Elohim had said to him.

verses.ar_he: וְאַבְרָהָם בַּר תִּשְׁעִין וּתְשַׁע שְׁנִין כַּד גְזַר בִּשְׂרָא דְעָרְלְתֵהּ
verses.ar_en: Avraham was ninety-nine years old when he was circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin.

verses.ar_he: וְיִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרֵהּ בַּר תְּלַת עַשְׂרֵי שְׁנִין כַּד גְּזַר יַת בִּשְׂרָא דְעָרְלְתֵהּ
verses.ar_en: And his son Yishmael was thirteen years old when he circumcised the flesh of his foreskin.

verses.ar_he: בִּכְרַן יוֹמָא הָדֵין (גְּזַר) אִתְגְּזַר אַבְרָהָם וְיִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרֵהּ
verses.ar_en: On that very day Avraham and his son Yishmael were circumcised.

verses.ar_he: וְכָל אֱנָשֵׁי בֵיתֵהּ יְלִידֵי בֵיתָא וּזְבִינֵי כַסְפָּא מִן בַּר עַמְמִין אִתְגְּזָרוּ (גְזָרוּ) עִמֵּהּ
verses.ar_en: All the men of his household, those born in his household, and bought with money from a stranger, were circumcised with him.

verses.ar_he: וְאִתְגְּלִי לֵהּ יְיָ בְּמֵישְׁרֵי מַמְרֵא וְהוּא יָתֵב בִּתְרַע מַשְׁכְּנָא כְּמֵיחַם יוֹמָא
verses.ar_en: Adonoy appeared [became revealed] to him in the groves [plains] of Mamrei and he was sitting at the door of the tent in the heat of the day.

verses.ar_he: וּזְקַף עֵינוֹהִי וַחֲזָא וְהָא תְּלָתָא גֻּבְרִין (נ''י גַּבְרִין) קָיְמִין עִלָּווֹהִי וַחֲזָא וּרְהַט לְקַדָּמוּתְהוֹן מִתְּרַע מַשְׁכְּנָא וּסְגִיד עַל אַרְעָא
verses.ar_en: He lifted his eyes and saw, and behold three men were standing over him. He saw [them], and ran from the door of the tent to greet them, and he bowed down to the earth.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמָר יְיָ אִם כְּעַן אַשְׁכָּחִית רַחֲמִין קֳדָמָךְ (נ''י בְּעֵינָיךְ) לָא כְעַן תְּעִבַּר מֵעַל עַבְדָּךְ
verses.ar_en: He said, My Master, if I have found favor in Your eyes [before you], please [now] do not bypass your servant.

verses.ar_he: יִסְּבוּן כְּעַן זְעֵיר מַיָּא וְאַסְחוּ רַגְלֵיכוֹן וְאִסְתְּמִיכוּ תְּחוֹת אִילָנָא
verses.ar_en: Let a bit of water be brought [They will take a bit of water] and wash your feet. Rest yourselves under the tree.

verses.ar_he: וְאֶסַּב פִּתָּא דְלַחְמָא וּסְעִידוּ לִבְּכוֹן בָּתַר כֵּן תְּעִבְּרוּן אֲרֵי עַל כֵּן עֲבַרְתּוּן עַל עַבְדְּכוֹן וַאֲמָרוּ כֵּן תַּעְבֵּיד כְּמָא דִּי מַלֵּלְתָּא
verses.ar_en: I will get bread and you will sustain your heart. Afterwards you will continue on your way, since you have passed by your servant. They said, Fine, do as you have said.

verses.ar_he: וְאוֹחִי אַבְרָהָם לְמַשְׁכְּנָא לְוַת שָׂרָה וַאֲמַר אוֹחָא תְּלָת סְאִין קִמְחָא דְּסָלְתָּא לוּשִׁי וְעִבִידִי גְּרִיצָן
verses.ar_en: Avraham hurried to Sarah’s tent and said, Hurry! [take] three measures of the finest flour; knead it and make cake-rolls.

verses.ar_he: וּלְוַת תּוֹרֵי רְהַט אַבְרָהָם וּדְבַר בַּר תּוֹרֵי רַכִּיךְ וְטַב וִיהַב לְעוּלֵמָא וְאוֹחִי לְמֶעְבַּד יָתֵהּ
verses.ar_en: Avraham ran to the cattle, and took a tender, choice calf. He gave it to the lad. and hurried to prepare it.

verses.ar_he: וּנְסִיב שְׁמַן וַחֲלָב וּבַר תּוֹרֵי דִּי עֲבַד וִיהַב קֳדָמֵיהוֹן וְהוּא מְשַׁמֵּשׁ עִלָּוֵיהוֹן תְּחוֹת אִילָנָא וַאֲכָלוּ
verses.ar_en: He took butter, milk, and the calf he had prepared, and set it before them. He stood over them [served them] under the tree, and they ate.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמָרוּ לֵהּ אָן שָׂרָה אִתְּתָךְ וַאֲמַר הָא בְמַשְׁכְּנָא
verses.ar_en: They said to him, Where is Sarah, your wife? He said Here, in the tent.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר מִתַּב אִתּוּב לְוָתָךְ כְּעִדָּן דְּאַתּוּן קַיָּמִין וְהָא בַר לְשָׂרָה אִתְּתָךְ וְשָׂרָה שְמַעַת בִּתְרַע מַשְׁכְנָא וְהוּא אֲחוֹרוֹהִי
verses.ar_en: He said I will return to you next year [at this time when you will be alive], and Sarah, your wife will have a son. Sarah was listening at the door of the tent, that was behind him.

verses.ar_he: וְאַבְרָהָם וְשָׂרָה סִיבוּ עַלּוּ בְיוֹמִין פְּסַק מִלְּמֶהֱוֵי לְשָׂרָה אוֹרַח כִּנְשַׁיָּא
verses.ar_en: Avraham and Sarah were old, well on in years. Sarah no longer had the way of women.

verses.ar_he: וְחַיְכַת שָׂרָה בִּמְעָהַהּ לְמֵימָר בָּתַר דְּסֵיבִית הֲוַת לִי עוּלֵימוּ וְרִבּוֹנִי סִיב
verses.ar_en: Sarah laughed to herself saying, Now that I am worn out [old], shall I have the pleasure [of a son] [youthfulness], my master being [also] an old man.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ לְאַבְרָהָם לְמָּא דְנָן חַיְכַת שָׂרָה לְמֵימַר הַבְרַם בְּקוּשְׁטָא אוֹלִיד וַאֲנָא סֵיבִית
verses.ar_en: Adonoy said to Avraham, Why did Sarah laugh saying, Can I really give birth when I am old?

verses.ar_he: הַיִתְכַּסֵּי מִן קֳדָם יְיָ פִּתְגָּמָא לִזְמַן אִתּוּב לְוָתָךְ כְּעִדָּן דְּאַתּוּן קַיָּמִין וּלְשָׂרָה בָר
verses.ar_en: Is anything too far removed [hidden] from [before] Adonoy? At the appointed time I will return to you, at this time of life [when you will be alive], and Sarah will have a son.

verses.ar_he: וְכַדִּיבַת שָׂרָה לְמֵימָר לָא חַיֵּכִית אֲרֵי דְחֵלַת וַאֲמַר לָא בְּרַם חַיָּכְתְּ
verses.ar_en: Sarah denied it saying, I did not laugh, for she was afraid. He said, Not so, for [but] you did laugh.

verses.ar_he: וְקָמוּ מִתַּמָּן גֻּבְרַיָּא וְאִסְתְּכִיאוּ עַל אַפֵּי סְדוֹם וְאַבְרָהָם אָזַל עִמְּהוֹן לְאַלְווֹאֵיהוֹן
verses.ar_en: The men stood up from where they were, and they gazed upon Sedom. Avraham went with them to send them [escort them] [on their way].

verses.ar_he: וַיְיָ אֲמָר הַמְכַסֵּי אֲנָא מֵאַבְרָהָם דִּי אֲנָא עָבֵד
verses.ar_en: Adonoy said, Shall I conceal from Avraham what I am about to do?

verses.ar_he: וְאַבְרָהָם מֵהֲוָה יֶהֱוֵי לְעַם סַגִּי וְתַקִּיף וְיִתְבָּרְכוּן בְּדִילֵהּ כֹּל עַמְמֵי אַרְעָא
verses.ar_en: Avraham is indeed to become a great and mighty nation, and through him [and because of him] shall be blessed all the nations of the world.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי גְּלִי קֳדָמַי (גי' רמב''ן יְדַעְתִּנֵּהּ) בְּדִיל דִּי יְפַקֵּד יָת בְּנוֹהִי וְיָת אֱנַשׁ בֵּיתֵהּ בַּתְרוֹהִי וְיִטְּרוּן אָרְחָן דְּתַקְּנָן קֳדָם יְיָ לְמֶעֱבַּד צְדַקְתָּא וְדִינָא בְּדִיל אַיְיתִי יְיָ עַל אַבְרָהָם יָת דְּמַלֵּל עֲלוֹהִי
verses.ar_en: For I have given him special attention because he commands his children [For it is known to Me that he will command his children], and his household after him, and they will preserve the way of Adonoy [the ways that are good in the eyes of Adonoy], doing charity and justice, so that Adonoy will bring upon Avraham all that which He has spoken of him.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ קְבֵלַת סְדוֹם וַעֲמוֹרָה אֲרֵי סְגִיאַת וְחוֹבָתְהוֹן אֲרֵי תְקִיפַת לַחֲדָא
verses.ar_en: [Thus] Adonoy said, The wailing concerning Sedom and Amorah is so great, and their sin is so very grave.

verses.ar_he: אִתְגְּלֵי כְעַן וְאֶדּוּן הֲכִי קְבִלְתְּהוֹן דְּעַלַּת לָקֳדָמַי עֲבָדוּ אֶעְבֵּד עִמְּהוֹן גְּמִירָא אִם לָא תָיְבִין וְאִם תָּיְבִין לָא אֶתְפְּרָע
verses.ar_en: I will descend now and see [I will become revealed now and judge], if their wailing which has come to [before] Me is indicative of their conduct; destruction [shall come upon them] [I will destroy them]. If not I will know. [If they will repent, I will not punish them.]

verses.ar_he: וְאִתְפְּנִיאוּ מִתַּמָּן גֻּבְרַיָּא וַאֲזָלוּ לִסְדוֹם וְאַבְרָהָם עַד כְּעַן מְשַׁמֵּשׁ בִּצְלוֹ קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: The men turned from where they were, and went toward Sedom. Avraham was still standing [serving with prayer] before Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וּקְרֵב אַבְרָהָם וַאֲמָר הֲבִרְגַז תְּשֵׁיצֵי זַכָּאָה עִם חַיָּבָא
verses.ar_en: Avraham came forward and said, Will You [actually] destroy the righteous with the wicked [in anger]?

verses.ar_he: מָאִים אִית חַמְּשִׁין זַכָּאִין בְּגוֹ קַרְתָּא הֲבִרְגַז תְּשֵׁיצֵי וְלָא תִשְׁבּוֹק לְאַתְרָא בְּדִיל חַמְשִׁין זַכָּאִין דִּי בְגַוָּהּ
verses.ar_en: Suppose [Perhaps] there are fifty righteous people in the midst of the city, will You still destroy it [in anger], and not bear with the place for the sake of the fifty righteous people inside it?

verses.ar_he: קוּשְׁטָא אִנּוּן דִּינָךְ מִלְּמֶעְבַּד כְּפִתְגָּמָא הָדֵין לְקַטָּלָא זַכָּאָה עִם חַיָּבָא וִיהֵי זַכָּאָה כְּחַיָּבָא קוּשְׁטָא אִנּוּן דִּינָךְ דְּדָיִן כָּל אַרְעָא לָא יַעְבֵד דִּינָא
verses.ar_en: It would be sacrilege [Your judgments are true therefore it is impossible] [to attribute] to You such an act, to kill the righteous with the wicked, treating the righteous and the wicked alike. It would be sacrilege to attribute this to You [Your judgments are true]: Shall the Judge of all the earth not do justice?

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ אִם אַשְׁכַּח בִּסְדוֹם חַמְשִׁין זַכָּאִין בְּגוֹ קַרְתָּא וְאֶשְׁבּוֹק לְכָל אַתְרָא בְּדִילְהוֹן
verses.ar_en: Adonoy said; If, in Sedom, I find fifty righteous within the city, I will bear with the entire place for their sake.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲתֵב אַבְרָהָם וַאֲמַר הָא כְעַן שָׁרֵיתִי לְמַלָּלָא קֳדָם יְיָ וַאֲנָא עָפָר וּקְטָם
verses.ar_en: Avraham responded and said, Here I have begun to speak to [before] my Master, and I am but dust and ashes.

verses.ar_he: מָאִים יַחְסְרוּן חַמְשִׁין זַכָּאִין חַמְשָׁא הַתְחַבֵּל בְּחַמְשָׁא יָת כָּל קַרְתָּא וַאֲמַר לָא אֲחַבֵּל אִם אַשְׁכַּח תַּמָּן אַרְבְּעִין וְחַמְשָׁא
verses.ar_en: But suppose [perhaps] they lack five of the fifty righteous? Will You destroy all the city because of five? He said, I will not destroy if I find forty-five there.

verses.ar_he: וְאוֹסִף עוֹד לְמַלָּלָא קֳדָמוֹהִי וַאֲמַר מָאִים יִשְׁתַּכְחוּן תַּמָּן אַרְבְּעִין וַאֲמַר לָא אֶעְבְּד גְּמֵרָא בְּדִיל אַרְבְּעִין
verses.ar_en: He [Avraham] continued to speak to [before] Him and said, Suppose [Perhaps] there are forty found there? He said, I will not do it [inflict destruction] for the sake of the forty.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לָא כְעַן יִתְקֵף קֳדָם יְיָ (נ''י רוּגְזָא דַּיְיָ) וַאֲמַלֵּל מָאִים יִשְׁתַּכְּחוּן תַּמָּן תְּלָתִין וַאֲמַר לָא אֶעְבֵּד גְּמֵרָא אִם אַשְׁכַּח תַּמָּן תְּלָתִין
verses.ar_en: He said, Let not my Master show anger and I will [continue] to speak. Suppose [Perhaps] thirty are found there? He said, I will not do it [inflict destruction] if I find thirty there.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר הָא כְעַן שָׁרֵיתִי לְמַלָּלָא קֳדָם יְיָ מָאִים יִשְׁתַּכְּחוּן תַּמָּן עֶשְרִין וַאֲמַר לָא אֲחַבֵּל בְּדִיל עֶשְׁרִין
verses.ar_en: He said, Here I wished to speak to [before] my Master. Suppose [Perhaps] twenty are found there? He said, I will not destroy for the sake of the twenty.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לָא כְעַן יִתְקֵף קֳדָם יְיָ (נ''י רוּגְזָא דַּיְיָ) וֶאֱמַלֵּל בְּרַם זִמְנָא הָדָא מָאִים יִשְׁתַּכְּחוּן תַּמָּן עַשְׂרָא וַאֲמַר לָא אֲחַבֵּל בְּדִיל עַשְׂרָא
verses.ar_en: He said, Let not my Master show anger [Let there not be anger before my Master], and I will speak just once more. Suppose [Perhaps] ten are found there? He said, I will not destroy for the sake of the ten.

verses.ar_he: וְאִסְתַּלַּק יְקָרָא דַּיְיָ כַּד שֵׁצִי לְמַלָּלָא עִם אַבְרָהָם וְאַבְרָהָם תָּב לְאַתְרֵהּ
verses.ar_en: Adonoy departed [The glory of Adonoy ascended] when He finished speaking to Avraham, and Avraham returned to his place.

verses.ar_he: וְעַלּוּ תְּרֵין מַלְאָכַיָּא לִסְדוֹם בְּרַמְשָׁא וְלוֹט יָתֵב בְּתַרְעָא (נ''י בִּתְרַע) דִּסְדוֹם וַחֲזָא לוֹט וְקָם לְקַדָּמוּתְהוֹן וּסְגִיד עַל אַפּוֹהִי עַל אַרְעָא
verses.ar_en: The two angels came to Sedom in the evening, while Lot was sitting at the gate of Sedom. Lot saw them, and he got up to greet them, and he bowed with his face to the ground.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר בְּבָעוּ כְעַן רִבּוֹנַי זוּרוּ כְעַן לְבֵית עַבְדְּכוֹן וּבִיתוּ וְאַסְחוּ רַגְלֵיכוֹן וּתְקַדְּמוּן וּתְהָכוּן לְאָרְחֲכוֹן וְאֲמָרוּ לָא אֶלָּהֵן בִּרְחוֹבָא נְבִית
verses.ar_en: He said, Behold [Please] now my lords, please [now] turn in to your servant’s house. Stay over night, bathe your feet, and get up early and continue on your way. They said, No, we will spend the night in the street.

verses.ar_he: וְאַתְקַף בְּהוֹן לַחֲדָא וְזָרוּ לְוָתֵהּ וְעַלּוּ לְבֵיתֵהּ וַעֲבַד לְהוֹן מִשְׁתְּיָא וּפַטִּיר אֲפָא לְהוֹן וְאֲכָלוּ
verses.ar_en: He urged them greatly, and they turned in to him and came to his house. He made a feast for them, and baked matzos [for them], and they ate.

verses.ar_he: עַד לָא שְׁכִיבוּ וְאֲנָשֵׁי קַרְתָּא אֲנָשֵׁי סְדוֹם אַקִּיפוּ עַל בֵּיתָא מֵעוּלֵימָא וְעַד סָבָא כָּל עַמָּא מִסּוֹפֵהּ
verses.ar_en: They had not yet lain down when the men of the city, the men of Sedom, surrounded the house—young and old alike—all the people from one end [of the city] to the other end.

verses.ar_he: וּקְרוֹ לְלוֹט וַאֲמָרוּ לֵהּ אָן גֻּבְרַיָא דִּי אֲתוֹ לְוָתָךְ לֵילְיָא אַפֵּקִנּוּן לְוָתָנָא וְנִדַּע יָתְהוֹן
verses.ar_en: They called to Lot and said to him, Where are the men who came to you tonight? Bring them out to us that we may know them.

verses.ar_he: וּנְפַק לְוָתְהוֹן לוֹט לְתַרְעָא וְדָשָׁא אֲחַד בַּתְרוֹהִי
verses.ar_en: Lot went out to them in front of the entrance, shutting the door behind him.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר בְּבָעוּ כְעַן אַחַי לָא תַבְאִישוּן
verses.ar_en: He said, My brothers, please [now] do not act wickedly.

verses.ar_he: הָא כְעַן לִי תַּרְתֵּין בְּנָן דִּי לָא יְדָעִנּוּן גְּבַר אַפֵּק כְּעַן יַתְהוֹן לְוָתְכוֹן וְעִיבִידוּ לְהֵן כִּדְתַקֵּן בְּעֵינֵיכוֹן לְחוֹד לְגֻבְרַיָּא הָאִלֵּין לָא תַעְבְּדוּן מִדַּעַם אֲרֵי עַל כֵּן עַלּוּ בִּטְלַל שֵׁרוּתִי
verses.ar_en: Behold! I have two daughters who have never known a man, I will bring them out to you, and do with them as you please; only do nothing to these men, since after all, they came under the shelter of my roof.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמָרוּ קְרֵב לְהַלָּא וַאֲמָרוּ חַד אֲתָא לְאִתּוֹתָבָא והָא דָיִין דִּינָא כְּעַן נַבְאֵשׁ לָךְ מִדִּילְהוֹן וּתְקִיפוּ בְגַבְרָא בְלוֹט לַחֲדָא וּקְרִיבוּ לְמִתְּבַר דָּשָׁא
verses.ar_en: They said, Step back out of the way! They said, This one came as an immigrant, and now he wants to be a judge. We will now deal worse with you than with them. They pushed hard against Lot, and came near to break the door.

verses.ar_he: וְאוֹשִׁיטוּ גֻּבְרַיָּא יָת יְדֵיהוֹן וְאַיְתִיאוּ יָת לוֹט לְוָתְהוֹן לְבֵיתָא וְיָת דָּשָׁא אֲחָדוּ
verses.ar_en: The men put out their hands, and pulled Lot to them, into the house, and closed the door.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת גֻּבְרַיָּא דִּי בִתְרַע בֵּיתָא מְחוֹ בְּשַׁבְרִירַיָּא מִזְּעֵירָא וְעַד רַבָּא וּלְאִיוּ לְאַשְׁכָּחָא תַרְעָא
verses.ar_en: The men who were at the entrance of the house, they struck with blindness—young and old alike—so that they wearied themselves trying to find the entrance.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמָרוּ גֻּבְרַיָּא לְלוֹט עוֹד מָן לָךְ הָכָא חַתְנָא וּבְנָךְ וּבְנָתָךְ וְכֹל דִּי לָךְ בְּקַרְתָּא אַפֵּיק מִן אַתְרָא
verses.ar_en: The men said to Lot, Who else do you have here—a son-in-law, your sons, your daughters? Whoever you have in the city, bring them out of his place.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי מְחַבְּלִין אֲנַחְנָא יָת אַתְרָא הָדֵין אֲרֵי סְגִיאַת קְבִלְתְּהוֹן קֳדָם יְיָ וְשַׁלְּחָנָא יְיָ לְחַבָּלוּתַהּ
verses.ar_en: We are going to destroy this place, for the wailing concerning them has become great in the presence of Adonoy; and Adonoy has sent us to destroy it.

verses.ar_he: וּנְפַק לוֹט וּמַלֵּיל עִם חַתְנוֹהִי נָסְבֵי בְנָתֵהּ וְאֲמַר קוּמוּ פּוּקוּ מִן אַתְרָא הָדֵין אֲרֵי מְחַבֵּל יְיָ יָת קַרְתָּא וַהֲוָה כִּמְחָיִךְ בְּעֵינֵי חַתְנוֹהִי
verses.ar_en: Lot went out and spoke to his sons-in-law who had married his daughters. He said [to them], Get up! Get out of this place, for Adonoy is going to destroy the city! He appeared as a comedian in the eyes of his sons-in-law.

verses.ar_he: וּכְמִסַּק צַפְרָא הֲוָה וּדְחִיקוּ מַלְאָכַיָּא בְּלוֹט לְמֵימָר קוּם דְּבַר יָת אִתְּתָךְ וְיָת תַּרְתֵּין בְּנָתָךְ דְּאִשְׁתְּכַחַן מְהֵימְנָא עִמָּךְ דִּילְמָא תִלְקֵי בְּחוֹבֵי קַרְתָּא
verses.ar_en: At the break of dawn, the angels urged Lot on, saying, Get up! Take your wife and your two daughters who are here [who are found to be faithful to you], lest you be swept away in the iniquity of the city.

verses.ar_he: וְאִתְעַכַּב וְאַתְקִיפוּ גֻּבְרַיָּא בִּידֵהּ וּבִידָא דְּאִתְּתֵהּ וּבִידָא דְתַּרְתֵּין בְּנָתֵהּ כִּרְחַם (נ''י כַּד חָס) יְיָ עֲלוֹהִי וְאַפְּקוּהִי וְאַשְׁרוּהי מִבָּרָא לְקַרְתָּא
verses.ar_en: He hesitated, and the men grabbed his hand and the hand of his wife and two daughters, for Adonoy had pity on him. They brought him out and placed him outside the city.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה כַּד אַפִּיקוּ יָתְהוֹן לְבָרָא וַאֲמַר חוּס עַל נַפְשָׁךְ לָא תִּסְתְּכִי לַאֲחוֹרָךְ וְלָא תְקוּם בְּכָל מֵישְׁרָא לְטוּרָא אִשְׁתְּזֵב דִּלְמָא תִלְקֵי
verses.ar_en: When they were brought out [of the city], he [the angel] said, Escape [Have pity] for your life! Do not look back! Do not remain anywhere in the valley [plain]. Escape to the mountain, lest you be swept away.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לוֹט לְהוֹן בְּבָעוּ כְעַן רִבּוֹנָי (נ''י יְיָ)
verses.ar_en: Lot said to them, Please, not so my Master. [Please, now, my Master.]

verses.ar_he: הָא כְעַן אַשְׁכַּח עַבְדָךְ רַחֲמִין קֳדָמָךְ וְאַסְגֵּיתָא טֵיבוּתָךְ דִּי עֲבַדְתָּ עִמִּי לְקַיָּמָא יָת נַפְשִׁי וַאֲנָא לֵית אֲנָא יָכִיל לְאִשְׁתֵּזָבָא לְטּוּרָא דִּילְמָא תְעַרְעִנַּנִי בִשְׁתָּא וְאֵימוּת
verses.ar_en: Behold your servant has found favor in Your eyes [before You]. Great is your kindness [goodness] that you have done with me, to keep me alive. I cannot escape to the mountain, lest the evil attach itself to me and I die.

verses.ar_he: הָא כְעַן קַרְתָּא הָדָא קְרִיבָא לְמֵעִירוֹק לְתַמָּן וְהִיא זְעֵירָא אִשְׁתְּזֵב כְּעַן תַּמָּן הֲלָא זְעֵירָא הִיא וְתִתְקַיַּם נַפְשִׁי
verses.ar_en: Behold, please, this city is near [enough] to flee there. It is insignificant. Let me escape there! It is insignificant, and my life will be saved.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לֵהּ הָא נְסֵיבִית אַפָּךְ אַף לְפִתְגָּמָא הָדֵין בְּדִיל דְּלָא לְמֵהְפַּךְ יָת קַרְתָּא דִּבְעִיתָא עֲלַהּ
verses.ar_en: He said to him, See I have also given you consideration regarding this. I will not overturn the city that you mentioned [for which you have beseeched].

verses.ar_he: אוֹחִי לְאִשְׁתֵּזֵב תַּמָּן אֲרֵי לָא אִכּוּל לְמֶעְבַּד פִּתְגָּמָא עַד מֵיתָךְ לְתַמָּן עַל כֵּן קְרָא שְׁמָא דְּקַרְתָּא צוֹעַר
verses.ar_en: Hurry, escape there, for I can do nothing until you get there. The city was therefore called Zoar.

verses.ar_he: שִׁמְשָׁא נְפַק עַל אַרְעָא וְלוֹט עַל לְצוֹעַר
verses.ar_en: The sun had risen upon the earth, when Lot came to Zoar.

verses.ar_he: וַיְיָ אַמְטַר עַל סְדוֹם וְעַל עֲמוֹרָה גָּפְרֵיתָא וְאֶשָּׁתָא מִן קֳדָם יְיָ מִן שְׁמַיָּא
verses.ar_en: Adonoy caused to rain upon Sedom and Amorah—sulfur and fire—from [before] Adonoy, from heaven.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲפַךְ יָת קִרְוַיָּא הָאִלֵּין וְיָת כָּל מֵישְׁרָא וְיָת כָּל יָתְבֵי קִרְוַיָּא וְצִמְחָא דְּאַרְעָא
verses.ar_en: He overturned these cities, and the entire plain, and all those who lived in the cities and all that grew upon the ground.

verses.ar_he: וְאִסְתְּכִיאַת אִתְּתֵהּ מִבַּתְרוֹהִי וַהֲוַת קָמָא דְּמִלְחָא
verses.ar_en: His [Lot’s] wife looked behind him; and she became a pillar of salt.

verses.ar_he: וְאַקְדֵּים אַבְרָהָם בְּצַפְרָא לְאַתְרָא דִּשַׁמֵשׁ תַּמָּן בִּצְלוֹ קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: Avraham got up early in morning [to return] to the place where he had stood before the Presence of Adonoy [to the place where he had served in prayer before Adonoy].

verses.ar_he: וְאִסְתְּכִי עַל אַפֵּי סְדוֹם וַעֲמוֹרָה וְעַל כָּל אַפֵּי אַרְעָא דְּמֵישְׁרָא וַחֲזָא וְהָא סְלִיק תְּנָנָא דְּאַרְעָא כִּתְנָנָא דְּאַתּוּנָא
verses.ar_en: He [Avraham] stared at Sedom and Amorah, and the whole land of the plain, and he saw the heavy smoke rising from the earth like the smoke of a furnace.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה בְּחַבָּלוּת (נ''י כַּד חֲבַל) יְיָ יָת קִרְוֵי מֵישְׁרָא וּדְכִיר יְיָ יָת אַבְרָהָם וְשַׁלַּח יָת לוֹט מִגּוֹ הֲפֶכְתָּא כַּד הֲפַךְ יָת קִרְוַיָּא דִּי הֲוָה יָתֵב בְּהֵן לוֹט
verses.ar_en: When Elohim destroyed the cities of the plain; Elohim remembered Avraham, and He sent Lot out of the upheaval when He overturned the cities in which Lot had lived.

verses.ar_he: וּסְלֵק לוֹט מִצּוֹעַר וִיתֵב בְּטוּרָא וְתַרְתֵּין בְּנָתֵהּ עִמֵּהּ אֲרֵי דָּחִיל לְמִתַּב בְּצוֹעַר וִיתֵב בִּמְעַרְתָּא הוּא וְתַרְתֵּין בְּנָתֵהּ
verses.ar_en: Lot went up from Zoar and lived in the mountain; and his two daughters went with him, for he was afraid to live in Zoar. He lived in a cave, he and his two daughters.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמֶרֶת רַבְּתָא לִזְעֶרְתָּא אֲבוּנָא סִיב וּגְבַר לֵית בְּאַרְעָא לְמֵיעַל עֲלָנָא כְּאוֹרַח כָּל אַרְעָא
verses.ar_en: The older girl said to the younger, Our father is old, and there is no man [left] on earth who will come into us in the normal manner.

verses.ar_he: אִיתָא נַשְׁקֵי יָת אֲבוּנָא חַמְרָא וְנִשְׁכּוּב עִמֵּהּ וּנְקַיֵּם מֵאֲבוּנָא בְּנִין
verses.ar_en: Come let us urge our father to drink wine, and sleep with him; that we may give life to seed [children] from our father.

verses.ar_he: וְאַשְׁקִיאָה יָת אֲבוּהֶן חַמְרָא בְּלֵילְיָא הוּא וְעַלַּת רַבְּתָא וּשְׁכִיבָא עִם אֲבוּהָא וְלָא יְדַע בְּמִשְׁכְּבַהּ וּבְקִימַהּ
verses.ar_en: They urged wine upon their father that night; and the older girl went in and slept with her father. He was not aware that she lay down or got up.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה בְּיוֹמָא דְבַתְרוֹהִי וַאֲמֶרֶת רַבְּתָא לִזְעֶרְתָּא הָא שְׁכֵיבִית רַמְשָׁא עִם אַבָּא נַשְׁקִנֵּהּ חַמְרָא אַף בְּלֵילְיָא וְעוּלִי שְׁכִיבִי עִמֵּהּ וּנְקַיֵּם מֵאֲבוּנָא בְּנִין
verses.ar_en: The next day, the older girl said to the younger, Last night I slept with my father. Let us urge wine upon him tonight also, and you go in and sleep with him that we may give life to seed from our father.

verses.ar_he: וְאַשְׁקִיאָה אַף בְּלֵילְיָא הַהוּא יָת אֲבוּהֶן חַמְרָא וְקָמַת זְעֶרְתָּא וּשְׁכִיבַת עִמֵּהּ וְלָא יְדַע בְּמִשְׁכְּבַהּ וּבְקִימַהּ
verses.ar_en: That night also, they urged their father [to drink] wine. The younger went up and slept with him, and he was not aware that she lay down or got up.

verses.ar_he: וְעַדִּיאַן תַּרְתֵּין בְּנַת לוֹט מֵאֲבוּהֶן
verses.ar_en: Lot’s two daughters became pregnant from their father.

verses.ar_he: וִילִידַת רַבְּתָא בַּר וּקְרַת שְׁמֵהּ מוֹאָב הוּא אֲבוּהוֹן דְמוֹאָבָא עַד יוֹמָא דֵין
verses.ar_en: The older girl gave birth to a son and she named him Moav. He is the ancestor of the Moabite nation even to this day.

verses.ar_he: וּזְעֶרְתָּא אַף הִיא יְלִידַת בַּר וּקְרַת שְׁמֵהּ בַּר עַמִּי הוּא אֲבוּהוֹן דִּבְנֵי עַמּוֹן עַד יוֹמָא דֵין
verses.ar_en: The younger girl also gave birth to a son, and she named him Ben-Ami. He is the ancestor of the people of Ammon even to this day.

verses.ar_he: וּנְטַל מִתַּמָּן אַבְרָהָם לְאַרְעָא דָּרוֹמָא וִיתֵב בֵּין רְקָם וּבֵין חַגְרָא וְאִתּוֹתַב בִּגְרָר
verses.ar_en: Avraham journeyed from there to the land of the Negev [south], and he lived between Kadeish [Rekem] and Shur [Chagar]. He lived for a while in Gerar.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר אַבְרָהָם עַל שָׂרָה אִתְּתֵהּ אֲחָתִי הִיא וּשְׁלַח אֲבִימֶלֶךְ מַלְכָּא דִּגְרָר וּדְבַר יָת שָׂרָה
verses.ar_en: Avraham said regarding Sarah, his wife, She is my sister. Avimelech, king of Gerar sent [messengers] and took Sarah.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲתָא מֵימַר מִן קָדָם יְיָ לְוַת אֲבִימֶלֶךְ בְּחֶלְמָא דְלֵילְיָא וַאֲמַר לֵהּ הָא אַתְּ מִית עַל עֵיסַק אִתְּתָא דִּדְבַרְתָּא וְהִיא אִתַּת גְּבָר
verses.ar_en: Elohim came to Avimelech [Word came from before Elohim to Avimelech] in a dream at night, and said to him, Behold, you shall die because of the woman you took, for she is a married woman [a man’s wife].

verses.ar_he: וַאֲבִימֶלֶךְ לָא קְרֵב לְוָתַהּ וַאֲמַר יְיָ הָעָם אַף זַכַּאי תִּקְטוֹל
verses.ar_en: Avimelech had not come near to her. He said, My Master, will You also kill an innocent nation?

verses.ar_he: הֲלָא הוּא אֲמַר לִי אֲחָתִי הִיא וְהִיא אַף הִיא אֲמָרַת אָחִי הוּא בְּקַשִּׁיטוּת לִבִּי וּבְזַכָּאוּת יָדַי עֲבָדִית דָּא
verses.ar_en: Did he not say to me, She is my sister? And she also said, He is my brother. With an innocent [upright] heart and clean [righteous] hands I did this.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לֵהּ מֵימַר מִן קֳדָם יְיָ בְּחֶלְמָא אַף קֳדָמַי גְּלִי אֲרֵי בְּקַשִּׁיטוּת לִבָּךְ עֲבַדְתָּ דָּא וּמְנָעִית אַף אֲנָא יָתָךְ מִלְּמֶחְטֵי קֳדָמָי עַל כֵּן לָא שְׁבָקְתָּךְ לְמִקְרַב לְוָתַהּ
verses.ar_en: Elohim said to him [Word from Elohim was said to him] in a dream, I also know [it is also revealed before me] that you did this with an innocent [upright] heart. I also prevented you from sinning against [before] Me. That is why I did not give you the chance to touch her.

verses.ar_he: וּכְעַן אֲתֵיב אִתַּת גַּבְרָא אֲרֵי נְבִיָּא הוּא וִיצַלֵּי עֲלָךְ וּתְחֵי וְאִם לֵיתָךְ מֵתֵיב דַּע אֲרֵי מֵימַת תְּמוּת אַתְּ וְכָל דִּי לָךְ
verses.ar_en: Now return the man’s wife, for he is a prophet. He will pray for you and you will live. If you do not return her, you should know that you will surely die—you and all that is yours.

verses.ar_he: וְאַקְדֵּים אֲבִימֶלֶךְ בְּצַפְרָא וּקְרָא לְכָל עַבְדּוֹהִי וּמַלִּיל יַת כָּל פִּתְגָּמַיָּא הָאִלֵּין קֳדָמֵיהוֹן וּדְחִילוּ גּוּבְרַיָּא לַחֲדָא
verses.ar_en: Avimelech got up early in the morning, and called all his servants. He spoke all these words in their ears [before them], and the men were very frightened.

verses.ar_he: וּקְרָא אֲבִימֶלֶךְ לְאַבְרָהָם וַאֲמַר לֵהּ מָה עֲבַדְתָּ לָנָא וּמָה חָבִית (נ''י חָטֵית) לָךְ אֲרֵי אַיְתֵיתָא עֲלַי וְעַל מַלְכוּתִי חוֹבָא רַבָּא עוֹבָדִין דִּי לָא כָשְׁרִין לְאִתְעֲבָדָא עֲבַדְתָּ עִמִּי
verses.ar_en: Avimelech called Avraham and said to him, What have you done to us? What wrong did I do to you that you brought on me and upon my kingdom such a great sin? Deeds that ought not to be done, you have done to me.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר אֲבִימֶלֶךְ לְאַבְרָהָם מָה חָזֵיתָ אֲרֵי עֲבַדְתָּ יָת פִתְגָּמָא הָדֵין
verses.ar_en: Avimelech [then] said to Avraham, What did you see that you did such a thing?

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר אַבְרָהָם אֲרֵי אֲמָרִית לְחוֹד לֵית דַּחַלְתָּא דַּיְיָ בְּאַתְרָא הָדֵין וְיִקְטְלֻנַּנִי עַל עֵיסַק אִתְּתִי
verses.ar_en: Avraham said, Because I said [thought] there is no fear of Elohim in this place, and they will kill me [in order] to take my wife.

verses.ar_he: וּבְרַם בְּקוּשְׁטָא אֲחָתִי בַּת אַבָּא הִיא בְּרַם לָא בַת אִמִּי וַהֲוַת לִי לְאִנְתּוּ
verses.ar_en: In any case, she is my sister, the daughter of my father, but not the daughter of my mother, and she became my wife.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה כַּד טָעוּ עַמְמַיָּא בָּתַר עוֹבָדֵי יְדֵיהוֹן יָתִי קָרִיב יְיָ לְדַחַלְתֵּהּ מִבֵּית אַבָּא וַאֲמָרִית לַהּ דֵּין (נ''י דָּא) טֵיבוּתִיךְ דִּי תַעְבְּדִי עִמִּי לְכָל אַתְרָא דִּי נְהַךְ לְתַמָּן אֱמָרִי עֲלַי אָחִי הוּא
verses.ar_en: When Elohim caused me to wander from my father’s house [When the nations strayed after the works of their hands, Elohim brought me close to His worship from my father’s house], I said to her, this is the kindness [goodness] you shall do for me. At every place we come [go] to, say of me, He is my brother.

verses.ar_he: וּדְבַר אֲבִימֶלֶךְ עָאן וְתוֹרִין וְעַבְדִין וְאַמְהָן וִיהַב לְאַבְרָהָם וַאֲתֵיב לֵהּ יָת שָׂרָה אִתְּתֵהּ
verses.ar_en: Avimelech took sheep, cattle, male and female slaves, and he gave them to Avraham. He [also] returned his wife Sarah to him.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר אֲבִימֶלֶךְ הָא אַרְעִי קֳדָמָךְ בִּדְתַקִּין בְּעֵינָיךְ תִּיב
verses.ar_en: Avimelech said, Behold, my land is before you. Live wherever you see fit.

verses.ar_he: וּלְשָׂרָה אֲמַר הָא יְהָבִית אֶלֶף סַלְעִין דִּכְסַף לְאָחִיךְ הָא הוּא לִיךְ כְּסוּת דִּיקָר עַיְנִין חֳלַף דִּשְׁלָחִית וּדְּבַרְתִּיךְ וַחֲזֵית יָתִיךְ וְיָת כָּל דְּעִמָּךְ וְעַל כָּל מָה דַּאֲמָרַת אִתּוֹכָחַת
verses.ar_en: To Sarah, he said, Behold I have given to your brother a thousand pieces [shekalim] of silver. It will be for you a [compensational] eye covering for all who are with you, that you may face every one. [It will be for you a garment of honor, in return for my having sent for you, and taken you, and seeing you and all that is with you. And regarding everything that you said, you were just.]

verses.ar_he: וְצַלִּי אַבְרָהָם קֳדָם יְיָ וְאַסִּי יְיָ יָת אֲבִימֶלֶךְ וְיָת אִתְּתֵהּ וְאַמְהָתֵהּ וְאִתְרְוָחוּ
verses.ar_en: Avraham prayed to [before] Elohim, and Elohim healed Avimelech, his wife, and his female slaves, and they gave birth [and they were relieved].

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי מֵיחַד אֲחַד יְיָ בְּאַפֵּי כָל פָּתַח וַלְדָא לְבֵית אֲבִימֶלֶךְ עַל עֵיסַק שָׂרָה אִתַּת אַבְרָהָם
verses.ar_en: For Adonoy had restrained every womb in the house of Avimelech according to the word of Sarah, Avraham’s wife.

verses.ar_he: וַיְיָ דְּכִיר יָת שָׂרָה כְּמָא דִּי אֲמַר וַעֲבַד יְיָ לְשָׂרָה כְּמָא דִּי מַלִּיל
verses.ar_en: Adonoy remembered Sarah as He had said, and Adonoy did for Sarah as He had spoken.

verses.ar_he: וְעַדִּיאַת וִילִידַת שָׂרָה לְאַבְרָהָם בַּר לְסִיבְתוֹהִי לִזְמַן דִּי מַלִּיל יָתֵהּ יְיָ
verses.ar_en: She conceived and Sarah gave birth to Avraham’s son in his old age, at the designated time that Elohim had declared.

verses.ar_he: וּקְרָא אַבְרָהָם יָת שׁוּם בְּרֵהּ דְאִתְיְלִיד לֵהּ דִּילִידַת לֵהּ שָׂרָה יִצְחָק
verses.ar_en: Avraham named his son that was born to him, to which Sarah had borne to him, Yitzchok.

verses.ar_he: וּגְזַר אַבְרָהָם יָת יִצְחָק בְּרֵהּ בַּר תְּמַנְיָא יוֹמִין כְּמָא דִּי פַקִּיד יָתֵהּ יְיָ
verses.ar_en: Avraham circumcised his son, Yitzchok, when he was eight days old, as Elohim had commanded him.

verses.ar_he: וְאַבְרָהָם בַּר מְאָה שְׁנִין כַּד אִתְיְלִיד לֵהּ יָת יִצְחָק בְּרֵהּ
verses.ar_en: Avraham was one hundred years old when his son Yitzchok was born to him.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמֶרֶת שָׂרָה חֶדְוָא עֲבַד לִי יְיָ כָּל דִּשְׁמַע יֶחֱדֵּי לִי
verses.ar_en: Sarah said, Elohim has given me laughter [gladness]. All who hear will laugh [rejoice] with me.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמֶרֶת מָאן מְהֵימָן דַּאֲמַר לְאַבְרָהָם קַיָּם דְּתוֹנִיק בְּנִין שָׂרָה אֲרֵי יְלֵידִית בַּר לְסִיבְתוֹהִי
verses.ar_en: She said, Who said to Avraham [Who is faithful that he said to Avraham and fulfills His promise], that Sarah would nurse children? For I have given birth to a son in his old age.

verses.ar_he: וּרְבָא רַבְיָא וְאִתְחֲסִיל וַעֲבַד אַבְרָהָם מִשְׁתְּיָא רַבָּא בְּיוֹמָא דְּאִתְחֲסִיל יָת יִצְחָק
verses.ar_en: The child grew and was weaned. Avraham made a great feast on the day Yitzchok was weaned.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲזַת שָׂרָה יָת בַּר הָגָר מִצְרֵיתָא דִּילִידַת לְאַבְרָהָם מְחָיִיךְ
verses.ar_en: Sarah saw that the son of Hagar, the Egyptian, that she had born to Avraham, was mocking.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמֶרֶת לְאַבְרָהָם תָּרֵךְ אַמְתָא הָדָא וְיָת בְּרַהּ אֲרֵי לָא יֵרַת בַּר אַמְתָא הָדָא עִם בְּרִי עִם יִצְחָק
verses.ar_en: She said to Avraham, Drive out this slave-woman and her son, for the son of this slave-woman will not inherit with my son, with Yitzchok.

verses.ar_he: וּבְאֵישׁ פִּתְגָּמָא לַחֲדָא בְּעֵינֵי אַבְרָהָם עַל עֵיסַק בְּרֵהּ
verses.ar_en: This thing was very wrong in the eyes of Avraham, on account of his son.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ לְאַבְרָהָם לָא יַבְאֵשׁ בְּעֵינָיךְ עַל עוּלֵימָא וְעַל אַמְתָךְ כֹּל דִּי תֵימַר לָךְ שָׂרָה קַבֵּל מִנַּהּ אֲרֵי בְיִצְחָק יִתְקְרוּן לָךְ בְּנִין
verses.ar_en: Elohim said to Avraham, Do not consider this wrong in your eyes on account of the boy and your slave-woman. Regarding all that Sarah tells you, listen to her voice [accept from her], for [only] through Yitzchok will seed be considered yours.

verses.ar_he: וְאַף יָת בַּר אַמְתָא לְעַם אֲשַׁוִּנֵּהּ אֲרֵי בְנָךְ הוּא
verses.ar_en: [But] also the son of the slave-woman I will make into a nation, for he is [of] your seed.

verses.ar_he: וְאַקְדֵּים אַבְרָהָם בְּצַפְרָא וּנְסִיב לַחֲמָא וְרָקְבָּא דְמַיָּא וִיהַב לְהָּגָר שַׁוֵי עַל כַּתְפַּהּ וְיָת רַבְיָא וְשַׁלְחַהּ וַאֲזָלַת וְתָעַת בְּמַדְבְּרָא (נ''א בְּמַדְבֵּר) בְּאֵר שָׁבַע
verses.ar_en: Avraham got up early in the morning. He took bread and a skin [pouch] of water, and gave it to Hagar. He placed it on her shoulder with the lad, and sent her away. She went and lost her way in the desert of Beer Sheva.

verses.ar_he: וּשְׁלִימוּ מַיָּא מִן רָקְבָּא וּרְמַת יָת רַבְיָא תְּחוֹת חַד מִן אִילָנַיָּא
verses.ar_en: The water in the skin was used up, and she threw the lad under one of the bushes.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲזָלַת וִיתִיבַת לַהּ מִקֳּבֵל אַרְחֵיקַת (נ''י אַרְחִיק) כְּמֵיגַד קַשְׁתָּא אֲרֵי אֲמֶרֶת לָא אֶחֱזֵי בְּמוֹתָא דְרַבְיָא וִיתִיבַת מִקֳּבֵל וַאֲרֵימַת יָת קָלַהּ וּבְכָת
verses.ar_en: She went and sat facing him, about [the distance] of bow-shots away. She said, Let me not see the lad die. She sat facing him and wept in a loud voice.

verses.ar_he: וּשְׁמִיעַ קֳדָם יְיָ יָת קָלֵהּ דְּרַבְיָא וּקְרָא מַלְאֲכָא דַּיְיָ לְהָגָר מִן שְׁמַיָּא וַאֲמַר לַהּ מָה לָיךְ הָגָר לָא תִדְחֲלִי אֲרֵי שְׁמִיעַ קֳדָם יְיָ יָת קָלֵהּ דְּרַבְיָא בַּאֲתַר דְּהוּא תַמָּן
verses.ar_en: Elohim heard the voice of the lad [was heard before Elohim]. An angel of God called to Hagar from heaven and said to her, What is the matter, Hagar? Do not fear. Elohim has heard the voice of the lad [has been heard before Elohim] in the place where he is.

verses.ar_he: קוּמִי טוּלִי יָת רַבְיָא וְאַתְקִיפִי יָת יְדֵךְ בֵּהּ אֲרֵי לְעַם סַגִּי אֲשַׁוִּנֵּהּ
verses.ar_en: Get up and lift up the lad. Keep your hand strong on him, for I will make him a great nation.

verses.ar_he: וּגְלָא יְיָ יָת עֵינָהַהּ וַחֲזַת בֵּירָא דְמַיָּא וַאֲזָלַת וּמְלַת יָת רָקְבָּא מַיָּא וְאַשְׁקִיאַת יָת רַבְיָא
verses.ar_en: Elohim opened [uncovered] her eyes, and she saw a well of water. She went and filled the skin with water, and gave the lad to drink.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה מֵימְרָא דַּיְיָ בְּסַעְדֵהּ דְּרַבְיָא וּרְבָא וִיתֵב בְּמַדְבְּרָא וַהֲוָה רָבֵי קַשְׁתָּא
verses.ar_en: Elohim was with the lad [The Word of Elohim supported the lad] and he grew up. He settled in the wilderness, [where] he became an expert archer.

verses.ar_he: וִיתֵב בְּמַדְבְּרָא דְפָארָן וּנְסִיבַת לֵהּ אִמֵּהּ אִתְּתָא מֵאַרְעָא דְמִצְרָיִם
verses.ar_en: He lived in the desert of Paran, and his mother took a wife for him from the land of Egypt.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה בְּעִדָּנָא הַהִיא וַאֲמַר אֲבִימֶלֶךְ וּפִיכֹל רַב חֵילֵהּ לְאַבְרָהָם לְמֵימָר מֵימְרָא דַּיְיָ בְּסַעְדָּךְ בְּכֹל דִּי אַתְּ עָבֵד
verses.ar_en: It was at this time, Avimelech and Pichol, his general spoke to Avraham, saying, Elohim is with you in all that you do [the Word of Elohim is your support in all that you do].

verses.ar_he: וּכְעַן קַיֵּם לִי בְּמֵימְרָא דַּיְיָ הָכָא דְּלָא תְשַׁקַּר בִּי וּבִבְרִי וּבְבַר בְּרִי כְּטִיבוֹתָא דִּי עֲבָדִית עִמָּךְ תַּעְבֵּד עִמִּי וְעִם אַרְעָא דְאִתּוֹתַבְתָּא בַהּ
verses.ar_en: Now, swear to me here, by [the Word of] Elohim, that you will not deal falsely with me, with my son, or my grandson. The kindness [goodness] that I have done to you, do to me and to the land in which you lived for a while.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר אַבְרָהָם אֲנָא אֲקַיֵּם
verses.ar_en: Avraham said, I will swear.

verses.ar_he: וְאוֹכַח אַבְרָהָם יָת אֲבִימֶלֶךְ עַל עֵיסַק בֵּירָא דְמַיָּא דִּי אֲנִּיסוּ עַבְדֵי אֲבִימֶלֶךְ
verses.ar_en: Avraham then reprimanded Avimelech regarding the well of water that Avimelech’s servants had taken by force.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר אֲבִימֶלֶךְ לָא יְדָעִית מָאן עֲבַד יָת פִּתְגָּמָא הָדֵין וְאַף אַתְּ לָא חַוֵּיתָ לִּי וְאַף אֲנָא לָא שְׁמָעִית אֱלָּהֵין יוֹמָא דֵין
verses.ar_en: Avimelech said, I do not know who did this thing. You also never told me, and I also heard nothing of it until today.

verses.ar_he: וּדְבַר אַבְרָהָם עָאן וְתוֹרִין וִיהַב לַאֲבִימֶלֶךְ וּגְזָרוּ תַרְוֵיהוֹן קְיָם
verses.ar_en: Avraham took sheep and cattle and gave them to Avimelech. The two of them made a covenant.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲקִים אַבְרָהָם יָת שְׁבַע חוּרְפַן דְּעָאן בִּלְחוֹדֵיהֶן
verses.ar_en: Avraham set seven ewes apart by themselves.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר אֲבִימֶלֶךְ לְאַבְרָהָם מָה אִנּוּן שְׁבַע חוּרְפַן אִלֵּין דַּאֲקֵמְתָּא בִּלְחוֹדֵיהֶן
verses.ar_en: Avimelech said to Avraham. What is the reason for these seven ewes that you have set apart?

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר אֲרֵי יָת שְׁבַע חוּרְפַן תְּקַבֵּל מִן יְדִי בְּדִיל דִּתְהֵי לִי לְסַהֲדוּ אֲרֵי חֲפָרִית יָת בֵּירָא הָדָא
verses.ar_en: He [Avraham] said, Take these seven ewes from my hand so that it will be proof for me, that I dug this well.

verses.ar_he: עַל כֵּן קְרָא לְאַתְרָא הַהוּא בְּאֵר שָׁבַע אֲרֵי תַמָּן קַיָּמוּ תַּרְוֵיהוֹן
verses.ar_en: Therefore he called that place Beer Sheva, since the two had made an oath there.

verses.ar_he: וּגְזָרוּ קְיָם בִּבְאֵר שָׁבַע וְקָם אֲבִימֶלֶךְ וּפִיכֹל רַב חֵילֵהּ וְתָבוּ לְאַרַע פְּלִשְׁתָּאֵי
verses.ar_en: They made a covenant in Beer Sheva. Avimelech, and Pichol, his general, then rose and returned to the land of the Philistines.

verses.ar_he: וּנְצִיב נִצְבָּא (נ''י אִילָנָא) בִּבְאֵר שָׁבַע וְצַלִּי תַמָּן בִּשְׁמָא דַּיְיָ אֱלָהָא דְעַלְמָא
verses.ar_en: Avraham planted an eishel [tree] in Beer Sheva, and there he proclaimed [and there he prayed in] the Name Adonoy, Almighty of the universe.

verses.ar_he: וְאִתּוֹתָב אַבְרָהָם בְּאַרַע פְּלִשְׁתָּאֵי יוֹמִין סַגִּיאִין
verses.ar_en: Avraham lived in the land of the Philistines for many days.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה בָּתַר פִּתְגָּמַיָּא הָאִלֵּין וַיְיָ נַסִּי יָת אַבְרָהָם וַאֲמַר לֵהּ אַבְרָהָם וַאֲמַר הָא אֲנָא
verses.ar_en: After these events, Elohim tested Avraham and said to him, Avraham! and he [Avraham] said, Here I am.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר דְּבַר כְּעַן יָת בְּרָךְ יָת יְחִידָךְ דִּי רְחַמְתָּ יָת יִצְחָק וְאִיזֵל לָךְ לְאַרְעָא פּוּלְחָנָא וְאַסְקֵהּ קֳדָמַי תַּמָּן לַעֲלָתָא עַל חַד מִן טוּרַיָּא דִּי אֵימַר לָךְ
verses.ar_en: He said, Please [Now] take your son, your only one, who you love—Yitzchok—and go to the land of Moriah [worship]. Sacrifice him [before me] as a burnt-offering on one of the mountains which I will designate to you.

verses.ar_he: וְאַקְדֵּים אַבְרָהָם בְּצַפְרָא וְזָרֵז יָת חֲמָרֵהּ וּדְבַר יָת תְּרֵין עוּלֵימוֹהִי עִמֵּהּ וְיָת יִצְחָק בְּרֵהּ וְצַלַּח אָעֵי לַעֲלָתָא וְקָם וַאֲזַל לְאַתְרָא דִּי אֲמַר לֵהּ יְיָ
verses.ar_en: Avraham awoke early in the morning, saddled his donkey, and took his two assistants with him, and also his son, Yitzchok. He split the wood of the burnt-offering, rose, and went to the place that Elohim had designated to him.

verses.ar_he: בְּיוֹמָא תְלִיתָאָה וּזְקַף אַבְרָהָם יָת עֵינוֹהִי וַחֲזָא יָת אַתְרָא מֵרָחִיק
verses.ar_en: On the third day, Avraham raised his eyes and saw the place from afar.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר אַבְרָהָם לְעוּלֵימוֹהִי אוֹרִיכוּ לְכוֹן הָכָא עִם חֲמָרָא וַאֲנָא וְעוּלֵימָא נִתְמְטֵי עַד כָּא וְנִסְגּוּד וּנְתוּב לְוַתְכוֹן
verses.ar_en: Avraham said to his assistants, Remain here with the donkey and I and the lad will go to that place. We will prostrate ourselves [in worship] and return to you.

verses.ar_he: וּנְסֵיב אַבְרָהָם יָת אָעֵי דַּעֲלָתָא וְשַׁוִּי עַל יִצְחָק בְּרֵהּ וּנְסֵיב בִּידֵהּ יָת אֶשָּׁתָא וְיָת סַכִּינָא וַאֲזָלוּ תַרְוֵיהוֹן כַּחֲדָא
verses.ar_en: Avraham took the wood of the burnt-offering and placed it on his son Yitzchok. In his hand he took the fire and the knife, and they both went together.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יִצְחָק לְאַבְרָהָם אֲבוּהִי וַאֲמַר אַבָּא וַאֲמַר הָא אֲנָא בְרִי וַאֲמַר הָא אֶשָּׁתָא וְאָעַיָּא וְאָן אִימְרָא לַעֲלָתָא
verses.ar_en: Yitzchok spoke to Avraham, his father, and said, Father, and he [Avraham] said, Here I am, my son. He said, Here are the fire and the wood, but where is the lamb for the burnt-offering?

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר אַבְרָהָם קֳדָם יְיָ גְּלֵי לֵהּ אִימְרָא לַעֲלָתָא בְּרִי וַאֲזָלוּ תַרְוֵיהוֹן כַּחֲדָא
verses.ar_en: Avraham said, Elohim will show the lamb [the lamb is revealed before Elohim] for a burnt-offering, my son. And the two of them went together.

verses.ar_he: וְאָתוּ לְאַתְרָא דִּי אֲמַר לֵהּ יְיָ וּבְנָא תַמָּן אַבְרָהָם יָת מַדְבְּחָא וְסַדַּר יָת אָעַיָּא וַעֲקַד יָת יִצְחָק בְּרֵהּ וְשַׁוֵּי יָתֵהּ עַל מַדְבְּחָא עֵיל מִן אָעַיָּא
verses.ar_en: They came to the place that Elohim had designated to him. Avraham built the altar there, and arranged the wood. He bound his son Yitzchok, and placed him on the altar, on top of the wood.

verses.ar_he: וְאוֹשִׁיט אַבְרָהָם יָת יְדֵהּ וּנְסֵיב יָת סַכִּינָא לְמֵיכַס יַת בְּרֵהּ
verses.ar_en: Avraham extended his hand and took the knife to slaughter his son.

verses.ar_he: וּקְרָא לֵהּ מַלְאָכָא דַּיְיָ מִן שְׁמַיָּא וַאֲמַר אַבְרָהָם אַבְרָהָם וַאֲמַר הָא אֲנָא
verses.ar_en: An angel of Adonoy called to him from heaven and said, Avraham, Avraham! and he said, Here I am.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לָא תוֹשִׁיט יְדָךְ לְעוּלֵימָא וְלָא תַעְבֵּד לֵהּ מִדָּעָם אֲרֵי כְּעַן יְדַעְנָא (נ''י יְדָעִית) אֲרֵי דַּחֲלָא דַּיְיָ אַתְּ וְלָא מְנַעְתָּ יָת בְּרָךְ יָת יְחִידָךְ מִנִּי
verses.ar_en: He [God] said, Do not touch the lad, nor do anything to [harm] him; for now I know that you are one who fears Elohim and have not withheld your son, your only one, from Me.

verses.ar_he: וּזְקַף אַבְרָהָם יָת עֵינוֹהִי בָּתַר אִלֵּין וַחֲזָא וְהָא דִּכְרָא בָּתַר אֲחִיד בְּאִילָנָא בְּקַרְנוֹהִי וַאֲזַל אַבְרָהָם וּנְסֵיב יָת דִּכְרָא וְאַסְקֵהּ לַעֲלָתָא חֲלַף בְּרֵהּ
verses.ar_en: Avraham looked up [afterwards] and beheld a ram after it had been caught in the thicket by its horns. Avraham went and took the ram and sacrificed it as a burnt-offering instead of his son.

verses.ar_he: וּפְלַח וְצַלִּי אַבְרָהָם תַּמָּן בְּאַתְרָא הַהוּא וַאֲמַר קֳדָם יְיָ הָכָא יְהוֹן פַּלְחַן דָּרַיָּא בְּכֵן יִתְאֲמַר בְּיוֹמָא הָדֵין בְּטוּרָא הָדֵין אַבְרָהָם קֳדָם יְיָ פְּלָח
verses.ar_en: Avraham called the name of that place, Adonoy will see; as it is said [to] this day, On Adonoy’s mountain, He will be seen. [Avraham worshiped and prayed there in that place, and he said before Adonoy, “Here will generations worship”. Therefore, as it is said [to] this day, “On this mountain Avraham worshiped before Adonoy”.]

verses.ar_he: וּקְרָא מַלְאָכָא דַּיְיָ לְאַבְרָהָם תִּנְיָנוּת מִן שְׁמַיָּא
verses.ar_en: An angel of Adonoy called to Avraham, a second time, from heaven.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר בְּמֵימְרִי קַיֵּמִית אֲמַר יְיָ אֲרֵי חֲלַף דִּי עֲבַדְתָּא יָת פִּתְגָּמָא הָדֵין וְלָא מְנַעְתָּא יָת בְּרָךְ יָת יְחִידָךְ
verses.ar_en: And said, I have sworn by Myself [My Word], declares Adonoy, that because you performed this deed, and did not withhold your only son.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי בָרָכָא אֲבָרְכִנָּךְ וְאַסְגָּאָה אַסְגֵּי יָת בְּנָיךְ כְּכוֹכְבֵי שְׁמַיָּא וּכְחָלָא דִּי עַל כֵּיף יַמָּא וְיִרְתוּן בְּנָיךְ יָת קִרְוֵי סַנְאֵיהוֹן
verses.ar_en: I will greatly bless you and make your descendants as numerous as the stars of the sky and like the sand on the seashore. Your descendants will inherit the gate [cities] of their enemies.

verses.ar_he: וְיִתְבָּרְכוּן בְּדִיל בְּנָיךְ כֹּל עַמְמַיָּא דְאַרְעָא חֲלַף דִּי קַבֵּלְתָּא לְמֵימְרִי
verses.ar_en: Through [Because of] your children, will be blessed all the nations of the world, because you heeded My voice [Word].

verses.ar_he: וְתַב אַבְרָהָם לְוָת עוּלֵימוֹהִי וְקָמוּ וַאֲזָלוּ כַחֲדָא לִבְאֵר שָׁבַע וִיתֵיב אַבְרָהָם בִּבְאֵר שָׁבַע
verses.ar_en: Avraham returned to his assistants, and they rose and went together to Beer Sheva. Avraham dwelt in Beer Sheva.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה בָּתַר פִּתְגָּמַיָּא הָאִלֵּין וְאִתְחֲוָא לְאַבְרָהָם לְמֵימָר הָא יְלֵידַת מִלְכָּה אַף הִיא בְּנִין לְנָחוֹר אָחוּךְ
verses.ar_en: After these words, it was told to Avraham, saying, Behold, Milkah has also born children to Nachor, your brother.

verses.ar_he: יָת עוּץ בּוּכְרֵהּ וְיָת בּוּז אָחוּהִי וְיָת קְמוּאֵל אֲבוּהִי דַּאֲרָם
verses.ar_en: Utz, his first born, Buz his brother, and Kemueil, the father of Aram.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת כֶּשֶׂד וְיָת חֲזוֹ וְיָת פִּלְדָּשׁ וְיָת יִדְלָף ויָת בְּתוּאֵל
verses.ar_en: [Also] Kesed, Chazo, Pildash, Yidlaf and Besueil.

verses.ar_he: וּבְתוּאֵל אוֹלִיד יָת רִבְקָה תְּמַנְיָא אִלֵּין יְלֵידַת מִלְכָּה לְנָחוֹר אֲחוּהִי דְאַבְרָהָם
verses.ar_en: Besueil fathered Rivkah. These eight, Milkah bore to Nachor, the brother of Avraham.

verses.ar_he: וּלְחֵנָתֵהּ וּשְׁמַהּ רְאוּמָה וִילֵידַת אַף הִיא יָת טֶבַח וְיָת גַּחַם וְיָת תַּחַשׁ וְיָת מַעֲכָה
verses.ar_en: His concubine was named Re’umah. She also gave birth to Tevach, Gacham, Tachash and Ma’achoh.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲווֹ חַיֵּי שָׂרָה מְאָה וְעֶשְׂרִין וּשְׁבַע שְׁנִין שְׁנֵי חַיֵּי שָׂרָה
verses.ar_en: The lifetime of Sarah consisted of one hundred years, twenty years and seven years. [These were] the years of Sarah’s life.

verses.ar_he: וּמִיתַת שָׂרָה בְּקִרְיַת אַרְבַּע הִיא חֶבְרוֹן בְּאַרְעָא דִּכְנָעַן וַאֲתָא אַבְרָהָם לְמִסְפְּדָה לְשָׂרָה וּלְמִבְכַּהּ
verses.ar_en: Sarah died in Kiryas Arba, which is Chevron, in the land of Canaan. Avraham came to eulogize Sarah and to weep for her.

verses.ar_he: וְקָם אַבְרָהָם מֵעַל אַפֵּי מִיתֵהּ וּמַלֵּל עִם בְּנֵי חִתָּאָה לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: Avraham rose from the presence of his dead, and spoke to the sons of Cheis saying,

verses.ar_he: דַּיָּר וְתוֹתַב אֲנָא עִמְּכוֹן הָבוּ לִי אַחֲסָנַת קְבוּרָא עִמְּכוֹן וְאִקְבַּר מִיתִי מִן קֳדָמָי
verses.ar_en: I am a foreigner and a resident among you. Grant me the possession of a grave site with you, so that I may bury my dead from my presence.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲתִיבוּ בְנֵי חִתָּאָה יָת אַבְרָהָם לְמֵימָר לֵהּ
verses.ar_en: The sons of Cheis replied to Avraham saying to him,

verses.ar_he: קַבֵּל מִנָּנָא רִבּוֹנָנָא רַב קֳדָם יְיָ אַתְּ בֵּינָנָא בִּשְׁפַר קִבְרָנָא קְבַר יָת מִיתָךְ אֱנַשׁ מִנָּנָא יָת קִבְרֵהּ לָא יִמְנַע מִנָּךְ מִלְמִקְבַּר מִיתָךְ
verses.ar_en: Hear [Accept] us my [our] master, you are a prince of God [you are respected before God] in our midst. Bury your dead in the choicest of our grave sites. No man among us will deny his grave site from you to bury your dead.

verses.ar_he: וְקָם אַבְרָהָם וּסְגִיד לְעַמָּא דְאַרְעָא לִבְנֵי חִתָּאָה
verses.ar_en: Avraham rose and bowed to the people of the land, the sons of Cheis.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלֵּל עִמְּהוֹן לְמֵימָר אִם אִית רַעֲוָא בְנַפְשְׁכוֹן לְמִקְבַּר יָת מִיתִי מִן קֳדָמַי קַבִּילוּ מִנִּי וּבְעוּ לִי מִן עֶפְרוֹן בַּר צוֹחַר
verses.ar_en: Avraham spoke to them, saying, If it is really your will [the will of your soul] that I bury my dead from my presence, listen to [accept] me and intercede for me with Ephron, son of Tzochar.

verses.ar_he: וְיִתֶּן לִי יָת מְעָרַת כָּפֶלְתָּא דִּי לֵהּ דִּי בִּסְטַר חַקְלֵהּ בְּכַסְפָּא שְׁלִים יִתְּנִינַהּ לִי בֵּינֵיכוֹן לְאַחֲסָנַת קְבוּרָא
verses.ar_en: Let him give me the Machpeilah [double] cave, which belongs to him, which is at the end of his field. Let him give [sell] it to me for its full value, as a grave site among you.

verses.ar_he: וְעֶפְרוֹן יָתֵב בְּגוֹ בְּנֵי חִתָּאָה וְאָתֵיב עֶפְרוֹן חִתָּאָה יָת אַבְרָהָם קֳדָם בְּנֵי חִתָּאָה לְכֹל עָלֵי תְּרַע קַרְתֵּהּ לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: Ephron lived in the midst of the sons of Cheis, Ephron the Chitite replied to Avraham in the ears [audience] of [before] the sons of Cheis, for all who came to the city gate, saying,

verses.ar_he: לָא רִבּוֹנִי קַבֵּיל מִנִּי חַקְלָא יְהָבִית לָךְ וּמְעַרְתָּא דִּי בֵהּ לָךְ יְהָבִיתַהּ לְעֵינֵי בְנֵי עַמִּי יְהָבִיתַהּ לָךְ קְבַר מִיתָךְ
verses.ar_en: No, my master, hear [accept] me: I have given you the field, and the cave that is in it, I have [also] given to you. Before the eyes of the sons of my people I have given it to you. Bury your dead.

verses.ar_he: וּסְגִיד אַבְרָהָם קֳדָם עַמָּא דְאַרְעָא
verses.ar_en: Avraham bowed to the people of the land.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלֵּיל עִם עֶפְרוֹן קֳדָם עַמָּא דְאַרְעָא לְמֵימָר בְּרַם אִם אַתְּ עָבֵד לִי טִיבוּ קַבֵּל מִנִּי אֶתֵּן כַּסְפָּא דְמֵי חַקְלָא סַב מִנִּי וְאֶקְבַּר יָת מִיתִי תַּמָּן
verses.ar_en: He spoke to Ephron in the ears [audience] of [before] the people of the land saying, If you will only listen to me. [If you will do a kindness for me, accept me.] I have given the money for the [value of the] field. Take it from me and I will bury my dead there.

verses.ar_he: וְאָתֵיב עֶפְרוֹן יָת אַבְרָהָם לְמֵימָר לֵהּ
verses.ar_en: Ephron replied to Avraham, saying to him,

verses.ar_he: רִבּוֹנִי קַבֵּל מִנִּי אַרְעָא שַׁוְיָא אַרְבַּע מְאָה סִלְעִין דִּכְסַף בֵּינָא וּבֵינָךְ מַה הִיא וְיָת מִיתָךְ קְבַר
verses.ar_en: My master, hear [accept] me. A land [worth] four hundred silver shekel—what is that between me and you? Bury your dead.

verses.ar_he: וְקַבֵּל אַבְרָהָם מִן עֶפְרוֹן וּתְקַל אַבְרָהָם לְעֶפְרוֹן יָת כַּסְפָּא דְּמַלֵּיל קֳדָם בְּנֵי חִתָּאָה אַרְבַּע מְאָה סִלְעִין דִּכְסַף מִתְקַבֵּל סְחוֹרָא (נ''י דְּמִתְקַבֵּל סְחוֹרָתָא) בְּכָל מְדִינְתָּא
verses.ar_en: Avraham listened to [accepted] Ephron, and Avraham weighed out for Ephron the silver that he spoke of in the hearing of [before] the sons of Cheis, four hundred silver shekel, negotiable currency [which are accepted by merchants in every city].

verses.ar_he: וְקָם חֲקַל עֶפְרוֹן דִּי בְּכָפֶלְתָּא דִּי קֳדָם מַמְרֵא חַקְלָא וּמְעַרְתָּא דִּי בֵהּ וְכָל אִילָנֵי דִּי בְחַקְלָא דִּי בְכָל תְּחוּמֵהּ סְחוֹר סְחוֹר
verses.ar_en: The field of Ephron was established [as Avraham’s possession], [the field] which was in Machpeilah, facing Mamrei; [this included] the field, the cave that was in it, and all the trees that were in the field that were in the entire circumference of its boundaries.
