verses.ar_he: לְאַבְרָהָם לִזְבִינוֹהִי לְעֵינֵי בְּנֵי חִתָּאָה בְּכֹל עָלֵי תְּרַע קַרְתֵּהּ
verses.ar_en: This became Avraham’s [possession] through a purchase before the eyes of the sons of Cheis, all who had come to the gate of his city.

verses.ar_he: וּבָתַר כֵּן קְבַר אַבְרָהָם יָת שָׂרָה אִתְּתֵהּ בִּמְעָרַת חֲקַל כָּפֶלְתָּא עַל אַפֵּי מַמְרֵא הִיא חֶבְרוֹן בְּאַרְעָא דִּכְנָעַן
verses.ar_en: After that Avraham buried his wife Sarah in the cave of the Machpeilah field, which faces Mamrei, which is Chevron, in the land of Canaan.

verses.ar_he: וְקָם חַקְלָא וּמְעַרְתָּא דִּי בֵהּ לְאַבְרָהָם לְאַחֲסָנַת קְבוּרָא מִן בְּנֵי חִתָּאָה
verses.ar_en: The field and its cave was established as Avraham’s possession as a gravesite, by the sons of Cheis.

verses.ar_he: וְאַבְרָהָם סִיב עָל בְּיוֹמִין וַיְיָ בְּרִיךְ יָת אַבְרָהָם בְּכֹלָא
verses.ar_en: Avraham was old, advanced in days [years], and Adonoy had blessed Avraham in all things.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר אַבְרָהָם לְעַבְדֵהּ סָבָא דְבֵיתֵהּ דְּשַׁלִּיט בְּכָל דִי לֵהּ שַׁוִּי כְעַן יְדָךְ תְּחוֹת יַרְכִּי
verses.ar_en: Avraham said to his servant, the senior [servant] of his household, who was in charge of all that he owned, Place your hand under my thigh.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲקַיֵּם עֲלָךְ בְּמֵימְרָא דַּיְיָ אֱלָהָא דִּשְׁמַיָּא וֵאלָהָא דְאַרְעָא דְּלָא תִסַּב אִתְּתָא לִבְרִי מִבְּנַת כְּנַעֲנָאֵי דִּי אֲנָא יָתֵב בֵּינֵיהוֹן
verses.ar_en: I will have you swear by [the Word of] Adonoy, God of heaven and God of earth, that you will not take a wife for my son from the daughters of the Canaanites, among whom I live.

verses.ar_he: אֱלָהֵין לְאַרְעִי וּלְיַלָּדוּתִי תֵּיזִיל וְתִסַּב אִתְּתָא לִבְרִי לְיִצְחָק
verses.ar_en: Instead, to my [native] land, to my birthplace, shall you go, and take a wife for my son, for Yitzchok,

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לֵהּ עַבְדָא מָאִים לָא תֵיבֵי אִתְּתָא לְמֵיתֵי בַתְרַי לְאַרְעָא הָדָא הַאֲתָבָא אָתֵיב יָת בְּרָךְ לְאַרְעָא דִּי נְפַקְתָּא מִתַּמָּן
verses.ar_en: The servant said to him, Perhaps the woman will not want to come back with me to this land? Shall I bring your son back to the land from where you came?

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לֵהּ אַבְרָהָם אִסְתַּמַּר לָךְ דִּילְמָא תָתֵיב יָת בְּרִי לְתַמָּן
verses.ar_en: Avraham said to him, Take care, not to bring my son back there.

verses.ar_he: יְיָ אֱלָהָא דִּשְׁמַיָּא דִּי דַּבְּרַנִי מִבֵּית אַבָּא וּמֵאֲרַע יַלְדוּתִי וְדִי מַלֵּל לִי וְדִי קַיֵּם לִי לְמֵימַר לִבְרָךְ אֶתֵּן יָת אַרְעָא הָדָא הוּא יִשְׁלַח מַלְאָכֵהּ קֳדָמָךְ וְתִסַּב אִתְּתָא לִבְרִי מִתַּמָּן
verses.ar_en: Adonoy, God of heaven, Who took me from my father’s house, and from the land of my birth, Who spoke to me, and Who swore to me, saying, To your descendants I will give this land—He will send His angel before you, and you shall take a wife for my son from there.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם לָא תֵיבֵי אִתְּתָא לְמֵיתֵי בַתְרָךְ וּתְהֵי זַכָּאָה מִמּוֹמָתִי דָּא לְחוֹד יָת בְּרִי לָא תָתֵב לְתַמָּן
verses.ar_en: If the woman does not want to come back with you, you are absolved from this oath to me. But do not bring my son back there.

verses.ar_he: וְשַׁוִּי עַבְדָא יָת יְדֵהּ תְּחוֹת יַרְכָא דְאַבְרָהָם רִבּוֹנֵהּ וְקַיֵּם לֵהּ עַל פִּתְגָּמָא הָדֵין
verses.ar_en: The servant placed his hand under the thigh of Avraham, his master, and swore to him regarding this matter.

verses.ar_he: וּדְבַר עַבְדָא עַשְׂרָא גַּמְלִין מִגַּמְלֵי רִבּוֹנֵהּ וַאֲזַל וְכָל שְׁפַר רִבּוֹנֵהּ בִּידֵהּ וְקָם וַאֲזַל לַאֲרָם דִּי עַל פְּרַת לְקַרְתָּא דְנָחוֹר
verses.ar_en: The servant took ten camels from his master’s camels and departed, and all the property of his master was in his hand. He rose and went to Aram Naharayim [which is next to the river P’ras]; to the city of Nachor.

verses.ar_he: וְאַשְׁרֵי גַּמְלַיָּא מִבָּרָא לְקַרְתָּא לִבְאֵרָא דְמַיָּא לְעִדַּן רַמְשָׁא לְעִדַּן דְּנַפְקַן מַלְיָתָא
verses.ar_en: He made the camels kneel [rest] outside the city, beside a well of water, in the evening, at the time the women go out to draw water.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ אֱלָהֵהּ דְּרִבּוֹנִי אַבְרָהָם זַמִּין כְּעַן קֳדָמַי יוֹמָא דֵּין וְעִבַד טִיבוּ עִם רִבּוֹנִי אַבְרָהָם
verses.ar_en: He said, Adonoy, God of my master, Avraham, be present before me today, and act kindly [do goodness] with my master, Avraham.

verses.ar_he: הָא אֲנָא קָאֵם עַל עֵינָא דְמַיָּא וּבְנַת אֱנָשֵׁי קַרְתָּא נַפְקַן לְמִמְלֵי מַיָּא
verses.ar_en: Behold, here I stand by this well of water, and the daughters of the townsmen are coming out to draw water.

verses.ar_he: וּתְהֵי עוּלֶמְתָּא דְּאֵימַר לַהּ אַרְכִינִי כְעַן קוּלְתִיךְ וְאֶשְׁתִּי וְתֵימַר אֵשְׁתְּ וְאַף גַּמְלָךְ אַשְׁקֵי יָתַהּ זַמִּנְתָּא לְעבְדָּךְ לְיִצְחָק וּבַהּ אִידַע אֲרֵי עֲבַדְתָּ טִיבוּ עִם רִבּוֹנִי
verses.ar_en: Let it be that the girl to whom I say, Please [Now], tip over your pitcher that I may drink and she will say Drink, and I will also give your camels to drink, will be the one whom You have determined for your servant, Yitzchok. With her I will know that You have dealt kindly [with goodness] with my master.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה הוּא עַד לָא שֵׁיצֵי לְמַלָּלָא וְהָא רִבְקָה נְפָקַת דְּאִתְיְלִידַת לִבְתוּאֵל בַּר מִלְכָּה אִתַּת נָחוֹר אֲחוּהִי דְאַבְרָהָם וְקוּלְתַהּ עַל כַּתְפַּהּ
verses.ar_en: He had not yet finished speaking, and behold Rivkah came out. She had been born to Besu’eil, the son of Milkah, the wife of Nachor, Avraham’s brother. Her pitcher was on her shoulder.

verses.ar_he: וְעוּלֶמְתָּא שַׁפִּירַת חֵיזוּ (נ''י שַׁפִּירָא לְמֶחֱזֵי) לַחֲדָא בְּתֻלְתָּא וּגְבַר לָא יַדְעָהּ וּנְחָתַת לְעֵינָא וּמְלַת קוּלְתַהּ וּסְלֵקָת
verses.ar_en: The girl was very good looking—a virgin—no man had known her. She went down to the well, filled her pitcher, and came up.

verses.ar_he: וּרְהַט עַבְדָּא לִקְדָמוּתַהּ וַאֲמַר אַשְׁקִינִי (נ''י אַטְעֵמְנִי) כְעַן זְעֵיר מַיָּא מִקּוּלְתִיךְ
verses.ar_en: The servant ran toward her and said, Please [Now] let me sip a little water from your pitcher.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמֶרֶת אֵשְׁתְּ רִבּוֹנִי וְאוֹחִיאַת וַאֲחֵיתַת קוּלְתַהּ עַל יְדַהּ וְאַשְׁקְתֵהּ
verses.ar_en: She said, Drink, my master, and she quickly lowered her pitcher to her hand, and let him drink.

verses.ar_he: וְשֵׁיצִיאַת לְאַשְׁקָיוּתֵהּ וַאֲמֶרֶת אַף לְגַמְלָךְ אַמְלֵי עַד דִּי סַפְקוּן לְמִשְׁתֵּי
verses.ar_en: When she had finished giving him to drink, she said, I will also draw water for your camels, until they will have finished drinking [had enough to drink].

verses.ar_he: וְאוֹחִיאַת וּנְפָצַת קוּלְתַהּ לְבֵית שַׁקְיָא וּרְהָטַת עוֹד לְבֵירָא לְמִמְלֵי וּמְלַת לְכָל גַּמְלוֹהִי
verses.ar_en: She quickly emptied her pitcher into the trough and she ran to the well again to draw water. and she drew water for all his camels.

verses.ar_he: וְגַבְרָא שָׁהֵי בַהּ מִסְתַּכֵּל שָׁתִיק לְמֵידַע הַאַצְלַח יְיָ אָרְחֵהּ אִם לָא
verses.ar_en: The man, wondering at her, remained silent, waiting to determine [The man waited and observed silently to determine] whether Adonoy had made his mission successful, or not.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה כַּד סַפִּיקוּ גַּמְלַיָּא לְמִשְׁתֵּי וּנְסֵיב גַּבְרָא קָדָשָׁא דְדַהֲבָא תִּקְלָא מַתְקְלֵהּ וּתְרֵין שֵׁירִין עַל יְדָהָא מַתְקַל עֲשַׂר סִלְעִין דְּדַהֲבָא מַתְקַלְהוֹן
verses.ar_en: When the camels had finished drinking [had enough to drink], the man took a gold nose ring, weighing half a shekel, and two bracelets for her arms, weighing ten gold shekel.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר בַּת מָן אַתְּ חַוִּי כְעַן לִי הַאִית בֵּית אָבוּךְ אָתַר כָּשַׁר לָנָא לִמְבָת
verses.ar_en: He said to her, Whose daughter are you? Please [Now] tell me. Is there [a fitting] place in your father’s house for us to spend the night.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמֶרֶת לֵהּ בַּת בְּתוּאֵל אֲנָא בַּר מִלְכָּה דִּילֵידַת לְנָחוֹר
verses.ar_en: She said to him, I am the daughter of Besueil, the son of Milkah, whom she bore to Nachor.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמֶרֶת לֵהּ אַף תִּבְנָא אַף כִּסָּתָא סַגִּי עִמָּנָא אַף אָתַר כָּשַׁר לִמְבָת
verses.ar_en: She said to him, We have plenty of straw and fodder, and also a [fitting] place to spend the night.

verses.ar_he: וּכְרַע גַּבְרָא וּסְגִיד קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: The man bowed [his head] and prostrated himself to [before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר בְּרִיךְ יְיָ אֱלָהָא דְרִבּוֹנִי אַבְרָהָם דִּי לָא מְנַע טִיבוּתֵהּ וְקוּשְׁטֵהּ מִן רִבּוֹנִי אֲנָא בְּאוֹרַח תַּקְנָא דַּבְּרַנִּי יְיָ בֵּית אֲחוֹהִי דְרִבּוֹנִי
verses.ar_en: He said, Blessed is Adonoy, God of my master, Avraham, Who has not abandoned His kindness [goodness] and truth [in dealing] with my master. I am still on the [straight] road and Adonoy has led me to the house of my master’s brethren.

verses.ar_he: וּרְהָטַת עוּלֶמְתָּא וְחַוִּיאַת לְבֵית אִמַּהּ כְּפִתְגָּמַיָּא הָאִלֵּין
verses.ar_en: The girl ran and told her mother’s household of these these happenings.

verses.ar_he: וּלְרִבְקָה אָחָא וּשְׁמֵהּ לָבָן וּרְהַט לָבָן לְוַת גַּבְרָא לְבָרָא לְוַת עֵינָא
verses.ar_en: Rivkah had a brother whose name was Lavan, and Lavan ran outside to the man [standing] at the well.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה כַּד חָזָא יָת קָדָשָׁא וְיָת שֵׁירַיָּא עַל יְדֵי אֲחָתֵהּ וְכַד שְׁמַע יָת פִּתְגָּמֵי רִבְקָה אֲחָתֵהּ לְמֵימַר כְּדֵין מַלֵּיל עִמִּי גַּבְרָא וַאֲתָא לְוַת גַּבְרָא וְהָא קָאֵם עִלַּוֵּי גַּמְלַיָּא עַל עֵינָא
verses.ar_en: When he had seen the nose ring and the bracelets on the hands of his sister, and heard the words of his sister, Rivkah saying, this is what the man spoke to me, that he [then] came to the man, who was still standing beside the camels at the well.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר עוּל בְּרִיכָא דַּיְיָ לְמָא אַתְּ קָאֵם בְּבָרָא וַאֲנָא פַּנֵּיתִי בֵיתָא וַאֲתַר כָּשַׁר לְגַמְלַיָּא
verses.ar_en: He [Lavan] said, Come, you who are blessed of Adonoy, why are you standing outside? I have emptied the house and [prepared] a [fitting] place for the camels.

verses.ar_he: וְעַל גַּבְרָא לְבֵיתָא וּשְׁרָא גַּמְלַיָּא וִיהַב תִּבְנָא וְכִסָּתָא לְגַמְלַיָּא וּמַיָּא לְאַסְחָאָה רַגְלוֹהִי וְרַגְלֵי גֻּבְרַיָּא דְּעִמֵּהּ
verses.ar_en: The man came into the house and unmuzzled the camels. [Lavan] gave the camels straw and fodder, and water to wash his [the man’s] feet and the feet of the men who were with him.

verses.ar_he: וְשַׁוִּיאוּ קֳדָמוֹהִי לְמֵיכָל וַאֲמַר לָא אֵיכוּל עַד דַּאֲמַלֵּל פִּתְגָּמָי וַאֲמַר מַלֵּיל
verses.ar_en: Food was set before him, but he said, I will not eat until I have spoken my words. He replied, Speak.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר עַבְדָּא דְאַבְרָהָם אֲנָא
verses.ar_en: He said, I am the servant of Avraham.

verses.ar_he: וַיְיָ בְּרִיךְ יָת רִבּוֹנִי לַחֲדָא וּרְבָא וִיהַב לֵהּ עָאן וְתוֹרִין וּכְסַף וּדְהַב וְעַבְדִּין וְאַמְהָן וְגַמְלִין וְחַמָרִין
verses.ar_en: Adonoy blessed my master greatly and he prospered. He gave him sheep, cattle, silver, gold, male slaves, female slaves, camels and donkeys.

verses.ar_he: וִילֵידַת שָׂרָה אִתַּת רִבּוֹנִי בַר לְרִבּוֹנִי בָּתַר דְּסֵיבָת וִיהַב לֵהּ יָת כָּל דִּילֵהּ
verses.ar_en: Sarah, the wife of my master gave birth to a son to my master, after she had grown old, and he has given him all that he possesses.

verses.ar_he: וְקַיֵּם עָלַי רִבּוֹנִי לְמֵימָר לָא תִסַבּ אִתְּתָא לִבְרִי מִבְּנַת כְּנַעֲנָאֵי דִי אֲנָא יָתֵב בְּאַרְעֵהּ
verses.ar_en: My master placed me under oath, saying, Do not take a wife for my son from the daughters of the Canaanites, in whose land I live.

verses.ar_he: אֶלָהֵן לְבֵית אַבָּא תֵּזִיל וּלְזַרְעִיתִי וְתִסַּב אִתְּתָא לִבְרִי
verses.ar_en: Instead, you must go to my father’s house, and to my family. Take a wife for my son.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמָרִית לְרִבּוֹנִי מָאִים לָא תֵיתֵי אִתְּתָא בַּתְרָי
verses.ar_en: I said to my master, Perhaps the woman will not come back with me?

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לִי יְיָ דִּי פְלָחִית קֳדָמוֹהִי יִשְׁלַח מַלְאָכֵהּ עִמָּךְ וְיַצְלַח אָרְחָךְ וְתִסַּב אִתְּתָא לִבְרִי מִזְּרְעִיתִי וּמִבֵּית אַבָּא
verses.ar_en: He said to me, Adonoy, before Whom I have walked [worshiped], will send His angel with you, and make your journey successful. You will then take a wife for my son from my family and from my fathers house.

verses.ar_he: בְּכֵן תְּהֵי זַכַּי (נ''י זַכָּא) מִמּוּמָתִי אֲרֵי תְהַךְ לְזַרְעִיתִי וְאִם לָא יִתְּנוּן לָךְ וּתְהֵי זַכַּי מִמּוּמָתִי
verses.ar_en: You will then be absolved from my oath, if when you come [go] to my family, and they will not give her to you. You will be absolved from my oath.

verses.ar_he: וְאָתִית (נ''י וַאֲתֵיתִי) יוֹמָא דֵּין לְעֵינָא וַאֲמָרִית יְיָ אֱלָהָא דְּרִבּוֹנִי אַבְרָהָם אִם אִית כְּעַן רַעֲוָא קֳדָמָךְ לְאַצְלָחָא אָרְחִי דִּי אֲנָא אָזֵיל עֲלַהּ
verses.ar_en: I came this day to the well, and I said, Adonoy, God of my master, Avraham, if You will grant success [if it is pleasing before You to grant success] to my journey on which I am going.

verses.ar_he: הָא אֲנָא קָאֵם עַל עֵינָא דְמַיָּא וִיהֵי עוּלֶמְתָּא דְּתִפּוֹק לְמִמְלֵי וְאֵימַר לַהּ אַשְׁקִינִי כְעַן זְעֵיר מַיָּא מִקּוּלְתִיךְ
verses.ar_en: Behold, here I stand at the well of water. When a girl comes out to draw water, I will say to her, Please [Now] let me drink a little water from your pitcher.

verses.ar_he: וְתֵימַר לִי אַף אַתְּ אֵשְׁתְּ וְאַף לְגַמְלָיךְ אַמְלִי הִיא אִתְּתָא דְּזַמִּין יְיָ לְבַר רִבּוֹנִי
verses.ar_en: If she says to me, You too may drink, and I will also draw water for your camels, then she is the one whom Adonoy has determined for the son of my master.

verses.ar_he: אֲנָא עַד לָא שֵׁיצִיתִי לְמַלָּלָא בְלִבִּי וְהָא רִבְקָה נְפָקַת וְקוּלְתַהּ עַל כַּתְפַּהּ וּנְחָתַת לְעֵינָא וּמְלָת וַאֲמָרִית לַהּ אַשְׁקִינִי כְעָן
verses.ar_en: Before I had finished speaking thus in my heart, when suddenly Rivkah came out with her pitcher on her shoulder. She went down to the well and drew water; and I said to her, Please [Now] give me a drink,

verses.ar_he: וְאוֹחִיאַת וַאֲחִיתַת קוּלְתַהּ מִנַּהּ וַאֲמֶרֶת אֵשְׁתְּ וְאַף גַּמְלָךְ אַשְׁקִי וּשְׁתֵיתִי וְאַף גַּמְלַיָּא אַשְׁקִיאַת
verses.ar_en: She quickly lowered her pitcher and said, Drink, and I will also give your camels to drink. I drank and she also gave the camels to drink.

verses.ar_he: וּשְׁאֵילִית יָתַהּ וַאֲמָרִית בַּת מָן אַתְּ וַאֲמֶרֶת בַּת בְּתוּאֵל בַּר נָחוֹר דִּילֵידַת לֵהּ מִלְכָּה וְשַׁוֵּיתִי קָדָשָׁא עַל אַפַּהּ וְשִׁירַיָּא עַל יְדָהָא
verses.ar_en: I asked her and said, Whose daughter are you? She replied, The daughter of Besueil, son of Nachor, whom Milkah bore unto him. I [then] placed a nose ring on her face and bracelets upon her hands.

verses.ar_he: וּכְרָעִית וּסְגָדִית קֳדָם יְיָ וּבָרֵכִית יָת יְיָ אֱלָהֵהּ דְּרִבּוֹנִי אַבְרָהָם דְּדַבְּרַנִּי בְּאוֹרַח קְשׁוֹט לְמִיסַב יָת בַּת אֲחוּהִי דְּרִבּוֹנִי לִבְרֵהּ
verses.ar_en: I bowed and prostrated myself to [before] Adonoy, and I blessed Adonoy, God of my master Avraham, Who led me on the true path [in order] to take the daughter of my master’s brother for his son.

verses.ar_he: וּכְעַן אִם אִיתֵיכוֹן עָבְדִין טִיבוּ וּקְשׁוֹט עִם רִבּוֹנִי חַוּוֹ לִי וְאִם לָא חַוּוֹ לִי וְאִתְפְּנֵי עַל יַמִּינָא אוֹ עַל שְׂמָאלָא
verses.ar_en: Now if you want to do what is kind [good] and true to my master, tell me. If not, tell me, and I will turn to the right or to the left.

verses.ar_he: וְאָתֵיב לָבָן וּבְתוּאֵל וַאֲמָרוּ מִן קֳדָם יְיָ נְפַק פִּתְגָּמָא לֵית אֲנַחְנָא יָכְלִין לְמַלָּלָא עִמָּךְ בִּישׁ אוֹ טָב
verses.ar_en: Lavan and Besueil answered and said, This is from [before] Adonoy, we cannot say anything to you, bad or good.

verses.ar_he: הָא רִבְקָה קֳדָמָךְ דְּבַר וְאֵיזִיל וּתְהֵי אִתְּתָא לְבַר רִבּוֹנָךְ כְּמָא דִּי מַלֵּל יְיָ
verses.ar_en: Here, Rivkah is before you, take her and go. Let her be a wife to your master’s son, as Adonoy has spoken.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה כַּד שְׁמַע עַבְדָּא דְאַבְרָהָם יָת פִּתְגָּמֵיהוֹן וּסְגֵד עַל אַרְעָא קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: When Avraham’s servant heard their words, he prostrated himself to the ground to [before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וְאַפֵּק עַבְדָּא מָנִין דִּכְסַף וּמָנִין דִּדְהַב וּלְבוּשִׁין וִיהַב לְרִבְקָה וּמִגְדָּנִין יְהַב לַאֲחוּהָא וּלְאִמַּהּ
verses.ar_en: The servant took out articles of silver, articles of gold and garments, and gave them to Rivkah. To her brother and mother, he gave precious fruits.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲכָלוּ וּשְׁתִיאוּ הוּא וְגוּבְרַיָּא דִּי עִמֵּהּ וּבָתוּ וְקָמוּ בְצַפְרָא וַאֲמַר שַׁלְּחוּנִי לְוַת רִבּוֹנִי
verses.ar_en: They [then] ate and drank, he and the men that were with him, and they stayed over night. They got up in the morning and he said, Send me off to my master.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר אֲחוּהָ וְאִמַּהּ תָּתֵיב עוּלֶמְתָּא עִמָּנָא עִדַּן בְּעִדַּן אוֹ עַשְׂרָא יַרְחִין בָּתַר כֵּן תֵּיזִיל
verses.ar_en: Her brother and mother said, Let the girl abide with us a year or ten months, then she can go.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לְהוֹן לָא תְאַחֲרוּן יָתִי וַיְיָ אַצְלַח אָרְחִי שַׁלְּחוּנִי וְאֵיהַךְ לְוַת רִבּוֹנִי
verses.ar_en: He said to them, Do not detain me, for Adonoy has made my journey successful. Send me off, so that I can go to my master.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַרוּ נִקְרֵי לְעוּלֶמְתָּא וְנִשְׁמָע מַה דְּהִיא אָמְרָה
verses.ar_en: They said, Let us call the girl and ask her [and hear what she says].

verses.ar_he: וּקְרוֹ לְרִבְקָה וַאֲמַרוּ לַהּ הֲתֵיזְלִי עִם גַּבְרָא הָדֵין וַאֲמֶרֶת אֵיזִיל
verses.ar_en: They called Rivkah and said to her, Will you go with this man? She said, I will go.

verses.ar_he: וְשַׁלָּחוּ יָת רִבְקָה אֲחַתְהוֹן וְיָת מֵנִקְתַּהּ וְיָת עַבְדָּא דְאַבְרָהָם וְיָת גַּבְרוֹהִי
verses.ar_en: They sent off Rivkah their sister, along with her nurse, and with Avraham’s servant and his men.

verses.ar_he: וּבָרִיכוּ יָת רִבְקָה וַאֲמַרוּ לַהּ אֲחָתָנָא אַתְּ הֲוֵי לְאַלְפִין וּלְרִבְוָן וְיִרְתוּן בְּנַיְכִי יָת קִרְוֵי סַנְאֵיהוֹן
verses.ar_en: They blessed Rivkah and said to her, Our sister, may you become thousands of [and] myriads, and may your descendants inherit the gate [cities] of his foes.

verses.ar_he: וְקָמַת רִבְקָה וְעוּלֶמְתָּהָא וּרְכִיבָא עַל גַּמְלַיָּא וְאָזְלָּא בָּתַר גַּבְרָא וּדְבַר עַבְדָּא יָת רִבְקָה וַאֲזָל
verses.ar_en: Rivkah and her maidens set off. They rode on the camels and followed the man. The servant took Rivkah and left.

verses.ar_he: וְיִצְחָק אָתָא מִמֵּתוֹהִי (נ''י עַל בְּמֵיתוֹהִי) מִבֵּירָא דְמַלְאָךְ קַיָּמָא אִתְחֲזֵי עֲלַהּ וְהוּא יָתֵב בַּאֲרַע דָּרוֹמָא
verses.ar_en: Yitzchok had just come from the well [called] Lachai Ro’i [the well at which a living angel appeared], for he lived in the land of the Negev [south].

verses.ar_he: וּנְפַק יִצְחָק לְצַלָּאָה בְחַקְלָא לְמִפְנֵי רַמְשָׁא וּזְקַף עֵינוֹהִי וַחֲזָא וְהָא גַּמְלַיָּא אָתָן
verses.ar_en: Yitzchok went out to meditate [pray] in the field towards evening. He raised his eyes and suddenly saw camels approaching.

verses.ar_he: וּזְקָפַת רִבְקָה יָת עֵינָהָא וַחֲזַת יָת יִצְחָק וְאִתְרְכִינַת מֵעַל גַּמְלָא
verses.ar_en: Rivkah raised her eyes and saw Yitzchok. She let herself down from [She inclined herself while upon] the camel.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמֶרֶת לְעַבְדָּא מָן גַּבְרָא דֵיכִי דִּמְהַלֵּךְ בְּחַקְלָא לְקַדָּמוּתָנָא וַאֲמַר עַבְדָּא הוּא רִבּוֹנִי וּנְסֵיבַת עֵיפָא וְאִתְכַּסִּיאַת
verses.ar_en: She said to the servant, Who is that man walking through the field towards us? The servant said, He is my master. She then took the veil and covered herself.

verses.ar_he: וְאִשְׁתָּעֵי עַבְדָּא לְיִצְחָק יָת כָּל פִּתְגָּמַיָּא דִּי עֲבָד
verses.ar_en: The servant told Yitzchok all the things he had done.

verses.ar_he: וְאַעֲלַהּ יִצְחָק לְמַשְׁכְּנָא וַחֲזָא וְהָא תַקְּנִין עוֹבָדָהָא כְּעוֹבָדֵי שָׂרָה אִמֵּהּ וּנְסֵיב יָת רִבְקָה וַהֲוַת לֵהּ לְאִנְּתּוּ וּרְחִימַהּ וְאִתְנְחֵם יִצְחָק בָּתַר דְּמִיתַת אִמֵּהּ
verses.ar_en: Yitzchok brought her into the tent of his mother, Sarah. [Yitzchok brought her into the tent, and behold, her deeds were good like the deeds of Sarah his mother.] He married Rivkah, and she became his wife, and he loved her. Yitzchok was then consoled for the loss of his mother.

verses.ar_he: וְאוֹסֵיף אַבְרָהָם וּנְסֵיב אִתְּתָא וּשְׁמַהּ קְטּוּרָה
verses.ar_en: Avraham again took a wife. Her name was Keturah.

verses.ar_he: וִילֵידַת לֵהּ יָת זִמְרָן וְיָת יָקְשָׁן וְיָת מְדָן וְיָת מִדְיָן וְיָת יִשְׁבָּק וְיָת שׁוּחַ
verses.ar_en: She bore him Zimran, Yokshon, Medan, Midian, Yishbok, and Shuach.

verses.ar_he: וְיָקְשָׁן אוֹלִיד יָת שְׁבָא וְיָת דְּדָן וּבְנֵי דְדָן הֲווֹ לְמַשִּׁירְיָן וְלִשְׁכוּנִין וּלְּנַגְוָן
verses.ar_en: Yokshon fathered Shevah and Dedan. The sons of Dedan were Ashurim [those who dwell in camps], Letushim [those who dwell in tents] and Leumim [those who dwell on islands].

verses.ar_he: וּבְנֵי מִדְיָן עֵיפָה וָעֵפֶר וַחֲנוֹךְ וַאֲבִידָע וְאֶלְדָּעָה כָּל אִלֵּין בְּנֵי קְטוּרָה
verses.ar_en: The sons of Midian were Eiphah, Eipher, Chanoch, Avidah and Eldoah. All these were children of Keturah.

verses.ar_he: וִיהַב אַבְרָהָם יָת כָּל דִּילֵהּ לְיִצְחָק
verses.ar_en: Avraham gave all that he possessed to Yitzchok.

verses.ar_he: וְלִבְנֵי לְחֵינָתָא דִּי לְאַבְרָהָם יְהַב אַבְרָהָם מַתְּנָן וְשַׁלְחִנּוּן מֵעַל יִצְחָק בְּרֵהּ בְּעוֹד דְּהוּא קַיָּם קִידוּמָא לַאֲרַע מַדִינְחָא
verses.ar_en: To the sons of the concubines that Avraham had, Avraham gave gifts. He sent them away from Yitzchok, his son, while he [Avraham] was still alive. [He sent them] eastward to the Land of the East.

verses.ar_he: וְאִלֵּין יוֹמֵי שְׁנֵי חַיֵּי אַבְרָהָם דַּחֲיָא מְאָה וְשַׁבְעִין וְחָמֵשׁ שְׁנִין
verses.ar_en: These are the days of the years of Avraham which he lived, one hundred years, seventy years and five years.

verses.ar_he: וְאִתְנְגִיד וּמִית אַבְרָהָם בְּסִיבוּ טָבָא סִיב וּשְׂבַע יוֹמִין וְאִתְכְּנִישׁ לְעַמֵּהּ
verses.ar_en: Avraham expired and died in a good old age, old and satisfied [and in the fullness of days], and he was gathered to his people.

verses.ar_he: וּקְבָרוּ יָתֵהּ יִצְחָק וְיִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּנוֹהִי בִּמְעָרַת כָּפֶלְתָּא בַּחֲקַל עֶפְרוֹן בַּר צֹחַר חִתָּאָה דִּי עַל אַפֵּי מַמְרֵא
verses.ar_en: His sons Yitzchok and Yishmael buried him in the Machpeilah cave, in the field of Ephron, son of Tzochar, the Chitite, which faces Mamrei.

verses.ar_he: חַקְלָא דִּי זְבַן אַבְרָהָם מִן בְּנֵי חִתָּאָה תַּמָּן אִתְקְבַר אַבְרָהָם וְשָׂרָה אִתְּתֵהּ
verses.ar_en: [This was] the field that Avraham purchased from the sons of Cheis. Avraham and his wife, Sarah, were buried there.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה בָּתַר דְּמִית אַבְרָהָם וּבָרֵךְ יְיָ יָת יִצְחָק בְּרֵהּ וִיתֵב יִצְחָק עִם בֵּירָא דְמַלְאָךְ קַיָּמָא אִתְחֲזֵי עֲלַהּ
verses.ar_en: After Avraham died, Elohim blessed his son Yitzchok. Yitzchok lived near Be’er Lachai Ro’i [the well at which a living angel appeared].

verses.ar_he: וְאִלֵּין תּוּלְדַת יִשְׁמָעֵאל בַּר אַבְרָהָם דִּי יְלֵידַת הָגָר מִצְרֵתָא אַמְתָא דְשָׂרָה לְאַבְרָהָם
verses.ar_en: These are the descendants of Yishmael son of Avraham, whom Hagar, the Egyptian, Sarah’s slave, bore to Avraham.

verses.ar_he: וְאִלֵּין שְׁמָהַת בְּנֵי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בִּשְׁמָהַתְהוֹן לְתוּלְדַתְהוֹן בּוּכְרָא דְיִשְׁמָעֵאל נְבָיוֹת וְקֵדָר וְאַדְבְּאֵל וּמִבְשָׂם
verses.ar_en: These are the names of Yishmael’s sons, by their names according to their birth. Nevayos was Yishmael’s first born, [he also had] Keidar, Adbeil and Mivsom,

verses.ar_he: וּמִשְׁמָע וְדוּמָה וּמַשָּׂא
verses.ar_en: Mishma, Dumah and Masa,

verses.ar_he: חֲדַד וְתֵימָא יְטוּר נָפִישׁ וָקֵדְמָה
verses.ar_en: Chadad, Teima, Yetur, Nofish and Keidmah.

verses.ar_he: אִלֵּין אִנּוּן בְּנֵי יִשְׁמָעֵאל וְאִלֵּין שְׁמָהַתְהוֹן בְּפַצְחֵיהוֹן וּבִכְרַכֵּיהוֹן תְּרֵין עֲסַר רַבְרְבִין לְאֻמֵּיהוֹן
verses.ar_en: These are the sons of Yishmael, and these are their names in their open villages and in their fortified strongholds, twelve princes in their nations.

verses.ar_he: וְאִלֵּין שְׁנֵי חַיֵּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל מְאָה וּתְלָתִין וּשְׁבַע שְׁנִין וְאִתְנְגִיד וּמִית וְאִתְכְּנִישׁ לְעַמֵּהּ
verses.ar_en: These are the years of Yishmael’s life, one hundred years, thirty years and seven years. He expired and died and was gathered to his people.

verses.ar_he: וּשְׁרוֹ מֵחֲוִילָה עַד חַגְרָא דִּי עַל אַפֵּי מִצְרַיִם מָטֵי לְאָתוּר עַל אַפֵּי כָל אֲחוֹהִי שְׁרָא
verses.ar_en: They lived from Chavilah to Shur [Chagar], which borders on Egypt, going towards Asshur. He lived in the presence of all his brethren.

verses.ar_he: וְאִלֵּין תּוּלְדַת יִצְחָק בַּר אַבְרָהָם אַבְרָהָם אוֹלִיד יָת יִצְחָק
verses.ar_en: And these are the descendants of Yitzchok son of Avraham. Avraham was the father of Yitzchok.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה יִצְחָק בַּר אַרְבְּעִין שְׁנִין כַּד נְסֵיב יָת רִבְקָה בַּת בְּתוּאֵל אֲרַמָּאָה מִפַּדַּן אֲרָם אֲחָתֵהּ דְלָבָן אֲרַמָּאָה לֵהּ לְאִנְתּוּ
verses.ar_en: Yitzchok was forty years old when he took Rivkah, the daughter of Besueil, the Aramite, of Padan Aram, sister of Lavan, the Aramite, for a wife.

verses.ar_he: וְצַלִּי יִצְחָק קֳדָם יְיָ לָקֳבֵל אִתְּתֵהּ אֲרֵי עֲקָרָה הִיא וְקַבֵּל צְלוֹתֵהּ יְיָ וְעַדִּיאַת רִבְקָה אִתְּתֵהּ
verses.ar_en: Yitzchok prayed to [before] Adonoy across from [opposite] his wife, for she was barren. Adonoy granted his prayer and his wife, Rivkah, conceived.

verses.ar_he: וְדַחֲקִין בְּנַיָּא בִּמְעָהָא וַאֲמֶרֶת אִם כֵּן לְמָה דְּנַן אֲנָא וַאֲזָלַת לְמִתְבַּע אוּלְפַן מִן קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: The children clashed [pressed] inside her, and [when this happened] she said, If this is so, why did I desire this? She [then] went to inquire of [to ask for instruction from before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ לַהּ תְּרֵין עַמְמִין בִּמְעַיְכִי וְתַרְתֵּין מַלְכְּוָן מִמֵעַיְכִי יִתְפָּרְשָׁן וּמַלְכוּ מִמַלְכוּ יִתְקַף וְרַבָּא יִשְׁתַּעֲבֵּיד לִזְעֵירָא
verses.ar_en: Adonoy said to her, Two nations are in your womb, and two Kingdoms will separate from within you. One government will be mightier than the other, but the greater one will serve the smaller one.

verses.ar_he: וּשְׁלִימוּ יוֹמָהָא לְמֵילָד וְהָא תְיוּמִין בִּמְעָהָא
verses.ar_en: When her days of pregnancy were completed, behold, there were twins in her womb.

verses.ar_he: וּנְפַק קַדְמָאָה סִמוֹק כֻּלֵּהּ כִּגְלִים (נ''י כִּכְלָן) דִּשְׂעָר וּקְרוֹ שְׁמֵהּ עֵשָׂו
verses.ar_en: The first one came out with a reddish complexion, covered completely with what was like a hairy robe, and they named him Eisov.

verses.ar_he: וּבָתַר כֵּן נְפַק אֲחוּהִי וִידֵהּ אֲחִידָא בְּעִקְבָא דְעֵשָׂו וּקְרָא שְׁמֵהּ יַעֲקֹב וְיִצְחָק בַּר שִׁתִּין שְׁנִין כַּד יְלִידַת יָתְהוֹן
verses.ar_en: After that his brother came out, his hand grasping the heel of Eisov, and he [Yitzchok] named him Yaakov. Yitzchok was sixty years old when she [Rivkah] gave birth to them.

verses.ar_he: וּרְבִיוּ עוּלֵמַיָּא וַהֲוָה עֵשָׂו גְבַר נַחְשִׁירְכָן גְבַר נָפֵק לְחַקְלָא וְיַעֲקֹב גְבַר שְׁלִים מְשַׁמֵשׁ בֵּית אוּלְפָנָא
verses.ar_en: The lads grew up. Eisov became a skilled trapper [an idle man], a man of the field [a man going out to the field]. Yaakov was a wholesome man, living in tents [serving in the house of study].

verses.ar_he: וּרְחֵם יִצְחָק יָת עֵשָׂו אֲרֵי מִצֵידֵהּ הֲוָה אָכִיל וְרִבְקָה רְחִימַת יָת יַעֲקֹב
verses.ar_en: Yitzchok loved Eisov because he ate of his trappings, but Rivkah loved Yaakov.

verses.ar_he: וּבַשִּׁיל יַעֲקֹב תַּבְשִׁילָא וַאֲתָא (נ'''י וְעַל) עֵשָׂו מִן חַקְלָא וְהוּא מְשַׁלְהֵי
verses.ar_en: Yaakov was simmering a pottage when Eisov came in from the field, exhausted.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר עֵשָׂו לְיַעֲקֹב אַטְעֵמְנִי כְעַן מִן סִמּוֹקָא סִמּוֹקָא הָדֵין אֲרֵי מְשַׁלְהֵי אֲנָא עַל כֵּן קְרָא שְׁמֵהּ אֱדוֹם
verses.ar_en: Eisov said to Yaakov, Please [Now] give me a swallow of this red [pottage], for I am exhausted. He was therefore named Edom [Red].

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יַעֲקֹב זַבִּין כְּיוֹם דִּלְהֵן יָת בְּכֵרוּתָךְ לִי
verses.ar_en: Yaakov said, As of this day [Like this day], sell your birthright to me.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר עֵשָׂו הָא אֲנָא אָזֵל לִמְמָת וּלְמָה דְּנָן לִי בְּכֵרוּתָא
verses.ar_en: Eisov said, Here I am going to die, what [good] is this birthright to me.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יַעֲקֹב קַיֵּם לִי כְּיוֹם דִּלְהֵן וְקַיִּים לֵהּ וְזַבִּין יָת בְּכֵרוּתֵהּ לְיַעֲקֹב
verses.ar_en: Yaakov said, Swear to me as of this day [like this day]. He swore to him, and sold his birthright to Yaakov.

verses.ar_he: וְיַעֲקֹב יְהַב לְעֵשָׂו לְחֵם וְתַבְשִׁיל דִּטְלוֹפְחִין וַאֲכַל וּשְׁתִי וְקָם וַאֲזָל וְשָׁט עֵשָׂו יָת בְּכֵרוּתָא
verses.ar_en: Yaakov then gave Eisov bread and a pottage of lentils. He [Eisov] ate and drank, got up and left. [Thus] Eisov scorned the birthright.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה כַפְנָא בְּאַרְעָא בַּר מִכַּפְנָא קַדְמָאָה דִּי הֲוָה בְּיוֹמֵי אַבְרָהָם וַאֲזַל יִצְחָק לְוַת אֲבִימֶלֶךְ מַלְכָּא דִּפְלִשְׁתָּאֵי לִגְרָר
verses.ar_en: There was a famine in the land, aside from the first famine that was in the days of Avraham. Yitzchok went to Avimelech, king of the Philistines, in Gerar.

verses.ar_he: וְאִתְגְּלִי לֵהּ יְיָ וַאֲמַר לָא תֵחוֹת לְמִצְרָיִם שְׁרֵי בְאַרְעָא דִּי אֵימַר לָךְ
verses.ar_en: Adonoy appeared [became revealed] to him and said, Do not go down to Egypt. Settle in the land that I will make known to you.

verses.ar_he: דּוּר בְּאַרְעָא הָדָא וִיהֵי מֵימְרִי בְסַעְדָךְ וְאֵבָרְכִנָךְ אֲרֵי לָךְ וְלִבְנָיךְ אֶתֵּן יָת כָּל אַרְעָתָא הָאִלֵּין וְאָקֵם יָת קְיָמָא דִּי קַיֵּמִית לְאַבְרָהָם אֲבוּךְ
verses.ar_en: Stay temporarily in this land and I will be with you and bless you [My Word will be your support and I will bless you], for to you and your descendants I will give all these lands. I will [thus] keep the oath that I swore to Avraham, your father.

verses.ar_he: וְאַסְגֵּי יָת בְּנָיךְ סַגִּיאִין כְּכוֹכְבֵי שְׁמַיָּא וְאֶתֵּן לִבְנָיךְ יָת כָּל אַרְעָתָא הָאִלֵּין וְיִתְבָּרְכוּן בְּדִיל בְּנָךְ כֹּל עַמְמֵי אַרְעָא
verses.ar_en: I will make your descendants [as numerous] as the stars of the heavens, and I will give your descendants all these lands. Through [Because of] your descendants shall be blessed all the nations of the world.

verses.ar_he: חֳלַף דִּי קַבִּיל אַבְרָהָם בְּמֵימְרִי וּנְטַר מַטְּרַת מֵימְרִי פִּקּוֹדַי קְיָמַי וְאוֹרָיָתָי
verses.ar_en: [All this is] because Avraham listened to [accepted] My voice [Word], and minded My mandate [the mandate of My Word], My commandments, My decrees and My teachings.

verses.ar_he: וִיתֵב יִצְחָק בִּגְרָר
verses.ar_en: Yitzchok [thus] settled in Gerar.

verses.ar_he: וּשְׁאִילוּ אֲנָשֵׁי אַתְרָא (עַל עֵיסַק אִתְּתֵהּ) לְאִתְּתֵהּ וַאֲמַר אֲחָתִי הִיא אֲרֵי דְחִיל לְמֵימַר אִתְּתִי דִּלְמָא יִקְטְּלֻנַּנִי אֲנָשֵׁי אַתְרָא עַל רִבְקָה אֲרֵי שַׁפִּירַת חֵיזוּ הִיא
verses.ar_en: The local men asked about his wife, and he said, She is my sister. He was afraid to say, [she is] my wife, lest the local men kill me for Rivkah, for she is so good looking.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה כַּד סְגִיאוּ לֵהּ תַּמָּן יוֹמַיָּא וְאִסְתְּכִי אֲבִימֶלֶךְ מַלְכָּא דִּפְלִשְׁתָּאֵי מִן חֲרַכָּא וַחֲזָא וְהָא יִצְחָק מְחַיִּיךְ עִם רִבְקָה אִתְּתֵהּ
verses.ar_en: Once, after [Yitzchok] had been there a long while, Avimelech, king of the Philistines, looked at the window, and he saw, and behold, Yitzchok was amusing himself with Rivkah, his wife.

verses.ar_he: וּקְרָא אֲבִימֶלֶךְ לְיִצְחָק וַאֲמַר בְּרַם הָא אִתְּתָךְ הִיא וְאֶכְדֵּין אֲמַרְתָּ אֲחָתִי הִיא וַאֲמַר לֵהּ יִצְחָק אֲרֵי אֲמָרִית דִּלְמָא אֵימוּת עֲלַהּ
verses.ar_en: Avimelech called Yitzchok and he said, But she is your wife. How could you have said, She is my sister? Yitzchok said to him, Because I said, I might die because of her.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר אֲבִימֶלֶךְ מָה דָא עֲבַדְתָּ לָנָא כִּזְעֵיר פּוֹן שָׁכִיב דִּמְיָחֵד בְּעַמָּא עִם אִתְּתָךְ וְאַיְתֵיתָא עֲלָנָא חוֹבָא
verses.ar_en: Avimelech said, What have you done to us? One of the people [The unique one among the people] could have easily slept with your wife, and you would have brought guilt upon us.

verses.ar_he: וּפַקִּיד אֲבִימֶלֶךְ יָת כָּל עַמָּא לְמֵימָר דְּיַנְזֵק לְגַבְרָא הָדֵין וּבְאִתְּתֵהּ אִתְקְטָלָא יִתְקְטֵּל
verses.ar_en: Avimelech [then] commanded all his people, saying, Whoever touches [injures] this man or his wife, shall die.

verses.ar_he: וּזְרַע יִצְחָק בְּאַרְעָא הַהִיא וְאַשְׁכַּח בְּשַׁתָּא הַהִיא עַל חַד מְאָה בִדְשַׁעֲרוֹהִי וּבָרְכֵהּ יְיָ
verses.ar_en: Yitzchok planted in that land, and in that year he reaped a hundred fold [more than that which they estimated], for Adonoy had blessed him.

verses.ar_he: וּרְבָא גַּבְרָא וַאֲזַל אֲזִיל (נ''י סָגֵי) וְרָבֵי עַד דִּי רְבָא לַחֲדָא
verses.ar_en: The man prospered. He continued to prosper [and increase] until he became very great.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה לֵהּ גֵּיתֵי עָנָא וְגֵיתֵי תוֹרִין וּפָלְחָנָא (נ''י וַעֲבוּדָה) סַגְיָא וְקַנִּיאוּ בֵהּ פְּלִשְׁתָּאֵי
verses.ar_en: He owned flocks of sheep, herds of cattle, and many slaves, and the Philistines were jealous of him.

verses.ar_he: וְכָל בֵּירִין דִּי חֲפָרוּ עַבְדֵי אֲבוּהִי בְּיוֹמֵי אַבְרָהָם אֲבוּהִי טַמּוֹנוּן פְּלִשְׁתָּאֵי וּמְלוֹנוּן עַפְרָא
verses.ar_en: All the wells that his father’s servants had dug in the days of his father, Avraham—the Philistines plugged them, and filled them with earth.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר אֲבִימֶלֶךְ לְיִצְחָק אִזְּל מֵעִמָּנָא אֲרֵי תְקֵפְתָּא מִנָּנָא לַחֲדָא
verses.ar_en: Avimelech said to Yitzchok, Go away from us. You have become much more powerful than us.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲזַל מִתַּמָּן יִצְחָק וּשְׁרָא בְנַחֲלָא דִּגְרָר וִיתֵב תַּמָּן
verses.ar_en: Yitzchok went away from there. He camped in the valley of Gerar and settled there.

verses.ar_he: וְתָב יִצְחָק וְחָפַר יָת בֵּירֵי דְמַיָּא דִּי חֲפָרוּ בְּיוֹמֵי אַבְרָהָם אֲבוּהִי וְטַּמּוֹנוּן פְּלִשְׁתָּאֵי בָּתַר דְּמִית אַבְרָהָם וּקְרָא לְהֵן שְׁמָהָן כִּשְׁמָהָן דִּי הֲוָה קָרֵי לְהֵן אֲבוּהִי
verses.ar_en: Yitzchok returned and excavated the wells of water which were dug in the days of his father, Avraham, and were plugged by the Philistines after Avraham’s death. He gave them the same names that his father had given them.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲפָרוּ עַבְדֵי יִצְחָק בְּנַחֲלָא וְאַשְׁכָּחוּ תַמָּן בֵּירָא דְּמַיִּין נָבְעִין
verses.ar_en: Yitzchok’s servants dug in the valley and found there a well of spring [flowing] water.

verses.ar_he: וּנְצוֹ רַעֲוָתָא דִּגְרָר עִם רַעֲוָתָא דְיִצְחָק לְמֵימַר דִּי לָנָא מַיָּא וּקְרָא שְׁמָא דְבֵירָא עִסְקָא אֲרֵי אִתְעַסִּיקוּ עִמֵּהּ
verses.ar_en: The shepherds of Gerar argued with the shepherds of Yitzchok, saying, the water is ours. He named the well Eisek [Quarrel], because they had quarreled with him.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲפָרוּ בֵּירָא אָחֳרִי וּנְצוֹ אַף עֲלַהּ וּקְרָא שְׁמַהּ שִׂטְנָא
verses.ar_en: They dug another well and they also argued about it. He named the well Sitnah [Obstruction].

verses.ar_he: וְאִסְתַּלַּק מִתַּמָּן וַחֲפַר בֵּירָא אָחֳרִי וְלָא נְצוֹ עֲלַהּ וּקְרָא שְׁמַהּ רְחֹבוֹת וַאֲמַר אֲרֵי כְעַן אַפְתֵּי יְיָ לָנָא וְנִיפוּשׁ בְּאַרְעָא
verses.ar_en: He moved away from there and he dug another well, and there was no argument over it. He named it Rechovos [Wide Spaces], and said, For now Adonoy has made room for us, and we shall be fruitful in the land.

verses.ar_he: וְאִסְתַּלַּק מִתַּמָּן לִבְּאֵר שָׁבַע
verses.ar_en: From there he went to Beer Sheva.

verses.ar_he: וְאִתְגְּלִי לֵהּ יְיָ בְּלֵילְיָא הַהוּא וַאֲמַר אֲנָא אֱלָהֵהּ דְּאַבְרָהָם אֲבוּךְ לָא תִדְחַל אֲרֵי בְסַעְדָּךְ מֵימְרִי וֶאֱבָרֵכִנָּךְ וְאַסְגֵּי יָת בְּנָיךְ בְּדִיל אַבְרָהָם עַבְדִּי
verses.ar_en: Adonoy appeared [became revealed] to him that night and said, I am the God of your father, Avraham. Do not fear for I am with you [My Word is your support]. I will bless you and make your descendants numerous, because of My servant, Avraham.

verses.ar_he: וּבְנָא תַמָּן מַדְבְּחָא וְצַלִּי בִּשְׁמָא דַּיְיָ וּפְרַס תַּמָּן מַשְׁכְּנֵהּ וּכְרוֹ תַמָּן עַבְדֵי יִצְחָק בֵּירָא
verses.ar_en: He [Yitzchok] built an altar there, and proclaimed [prayed in] the Name of Adonoy. He set up his tent there, and Yitzchok’s servants dug a well there.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲבִימֶלֶךְ אֲזַל לְוָתֵהּ מִגְּרָר וְסִיעַת מֵרַחֲמוֹהִי וּפִיכֹל רַב חֵילֵהּ
verses.ar_en: Avimelech came to Yitzchok from Gerar along with a group of friends and Pichol, his general.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לְהוֹן יִצְחָק מָה דֵּין אֲתֵיתוּן לְוָתִי וְאַתּוּן סְנֵיתוּן יָתִי וְשַׁלַּחְתּוּנִי מִלְּוָתְכוֹן
verses.ar_en: Yitzchok said to them, Why have you come to me? You hate me and drove me away from you.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמָרוּ מֶחֱזָא חֲזֵינָא אֲרֵי הֲוָה מֵימְרָא דַּיְיָ בִּסַעְדָּךְ וַאֲמַרְנָא תִּתְקַיַּם כְּעַן מוֹמָתָא דִּהֲוָה בֵין אֲבָהָתָנָא בֵּינָנָא וּבֵינָךְ וְנִגְזַר קְיָם עִמָּךְ
verses.ar_en: They said, We have indeed seen that Adonoy is with you [the Word of Adonoy is your support], and we said, Let there now be an oath between us, [Let the oath that was between our fathers now be established] between ourselves and you, and let us make a covenant with you;

verses.ar_he: אִם תַּעְבֵּד עִמָּנָא בִּישָׁא כְּמָא דִּי לָא אַנְזִיקְנָךְ וּכְמָא דִּי עֲבַדְנָא עִמָךְ לְחוֹד טָב וַנְשַׁלְּחִנָּךְ בִּשְׁלָם אַתְּ כְּעַן בְּרִיכָא דַּיְיָ
verses.ar_en: that you will do us no harm, just as we did not touch [injure] you. We did nothing but good to you, and sent you away in peace. You are now the blessed one of Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד לְהוֹן מִשְׁתְּיָא וַאֲכָלוּ וּשְׁתִיאוּ
verses.ar_en: He [Yitzchok] made a feast for them, and they ate and drank.

verses.ar_he: וְאַקְדִימוּ בְצַפְרָא וְקַיִּימוּ גְּבַר לְאָחוּהִי וְשַׁלָּחִנוּן יִצְחָק וַאֲזָלוּ מִלְוָתֵהּ בִּשְׁלָם
verses.ar_en: They got up early in the morning, and they each swore to the other. Yitzchok sent them away and they left in peace.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה בְּיוֹמָא הַהוּא וַאֲתוֹ עַבְדֵי יִצְחָק וְחַוִּיאוּ לֵהּ עַל עֵיסַק בֵּירָא דִּי חֲפָרוּ וַאֲמָרוּ לֵהּ אַשְׁכַּחְנָא מַיָּא
verses.ar_en: On that day Yitzchok’s servants came and told him about the well they had dug; and they said to him, We have found water.

verses.ar_he: וּקְרָא יָתַהּ שִׁבְעָה עַל כֵּן שְׁמָא דְקַרְתָּא בְּאֵרָא דְשֶׁבַע (נ''י בְּאֵר שֶׁבַע) עַד יוֹמָא הָדֵין
verses.ar_en: He named it Shiva. Therefore the city is called Beer Sheva until this very day.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה עֵשָׂו בַּר אַרְבְּעִין שְׁנִין וּנְסִיב אִתְּתָא יָת יְהוּדִית בַּת בְּאֵרִי חִתָּאָה וְיָת בָּשְׂמַת בַּת אֵילוֹן חִתָּאָה
verses.ar_en: Eisov was forty years old and he married Yehudis, the daughter of Be’eri, the Chittite and Bosmas, the daughter of Eylon the Chittite.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָאָה מְסָרְבָן וּמְרַגְּזָן עַל מֵימַר יִצְחָק וְרִבְקָה
verses.ar_en: They were rebellious of spirit to [They were rebels and aggravators against the words of] Yitzchok and Rivkah.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה כַּד סִיב יִצְחָק וְכָהֲיָּא עֵינוֹהִי מִלְּמֶחֱזֵי וּקְרָא יַת עֵשָׂו בְּרֵהּ רַבָּה וַאֲמַר לֵהּ בְּרִי וַאֲמַר לֵהּ הָא אָנָא
verses.ar_en: And when Yitzchok grew old his eyesight faded and he could not see. He called Eisov, his elder son, and said to him, My son. [Eisov] said to him, Here I am.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר הָא כְעַן סֵיבִית לֵית אֲנָא יְדַע יוֹמָא דְאֵימוּת
verses.ar_en: [Yitzchok] said, Behold, if you please [now], I am old. I do not know the day of my death.

verses.ar_he: וּכְעַן סַב כְּעַן זֵינָךְ סַיְפָךְ וְקַשְׁתָּךְ וּפוּק לְחַקְלָא וְצוּד לִי צֵידָא
verses.ar_en: Now [therefore] please [now] take your equipment, your sword and your bow, and go out to the field and trap [deer] for me.

verses.ar_he: וְעִבֵיד לִי תַבְשִׁילִין כְּמָא דִרְחֵימִית וְאָעֵל לִי וְאֵיכוּל בְּדִיל דִּי תְבָרֵכִנָּךְ נַפְשִׁי עַד לָא אֵימוּת
verses.ar_en: Make it into a tasty dish for me, the way I like it, and bring it to me that I may eat, so that my soul will bless you before I die.

verses.ar_he: וְרִבְקָה שְׁמַעַת כַּד מַלִּיל יִצְחָק לְוַת עֵשָׂו בְּרֵהּ וַאֲזַל עֵשָׂו לְחַקְלָא לְמֵיצַד צֵידָא לְאַיְתָאָה
verses.ar_en: Rivkah had [over]heard what Yitzchok said to his son, Eisov. Eisov went out to the field to trap [deer] to bring it [home.]

verses.ar_he: וְרִבְקָה אֲמָרַת לְוַת יַעֲקֹב בְּרַהּ לְמֵימָר הָא שְׁמָעִית יַת אֲבוּךְ מְמַלֵּל עִם עֵשָׂו אַחוּךְ לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: Rivkah said to her son Yaakov, saying, Behold, I heard your father speaking to your brother Eisov, saying,

verses.ar_he: אַיְתִי לִי צֵידָא וְעִבֵּיד לִי תַבְשִׁילִין וְאֵיכוּל וֶאֱבָרֵכִנָּךְ קֳדָם יְיָ קֳדָם מוֹתִי
verses.ar_en: Bring back [deer] for me and make it into a tasty dish for me and I will eat. I will then bless you in the presence of Adonoy before I die.

verses.ar_he: וּכְעַן בְּרִי קַבֵּל מִנִי לְמָא דִי אֲנָא מפַקֵד יָתָךְ
verses.ar_en: Now my son, listen to [accept] me, concerning that which I command you.

verses.ar_he: אִזֵיל כְּעַן לְוַת עָנָא וְסַב לִי מִתַּמָּן תְּרֵין גַדְיֵי (בַר) עִזְּין טָבָן וְאֶעְבֵּד יָתְהוֹן תַּבְשִׁילִין לְאָבוּךְ כְּמָא דִי רְחֵם
verses.ar_en: Go, please [now], to the sheep and take for me from there two choice young goats, and I will make [from] them a tasty dish for your father as he likes.

verses.ar_he: וְתַיְתִי (נ''י וְתָעֵל) לְאָבוּךְ וְיֵכוּל בְּדִיל דִּיְבָרְכִנָּךְ קֳדָם מוֹתֵהּ
verses.ar_en: You will [then] bring it to your father to eat, in order that he will bless you before he dies.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יַעֲקֹב לְרִבְקָה אִמֵּהּ הָא עֵשָׂו אָחִי גְּבַר שַׂעֲרָן וַאֲנָא גְּבַר שְׁעִיעַ
verses.ar_en: Yaakov said to Rivkah, his mother, Behold, Eisov, my brother is a hairy person and I am a smooth-skinned person.

verses.ar_he: מָאִים יְמֻשִּׁנַּנִי אַבָּא וְאֵהֵי בְעֵינוֹהִי כְּמִתְלָעָב וְאֵהֵי מַיְתֵי (נ''י וָאֱהִי מַיְתֵי) עֲלַי לְוָטִין וְלָא בִרְכָן
verses.ar_en: Suppose my father touches me. I will be in his eyes as an impostor [a mocker]. I will bring upon myself a curse [curses]—not a blessing [blessings].

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמֶרֶת לֵהּ אִמֵּהּ עֲלַי אִתְאַמַּר בִּנְבוּאָה דְּלָא יֵיתוּן לְוָטַּיָּא עֲלָךְ בְּרִי בְּרַם קַבֵּל מִנִּי וְאִזְּיל סַב לִי
verses.ar_en: His mother said to him, Your curse shall be upon me [It was said regarding me in a prophecy that curses will not come upon you], my son; but listen to [accept] me. Go bring them to me.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲזַל וּנְסִיב וְאַיְתִי לְאִמֵּהּ וַעֲבָדַת אִמֵּהּ תַּבְשִׁילִין כְּמָא דִּרְחֵם אֲבוּהִי
verses.ar_en: He went, took [them], and brought [them] to his mother. His mother make a tasty dish as his father liked.

verses.ar_he: וּנְסִיבַת רִבְקָה יָת לְבוּשֵׁי עֵשָׂו בְּרַהּ רַבָּא דָּכְיָתָא דִּי עִמַּהּ בְּבֵיתָא וְאַלְבִּישַׁת יָת יַעֲקֹב בְּרַהּ זְעֵירָא
verses.ar_en: Rivkah took the garments of Eisov, her elder son, [the garments] that were precious [to him] [the clean ones] that were in her keeping in the house, and put them on Yaakov, her younger son.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת מַשְׁכֵי גַּדְיֵי בַּר עִזֵּי אַלְבִּישַׁת עַל יְדוֹהִי וְעַל שְׁעִיעוּת צַוְרֵהּ
verses.ar_en: The skins of the young goats she placed on his hands and the smooth part of his neck.

verses.ar_he: וִיהָבַת יָת תַּבְשִׁילַיָּא וְיָת לַחְמָא דִּי עֲבָדַת בִּידָא דְיַעֲקֹב בְּרַהּ
verses.ar_en: She placed the tasty dish and the bread which she had made, in the hand of Yaakov, her son.

verses.ar_he: וְעַל לְוַת אֲבוּהִי וַאֲמַר אַבָּא וַאֲמַר הָא אֲנָא מָן אַתְּ בְּרִי
verses.ar_en: He came to his father and said, My father. [Yitzchok] said, Here I am. Who are you my son?

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יַעֲקֹב לַאֲבוּהִי אֲנָא עֵשָׂו בּוּכְרָךְ עֲבָדִית כּמָא דִי מַלֵּילְתָּא עִמִּי (נ''י:לִי) קוּם כְּעַן אִסְתַּחַר וֶאֱכוּל מִצֵידִי בְּדִיל דִּי תְבָרְכִנַּנִּי נַפְשָׁךְ
verses.ar_en: Yaakov said to his father, It is I, Eisov your firstborn. I have done as you told me. Rise, if you please [now], sit up [recline] and eat of my trapping so that your soul will bless me.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יִצְחָק לִבְרֵהּ מָה דֵּין אוֹחֵיתָא לְאַשְׁכָּחָא בְּרִי וַאֲמַר אֲרֵי זַמִּין יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ קֳדָמַי
verses.ar_en: Yitzchok said to his son, How is it that you found it so quickly my son? He [Yaakov] said, Because Adonoy, your God, brought it about for me.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יִצְחָק לְיַעֲקֹב קְרֵיב כְּעַן וֶאֱמֻשִּׁנָּךְ בְּרִי הַאַתְּ דֵּין בְּרִי עֵשָׂו אִם לָא
verses.ar_en: Yitzchok said to Yaakov, Come close, if you please [now], and let me touch you, my son. Are you my son Eisov or not?

verses.ar_he: וּקְרֵיב יַעֲקֹב לְוַת יִצְחָק אֲבוּהִי וּמָשְׁיֵהּ וַאֲמַר קָלָא קָלָא דְיַעֲקֹב וִידַיָּא יְדוֹהִי דְעֵשָׂו
verses.ar_en: Yaakov came close to Yitzchok, his father, and he [Yitzchok] touched him. He said, The voice is the voice of Yaakov, but the hands are the hands of Eisov.

verses.ar_he: וְלָא אִשְׁתְּמוֹדְעֵהּ אֲרֵי הֲוָאָה יְדוֹהִי כִּידֵי עֵשָׂו אֲחוּהִי שְׂעִירָן (נ''י שַׂעֲרַנְיָן) וּבָרְכֵהּ
verses.ar_en: He [Yitzchok] did not recognize him because his hands were like those of Eisov, his brother—they were hairy—and [thus] he blessed him.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר אַתְּ דֵּין בְּרִי עֵשָׂו וַאֲמַר הָא אֲנָא
verses.ar_en: He said, Are you indeed my son, Eisov? [Yaakov] said, [Behold] I am.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר קָרֵיב קֳדָמַי וְאֵיכוּל מִצֵידָא דִּבְרִי בְּדִיל דִּי תְבָרְכִנָּךְ נַפְשִׁי וְקָרֵיב לֵהּ וַאֲכַל וְאַיְתִי (נ''י וְאָעֵל) לֵהּ חַמְרָא וּשְׁתִי
verses.ar_en: He said, Bring it close to [before] me and I will eat from my son’s trappings, so that my soul will bless you. He brought it close to him and he ate. He [then] brought him wine and he drank.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לֵהּ יִצְחָק אֲבוּהִי קְרֵיב כְּעַן וּנְשַׁק לִי (נ''י וְשַׁק לִי) בְּרִי
verses.ar_en: His father Yitzchok said to him, Come close to me [now] and kiss me, my son.

verses.ar_he: וּקְרֵב וּנְשַׁק לֵהּ וַאֲרַח יָת רֵיחָא דִּלְבוּשׁוֹהִי וּבָרְכֵהּ וַאֲמַר חֲזֵי רֵיחָא דִּבְרִי כְּרֵיחָא דְחַקְלָא דִּי בָרֲכֵהּ יְיָ
verses.ar_en: He came close and kissed him. He [Yitzchok] smelled the fragrance of his garments, and he blessed him. He said, See, my son’s fragrance is like the fragrance of a field blessed by Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וְיִתֶּן לָךְ יְיָ מִטַּלָּא דִּשְׁמַיָּא וּמִטּוּבָא דְאַרְעָא וּסְגִיאוּת (נ''י וְסַגְיוּת) עִיבוּר וַחֲמָר
verses.ar_en: And may God give you of the dew of heaven, and of the fatness [riches] [goodness] of the land, and abundance of grain and wine.

verses.ar_he: יִפְלְחֻנָּךְ עַמְמִין וְיִשְׁתַּעְבְּדוּן לָךְ מַלְכְּוָן הֱוֵי רַב לְאַחָיךְ וְיִסְגְּדוּן לָךְ בְּנֵי אִמָּךְ מְלַטְטָיךְ יְהוֹן לִיטִין וּמְבָרֲכָיךְ יְהוֹן בְּרִיכִין
verses.ar_en: Peoples will serve you and nations bow to you [kingdoms will be subservient to you]. Be master over your brothers, and your mother’s sons will bow to you. Those who curse you are [will be] cursed, and those who bless you are [will be] blessed.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה כַּד שֵׁיצֵי יִצְחָק לְבָרָכָא יָת יַעֲקֹב וַהֲוָה בְּרַם מִפַּק נְפַק יַעֲקֹב מִלְּוַת אַפֵּי יִצְחָק אֲבוּהִי וְעֵשָׂו אֲחוּהִי אָתָא (נ''י עַל) מִצֵידֵהּ
verses.ar_en: It was when Yitzchok had finished blessing Yaakov, and Yaakov had just left the presence of Yitzchok, his father, that Eisov came back from his trapping.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד אַף הוּא תַּבְשִׁילִין וְאָעֵיל לְוַת אֲבוּהִי וַאֲמַר לַאֲבוּהִי יָקוּם אַבָּא וְיֵכוּל מִצֵידָא דִּבְרֵהּ בְּדִיל דִּי תְבָרְכִנַּנִּי נַפְשָׁךְ
verses.ar_en: He too made a tasty dish and brought it to his father. He said to his father, Let my father rise and eat of his son’s trapping, that your soul may bless me.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לֵהּ יִצְחָק אֲבוּהִי מָן אָתְּ וַאֲמַר אֲנָא בְּרָךְ בּוּכְרָךְ עֵשָׂו
verses.ar_en: Yitzchok, his father, said to him, Who are you? He said, I am your son, your firstborn, Eisov.

verses.ar_he: וּתְוָה יִצְחָק תִּוְהָא רַבָּא עַד לַחֲדָא וַאֲמַר מָן הוּא דֵּיכִי דְצָד צֵידָא וְאָעֵיל לִי וַאֲכָלִית מִכֹּלָּא עַד לָא תֵיעוֹל וּבָרֵכִתֵּהּ אַף בְּרִיךְ יְהֵי
verses.ar_en: Yitzchok was seized with a powerful trembling [Yitzchok was astonished with great astonishment]; and said, Who, then, is he who trapped [deer] and brought it to me. I ate all of it before you came, and I blessed him. He shall be blessed.

verses.ar_he: כַּד שְׁמַע עֵשָׂו יָת פִּתְגָּמֵי אֲבוּהִי וּצְוַח צִוְחָא רַבָּא וּמְרִירָא עַד לַחֲדָא וַאֲמַר לַאֲבוּהִי בָּרֵכְנִי אַף אֲנָא (נ''י לִי) אַבָּא
verses.ar_en: When Eisov heard his father’s words, he wailed a most loud and bitter cry, and he said to his father, Bless me too, my father.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר עַל אָחוּךְ בְּחָכְמְתָא וְקַבִּיל בִּרְכְּתָךְ
verses.ar_en: [Yitzchok] said, Your brother came with cunning [wisdom] and he took [received] your blessing.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יָאוּת קְרָא שְׁמֵהּ יַעֲקֹב וְכָמַנִי דְּנָן תַּרְתֵּין זִמְנִין יָת בְּכֵירוּתִי נְסִיב וְהָא כְּעַן קַבִּיל בִּרְכְּתִי וַאֲמַר הֲלָא שְׁבַקְתָּ לִי בִּרְכְּתָא
verses.ar_en: [Eisov] said, Is he not rightly called Yaakov? [He is rightly called Yaakov] He has deceived me twice; he took my birthright, and now he has taken [received] my blessing. He said, Have you not saved a blessing for me?

verses.ar_he: וַאֲתֵיב יִצְחָק וַאֲמַר לְעֵשָׂו הָא רַב שַׁוִּתֵּהּ לָךְ (נ''י עִלַּוָּךְ) וְיָת כָּל אֲחוֹהִי יְהָבִית לֵהּ לְעַבְדִּין וְעִיבוּר וַחֲמָר סְעִדְתֵּהּ וְלָךְ הָכָא מָה אֶעְבֵּיד בְּרִי
verses.ar_en: Yitzchok replied and said to Eisov. Behold, I have made him your master, and all his brothers I have given him as slaves. I have sustained him with grain and wine. Where? [Here.] What can I do for you, my son?

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר עֵשָׂו לַאֲבוּהִי הֲבִרְכְּתָא חֲדָא הִיא לָךְ אַבָּא בָּרֵךְ לִי אַף אֲנָא אַבָּא וַאֲרֵים עֵשָׂו קָלֵהּ וּבְכָא
verses.ar_en: Eisov said to his father, Do you have only one blessing, my father? Bless me too, my father, and Eisov raised his voice and wept.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲתֵיב יִצְחָק אֲבוּהִי וַאֲמַר לֵהּ הָא מִטּוּבָא דְאַרְעָא יְהֵא מוֹתְבָךְ וּמִטַּלָּא דִּשְׁמַיָּא מִלְּעֵלָא
verses.ar_en: Yitzchok, his father replied and said to him, Behold the fatness [richness] [goodness] of the earth shall be your dwelling, and of the dew of heaven from above.

verses.ar_he: וְעַל חַרְבָּךְ תֵּיחֵי וְיָת אָחוּךְ תִּפְלָח וִיהֵי כַּד יַעְבְּרוּן בְּנוֹהִי עַל פִּתְגָּמֵי אוֹרַיְתָא וְתַעְדִּי נִירֵהּ מֵעַל צַוְרָךְ
verses.ar_en: You shall live by your sword, and you shall serve your brother. When you have cause to be grieved [When his sons will transgress the words of the Torah], you will throw off his yoke from your neck.

verses.ar_he: וּנְטַר עֵשָׂו דְּבָבוּ לְיַעֲקֹב עַל בִּרְכְּתָא דִּי בָרְכֵהּ אֲבוּהִי וַאֲמַר עֵשָׂו בְּלִבֵּהּ יִקְרְבוּן יוֹמֵי אֶבְלֵי דְאַבָּא וְאֶקְטוֹל יָת יַעֲקֹב אָחִי
verses.ar_en: Eisov hated Yaakov because of the blessing with which his father blessed him, and Eisov said in his heart, The mourning days for my father are approaching. I will then kill my brother, Yaakov.

verses.ar_he: וְאִתְחַוָּה לְרִבְקָה יָת פִּתְגָּמֵי עֵשָׂו בְּרַהּ רַבָּא וּשְׁלָחַת וּקְרַת לְיַעֲקֹב בְּרַהּ זְעֵירָא וַאֲמֶרֶת לֵהּ הָא עֵשָׂו אָחוּךְ כָּמִן לָךְ לְמִקְטְלָךְ
verses.ar_en: Rivkah was informed about the words of Eisov, her older son, and she sent [a messenger] to call Yaakov, her younger son, and she said to him. Behold, your brother Eisov is consoled through you [lying in wait for you], [for he intends] to kill you.

verses.ar_he: וּכְעַן בְּרִי קַבֵּל מִנִּי וְקוּם אִזֵּיל לָךְ לְוַת לָבָן אָחִי לְחָרָן
verses.ar_en: Now my son listen to [accept] me. Get up and flee to Lavan, my brother, to Charan.

verses.ar_he: וְתֵתֵיב עִמֵּהּ יוֹמִין זְעֵירִין עַד דִּיתוּב רוּגְזָא דְאָחוּךְ
verses.ar_en: Remain with him a short time until your brother’s fury has subsided.

verses.ar_he: עַד דִּיתוּב רוּגְזָא דְאָחוּךְ מִנָּךְ וְיִתְנְשֵׁי יָת דִּי עֲבַדְתָּ לֵהּ וְאֶשְׁלַח וְאֶדְבְּרִנָּךְ מִתַּמָּן לְמָה אֶתְכַּל אַף תַּרְוֵיכוֹן יוֹמָא חָד
verses.ar_en: Until your brother’s rage toward you has subsided, and he has forgotten what you did to him. I will then send [for you] and bring you [back] from there. Why should I lose both of you on one day?

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמֶרֶת רִבְקָה לְיִצְחָק עָקִית בְּחַיַּי מִן קֳדָם בְּנַת חִתָּאָה אִם נְסִיב יַעֲקֹב אִתְּתָא מִבְּנַת חִתָּאָה כְאִלֵּין מִבְּנַת אַרְעָא לְמָה לִי חַיִּים
verses.ar_en: Rivkah said to Yitzchok, I am disgusted with my life because of the daughters of Cheis. If Yaakov marries a woman of the daughters of Cheis, like these, from the daughters of the land, what is life [worth] to me.

verses.ar_he: וּקְרָא יִצְחָק לְיַעֲקֹב וּבָרִיךְ יָתֵהּ וּפַקְדֵהּ וַאֲמַר לֵהּ לָא תִסַּב אִתְּתָא מִבְּנַת כְּנָעַן
verses.ar_en: Yitzchok called Yaakov and blessed him. He commanded him and said to him, Do not marry a woman of the daughters of Canaan.

verses.ar_he: קוּם אִזֵּיל לְפַדַּן אֲרָם לְבֵית בְּתוּאֵל אֲבוּהָא דְאִמָּךְ וְסַב לָךְ מִתַּמָּן אִתְּתָא מִבְּנַת לָבָן אֲחוּהָא דְאִמָּךְ
verses.ar_en: Set out and go to Padan Aram, to the house of Besueil, your mother’s father, and marry one of the daughters of Lavan, your mother’s brother.

verses.ar_he: וְאֵל שַׁדַּי יְבָרֵךְ יָתָךְ וְיַפְּשָׁךְ וְיַסְגִּנָּךְ וּתְהֵי לְכִנְשַׁת שִׁבְטִין
verses.ar_en: May the Almighty, Shaddai, bless you, make you fruitful and multiply you. May you become an assembly of peoples [tribes].

verses.ar_he: וְיִתֶּן לָךְ יָת בִּרְכְּתָא דְאַבְרָהָם לָךְ וְלִבְנָיךְ עִמָּךְ לְמֵירְתָךְ יָת אֲרַע תּוֹתָבוּתָךְ דִּי יְהַב יְיָ לְאַבְרָהָם
verses.ar_en: May He give you the blessing of Avraham, to you and to your descendants with you, that you may inherit the land of your dwelling which God gave to Avraham.

verses.ar_he: וּשְׁלַח יִצְחָק יָת יַעֲקֹב וַאֲזַל לְפַדַּן אֲרָם לְוַת לָבָן בַּר בְּתוּאֵל אֲרַמָּאָה אֲחוּהָא דְרִבְקָה אִמֵּהּ דְּיַעֲקֹב וְעֵשָׂו
verses.ar_en: Yitzchok sent Yaakov on his way, and he went to Paddan Aram, to Lavan, son of Besueil the Aramean, the brother of Rivkah, mother of Yaakov and Eisov.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲזָא עֵשָׂו אֲרֵי בָרִיךְ יִצְחָק יָת יַעֲקֹב וְשַׁלַּח יָתֵהּ לְפַדַּן אֲרָם לְמִסַּב לֵהּ מִתַּמָּן אִתְּתָא כַּד בָּרִיךְ יָתֵהּ וּפַקֵּיד עֲלוֹהִי לְמֵימַר לָא תִסַּב אִתְּתָא מִבְּנַת כְּנָעַן
verses.ar_en: Eisov saw that Yitzchok blessed Yaakov, and sent him to Paddan Aram, to find a wife there; and as he blessed him, he commanded him saying, Do not take a wife from the daughters of Canaan.

verses.ar_he: וְקַבִּיל יַעֲקֹב מִן אֲבוּהִי וּמִן אִמֵּהּ וַאֲזַל לְפַדַּן אֲרָם
verses.ar_en: And Yaakov listened to [accepted] his father and mother, and went to Paddan Aram.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲזָא עֵשָׂו אֲרֵי בִישָׁא בְּנַת כְּנָעַן בְּעֵינֵי יִצְחָק אֲבוּהִי
verses.ar_en: Eisov [thus] realized that the daughters of Canaan were evil in the eyes of Yitzchok, his father.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲזַל עֵשָׂו לְוַת יִשְׁמָעֵאל וּנְסִיב יָת מַחֲלַת בַּת יִשְׁמָעֵאל בַּר אַבְרָהָם אֲחָתֵהּ דִּנְבָיוֹת עַל נְשׁוֹהִי לֵהּ לְאִנְתּוּ: ססס
verses.ar_en: Eisov [then] went to Yishmael, and took Mochalas, the daughter of Yishmael, the son of Avraham and sister of Nevayos, in addition to his other wives, for a wife.

verses.ar_he: וּנְפַק יַעֲקֹב מִבְּאֵרָא דְשָׁבַע וַאֲזַל לְחָרָן
verses.ar_en: Yaakov left Beer Sheva and went toward Charan.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲרַע בְּאַתְרָא וּבָת תַּמָּן אֲרֵי עָל שִׁמְשָׁא וּנְסִיב מֵאַבְנֵי אַתְרָא וְשַׁוִּי אִסָדוֹהִי וּשְׁכִיב בְּאַתְרָא הַהוּא
verses.ar_en: He reached the place and spent the night there because the sun had set. He took some of the stones of that place, and arranged them around his head, and lay down [to sleep] in that place.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲלַם וְהָא סֻלְמָא נָעִיץ בְּאַרְעָא וְרֵישֵׁהּ מָטֵי עַד צֵית שְׁמַיָּא וְהָא מַלְאָכַיָּא דַּיְיָ סָלְקִין וְנָחֲתִין בֵּהּ
verses.ar_en: He dreamed, and behold a ladder was set up on [planted in] the earth and the top of it reached toward heaven; and behold angels of Elohim were ascending and descending on it.

verses.ar_he: וְהָא יְקָרָא דַיְיָ מְעַתַּד עִלָווֹהִי וַאֲמַר אֲנָא יְיָ אֱלָהֵהּ דְּאַבְרָהָם אָבוּךְ וֵאלָהֵהּ דְּיִצְחָק אַרְעָא דִּי אַתְּ שְׁכִיב עֲלַהּ לָךְ אֶתְּנִנַּהּ וְלִבְנָיךְ
verses.ar_en: And behold [the Glory of] Adonoy stood over him, and said, I am Adonoy, God of Avraham, your father, and God of Yitzchok. The land upon which you are lying, I will give to you and to your descendants.

verses.ar_he: וִיהוֹן בְּנָיךְ סַגִּיאִין כְּעַפְרָא דְאַרְעָא וְתִתְקֵף לְמַעַרְבָא וּלְמַדִינְחָא וּלְצִפּוּנָא וּלְדָרוֹמָא וְיִתְבָּרְכוּן בְּדִילָךְ כָּל זַרְעֲיַת אַרְעָא וּבְדִיל בְּנָיךְ
verses.ar_en: Your descendants shall be [many] as the dust of the earth. You shall spread [be strong] to the west, to the east, to the north and to the south. Through [Because of] you shall be blessed all the families of the earth, and through [because of] your descendants.

verses.ar_he: וְהָא מֵימְרִי בְּסַעְדָךְ וְאֶטְרִנָךְ בְּכָל אֲתַר דִּי תְהַךְ וַאֲתֵיבִנָּךְ לְאַרְעָא הָדָא אֲרֵי לָא אֶשְׁבְּקִנָּךְ עַד דִּי אֶעְבֵּיד יָת דִּי מַלֵּלִית לָךְ
verses.ar_en: Behold, I am with you [My Word is your support], and I will guard you wherever [every place] you go, and I will bring you back to this land. I will not forsake you until I have done that which I have spoken for you.

verses.ar_he: וְאִתְּעַר יַעֲקֹב מִשִּׁנְתֵּהּ וַאֲמַר בְּקוּשְׁטָּא (אִית) יְקָרָא דַיְיָ שָׁרֵי בְּאַתְרָא הָדֵין וַאֲנָא לָא הֲוֵיתִי יְדָע
verses.ar_en: Yaakov awoke from his sleep, and said, In truth, [the Glory of] Adonoy is [dwells] in this place, and I did not know it [would not have known it].

verses.ar_he: וּדְחִיל וַאֲמַר מָה דְחִילוּ אַתְרָא הָדֵין לֵית דֵּין אֲתַר הֶדְיוֹט אֶלָהֵין אֲתַר דְּרַעֲוָא בֵהּ מִן קֳדָם יְיָ וְדֵין תְּרַע קֳבֵל שְׁמַיָּא
verses.ar_en: He was afraid and said, How awesome is this place! This is none other than the house of Elohim [not a regular place but a place where it is the will of Elohim to receive prayers], and this is the gate of [opposite] heaven.

verses.ar_he: וְאַקְדֵים יַעֲקֹב בְּצַפְרָא וּנְסִיב יָת אַבְנָא דִי שַׁוִּי אִסָדוֹהִי וְשַׁוִּי יָתַהּ קָמָא וַאֲרִיק מִשְׁחָא עַל רֵישֵׁהּ
verses.ar_en: Yaakov rose early in the morning and took the stone that he had placed at his head; and he set it as a monument, and poured oil on its top.

verses.ar_he: וּקְרָא יָת שְׁמָא דְאַתְרָא הַהוּא בֵּית אֵל וּבְרַם לוּז שְׁמָא דְקַרְתָּא בְּקַדְמֵיתָא
verses.ar_en: He named that place Beis Eil, but Luz was the original name of the city.

verses.ar_he: וְקַיִּים יַעֲקֹב קְיָם לְמֵימָר אִם יְהֵא מֵימְרָא דַּיְיָ בְּסַעְדִי וְיִטְרִינַנִּי בְּאָרְחָא הָדֵין דִּי אֲנָא אָזֵל וְיִתֶּן לִי לַחֲמָא (נ''י לְחֵם) לְמֵיכַל וּכְסוּ לְמִלְבָּשׁ
verses.ar_en: Yaakov made a vow, saying, If [the Word of] Elohim will be with me [my support], and guards me on this path that I am going, and gives me bread to eat and clothing to wear;

verses.ar_he: וְאֵתוּב בִּשְׁלַם לְבֵית אַבָּא וִיהֵא מֵימְרָא דַיְיָ לִי לֵאלָהָא
verses.ar_en: And if I return in peace to my father’s house, and [the Word of] Adonoy will be my God;

verses.ar_he: וְאַבְנָא הָדָא דִי שַׁוֵּיתִי קָמָא תְּהֵי דִי אֵהֵי פָלַח עֲלַהּ קֳדָם יְיָ וְכֹל דִּי תִתֶּן לִי חַד מִן עַשְׂרָא אַפְרְשִׁנֵּהּ קֳדָמָךְ
verses.ar_en: [Then] this stone which I have set [as] a monument will become a House of God [place where I will worship upon it before God], and of all that You give, I will surely give a tenth to [before] You.

verses.ar_he: וּנְטַל יַעֲקֹב רַגְלוֹהִי (נ''י רִיגְלוֹהִי) וַאֲזַל לַאֲרַע בְּנֵי מַדִינְחָא
verses.ar_en: Yaakov [then] lifted his feet and went toward the land of the people of the East.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲזָא וְהָא בֵירָא בְחַקְלָא וְהָא תַמָּן תְּלָתָא עֶדְרִין דְּעָן רְבֵעִין עֲלַהּ אֲרֵי מִן בֵּירָא הַהִיא מַשְׁקָן עֲדָרַיָּא וְאַבְנָא רַבְּתָא עַל פּוּמָא דְבֵירָא
verses.ar_en: He looked and [saw] a well in the field; and behold there were three flocks of sheep lying beside it, for from that well the flocks are watered. There was a large stone over the mouth of the well.

verses.ar_he: וּמִתְכַּנְשִׁין לְתַמָּן כָּל עֲדָרַיָּא וּמְגַנְדְּרִין יָת אַבְנָא מֵעַל פּוּמָא דְבֵירָא וּמַשְׁקָן יָת עָנָא וּמְתִיבִין יָת אַבְנָא עַל פּוּמָא דְבֵירָא לְאַתְרַהּ
verses.ar_en: When all the flocks would gather, [the shepherds] would roll the stone from the well’s mouth, and water the sheep. They would [then] return the stone to its place over the mouth of the well.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לְהוֹן יַעֲקֹב אַחַי מְנָן אַתּוּן וַאֲמָרוּ מֵחָרָן אֲנָחְנָא
verses.ar_en: Yaakov said to them, My brothers, from where do you come? They said, We are from Charan.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לְהוֹן הַיְדַעְתּוּן יָת לָבָן בַּר נָחוֹר וַאֲמָרוּ יְדַעְנָן
verses.ar_en: He said to them, Do you know Lavan, the son of Nachor? They said, We know him.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לְהוֹן הַשְׁלַם לֵהּ וַאֲמָרוּ שְׁלַם וְהָא רָחֵל בְּרַתֵּהּ אַתְיָא עִם עָנָא
verses.ar_en: He said to them, Is he doing well? They said, He is doing well. Behold Rochel, his daughter, is coming with the sheep.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר הָא עוֹד יוֹמָא סַגִי לָא עִדַן לְמִכְנַשׁ בְּעִיר אַשְׁקוּ עָנָא וְאִזִילוּ רְעוּ
verses.ar_en: He said to them, The day is yet long, it is not yet time for the sheep to be gathered, water the sheep and go pasture them.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמָרוּ לָא נִכּוּל עַד דִי יִתְכַּנְשִׁין כָּל עֲדָרַיָּא וִיגַנְדְרוּן יָת אַבְנָא מֵעַל פוּמָא דְבֵירָא וְנַשְׁקֵי עָנָא
verses.ar_en: They said, We cannot [do so] until all the flocks have gathered and [the shepherds] roll the stone from the mouth of the well. Then we can water the sheep.

verses.ar_he: עַד דְהוּא מְמַלֵל עִמְהוֹן וְרָחֵל אָתַת עִם עָנָא דִי לַאֲבוּהָ אֲרֵי רָעִיתָא הִיא
verses.ar_en: While he was still speaking with them, Rochel came with her father’s sheep, for she was a shepherdess.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה כַּד חֲזָא יַעֲקֹב יָת רָחֵל בַּת לָבָן אֲחוּהָא דְאִמֵהּ וְיָת עָנָא דְלָבָן אֲחוּהָא דְאִמֵהּ וּקְרֵב יַעֲקֹב וּגַנְדַר יָת אַבְנָא מֵעַל פּוּמָא דְבֵירָא וְאַשְׁקֵי יָת עָנָא דְלָבָן אֲחוּהָא דְאִמֵהּ
verses.ar_en: When Yaakov saw Rochel, the daughter of Lavan, his mother’s brother, with the sheep of Lavan, his mother’s brother, he stepped near and rolled the stone from the mouth of the well. He then watered the sheep of Lavan, his mother’s brother.

verses.ar_he: וּנְשַׁק יַעֲקֹב לְרָחֵל וַאֲרֵם יָת קָלֵהּ וּבְכָא
verses.ar_en: Yaakov kissed Rochel and cried in a loud voice.

verses.ar_he: וְחַוִּי יַעֲקֹב לְרָחֵל אֲרֵי בַר אֲחַת אָבוּהָא הוּא וַאֲרֵי בַר רִבְקָה הוּא וּרְהָטַת וְחַוִּיאַת לְאָבוּהָא
verses.ar_en: Yaakov told Rochel that he was a relative of her father [the son of her father’s sister], that he was the son of Rivkah. She ran and told her father.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה כַּד שְׁמַע לָבָן יָת שֵׁמַע יַעֲקֹב בַּר אֲחָתֵהּ וּרְהַט לְקַדָמוּתֵהּ וְגַפֵּף לֵהּ וְנַשִׁיק לֵהּ וְאַעֲלֵהּ לְבֵיתֵהּ וְאִשְׁתָּעִי לְלָבָן יָת כָּל פִּתְגָמַיָּא הָאִלֵּין
verses.ar_en: When Lavan heard the news of Yaakov, his sister’s son, he ran to greet him. He embraced him and kissed him, and brought him to his house. [Yaakov] told Lavan all that had happened.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לֵהּ לָבָן בְּרַם קָרִיבִי וּבִשְׂרִי אָתְּ וִיתֵיב עִמֵּהּ יְרַח יוֹמִין
verses.ar_en: Lavan said to him, Nevertheless, you are my bone [relative] and flesh. [Yaakov] lived with him for a month.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לָבָן לְיַעֲקֹב הֲמִדְּאָחִי אַתְּ וְתִפְלְחִנַּנִּי מַגָּן חַוִּי לִי מָה אַגְרָךְ
verses.ar_en: Lavan said to Yaakov, Just because you are my relative, must you work for me without pay? Tell me, [what should] your wages [be]?

verses.ar_he: וּלְלָבָן תַּרְתֵּין בְּנָן שׁוּם רַבְּתָא לֵאָה וְשׁוּם זְעֶרְתָּא רָחֵל
verses.ar_en: Lavan had two daughters. The name of the older one was Leah, and the name of the younger one was Rochel.

verses.ar_he: וְעֵינֵי לֵאָה יָאֲיָן וְרָחֵל הֲוַת שַׁפִּירָא בְרֵיוָא וְיָאֲיָא בְחֶזְוָא
verses.ar_en: The eyes of Leah were tender [beautiful]. Rochel was of beautiful form and of beautiful appearance.

verses.ar_he: וּרְחֵם יַעֲקֹב יָת רָחֵל וַאֲמַר אֶפְלְחִנָּךְ שְׁבַע שְׁנִין בְּרָחֵל בְּרַתָּךְ זְעֶרְתָּא
verses.ar_en: Yaakov loved Rochel. and he said, I will work for you seven years for Rochel, your younger daughter.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לָבָן טַב דְּאֶתֵּן יָתַהּ לָךְ מִדְּאֶתֵּן יָתַהּ לִגְבַר אָחֳרָן תִּיב עִמִּי
verses.ar_en: Lavan said, Better that I give her to you than I should give her to another man. [Remain] living with me.

verses.ar_he: וּפְלַח יַעֲקֹב בְּרָחֵל שְׁבַע שְׁנִין וַהֲווֹ בְעֵינוֹהִי כְּיוֹמִין זְעִירִין כַּד רְחֵים יָתַהּ
verses.ar_en: Yaakov worked seven years for Rochel, but they seemed to him like a few days, so much did he love her.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יַעֲקֹב לְלָבָן הַב יָת אִתְּתִי אֲרֵי אַשְׁלֵמִית יוֹמֵי פָלְחָנִי וְאֵעוֹל לְוָתַהּ
verses.ar_en: Yaakov said to Lavan, Give me my wife, for my term [of labor] is completed; and thus I will consummate the marriage with her.

verses.ar_he: וּכְנַשׁ לָבָן יָת כָּל אֲנָשֵׁי אַתְרָא וַעֲבַד מִשְׁתְּיָא
verses.ar_en: Lavan gathered all the local people and he made a [wedding] feast.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה בְרַמְשָׁא וּדְבַר יָת לֵאָה בְרַתֵּהּ וְאָעֵיל יָתַהּ לְוָתֵהּ וְעַל לְוָתַהּ
verses.ar_en: When it was evening, he took Leah, his daughter, and brought her to him [Yaakov]. He consummated the marriage with her.

verses.ar_he: וִיהַב לָבָן לַהּ יָת זִלְפָּה אַמְתֵהּ לְלֵאָה בְרַתֵּהּ לְאַמְהוּ
verses.ar_en: Lavan gave Zilpah, his servant to her, to Leah, his daughter as a handmaid.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה בְצַפְרָא וְהָא הִיא לֵאָה וַאֲמַר לְלָבָן מָה דָּא עֲבַדְתָּ לִּי הֲלָא בְרָחֵל פְּלָחִית עִמָּךְ וּלְמָא שַׁקַּרְתָּ בִּי
verses.ar_en: When it was morning, behold it was Leah! He [Yaakov] said to Lavan, What have you done to me? Did I not work with you for Rochel? Why did you deceive me?

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לָבָן לָא יִתְעֲבֵד כְּדֵין בְּאַתְרָנָא לְמִתַּן זְעֶרְתָּא קֳדָם רַבְּתָא
verses.ar_en: Lavan said, It is not done so in our place, to give the younger [daughter in marriage] before the firstborn.

verses.ar_he: אַשְׁלִים שְׁבוּעֲתָא דְדָא וְנִתֵּן לָךְ אַף יָת דָּא בְּפָלְחָנָא דִּי תִפְלַח עִמִּי עוֹד שְׁבַע שְׁנִין אָחֳרָנִין
verses.ar_en: Complete the [marriage] week for this one. We will then give you the other also—in return for the work that you will do with me for another seven years.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד יַעֲקֹב כֵּן וְאַשְׁלֵים שְׁבוּעֲתָא דְדָא וִיהַב לֵהּ יָת רָחֵל בְּרַתֵּהּ לֵהּ לְאִנְתּוּ
verses.ar_en: Yaakov did so, and he completed the [marriage] week for this one [Leah]. He [Lavan] then gave Rochel, his daughter to him as a wife.

verses.ar_he: וִיהַב לָבָן לְרָחֵל בְּרַתֵּהּ יָת בִּלְהָה אַמְתֵהּ לַהּ לְאַמְהוּ
verses.ar_en: To his daughter, Rochel, Lavan gave his servant Bilhah, to be her handmaid.

verses.ar_he: וְעַל אַף לְּוַת רָחֵל וּרְחֵים אַף יָת רָחֵל מִלֵּאָה וּפְלַח עִמֵּהּ עוֹד שְׁבַע שְׁנִין אָחֳרָנִין
verses.ar_en: He [Yaakov] also consummated his marriage with Rochel. He loved Rochel more than Leah, and he worked with [Lavan] additionally, another seven years.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲזָא יְיָ אֲרֵי שְׂנִיאֲתָא לֵאָה וִיהַב לַהּ עִדּוּי וְרָחֵל עַקְרָא
verses.ar_en: Adonoy saw that Leah was the hated one, and He opened her womb [allowed her to conceive]. Rochel remained barren.

verses.ar_he: וְעַדִּיאַת לֵּאָה וִילִידַת בָּר וּקְרַת שְׁמֵהּ רְאוּבֵן אֲרֵי אֲמֶרֶת אֲרֵי גְלִי קֳדָם יְיָ עֻלְבּוֹנִי אֲרֵי כְעַן יְרַחֲמִנַנִי בַעֲלִי
verses.ar_en: Leah conceived and gave birth to a son. She named him Reuvein, as she said, Adonoy has seen my affliction [was revealed before Adonoy]; for now my husband will love me.

verses.ar_he: וְעַדִּיאַת עוֹד וִילִידַת בָּר וַאֲמֶרֶת אֲרֵי שְׁמִיעַ קֳדָם יְיָ אֲרֵי שְׂנִיאֲתָא אֲנָא וִיהַב לִי אַף יָת דֵּין וּקְרַת שְׁמֵהּ שִׁמְעוֹן
verses.ar_en: She conceived again and gave birth to a son. She said, Since Adonoy [it was] heard [before Adonoy] that I am the hated one, He also gave me this one, and she named him Shimon.

verses.ar_he: וְעַדִּיאַת עוֹד וִילִידַת בָּר וַאֲמֶרֶת הָדָא זִמְנָא יִתְחַבַּר לִי בַעֲלִי אֲרֵי יְלֵידִית לֵהּ תְּלָתָא בְנִין עַל כֵּן קְרָא שְׁמֵהּ לֵוִי
verses.ar_en: She conceived again and gave birth to a son. She said, This time my husband will become attached to me, for I have born him three sons. He therefore named him Leivi.

verses.ar_he: וְעַדִּיאַת עוֹד וִילִידַת בָּר וַאֲמֶרֶת הָדָא זִמְנָא אוֹדֶה קֳדָם יְיָ עַל כֵּן קְרַת שְׁמֵהּ יְהוּדָה וְקָמַת מִלְּמֵילַד
verses.ar_en: She conceived again and gave birth to a son. She said, This time I will [give] praise [before] Adonoy. She therefore named him Yehudah. She then stopped giving birth.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲזַת רָחֵל אֲרֵי לָא יְלִידַת לְיַעֲקֹב וְקַנִּיאַת רָחֵל בַּאֲחָתַהּ וַאֲמֶרֶת לְיַעֲקֹב הַב לִי בְנִין וְאִם לָא מֵיתָא אֲנָא
verses.ar_en: Rochel saw that she was not bearing children to Yaakov. Rochel became jealous of her sister, and she said to Yaakov, Give me children; if not I am [considered] dead.

verses.ar_he: וּתְקֵיף רוּגְזָא דְיַעֲקֹב בְּרָחֵל וַאֲמַר הָא מִנִּי אַתְּ בַּעְיָא הֲלָא מִן קֳדָם יְיָ תִּבְעִין דִּי מְנַע מִנִּיךְ וַלְדָא דִּמְעִין
verses.ar_en: Yaakov became very angry with Rochel, and he said, Am I in God’s place? [Are you asking me? Is it not from before God that you should ask?] [It is He] who has withheld from you the fruit of the womb.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמֶרֶת הָא אַמְתִי בִלְהָה עוּל לְוָתַהּ וּתְלִיד וַאֲנָא אֱרַבֵּי וְאִתְבְּנֵי אַף אֲנָא מִנַּהּ
verses.ar_en: She said, Here is my handmaid, Bilhah, consummate a marriage with her. Let her give birth upon my knees [and I will rear them], and I too will have a son [be built up] through her.

verses.ar_he: וִיהָבַת לֵהּ יָת בִּלְהָה אַמְתַהּ לְאִנְתּוּ וְעַל לְוָתַהּ יַעֲקֹב
verses.ar_en: She gave him Bilhah, her handmaid, as a wife and Yaakov consummated the marriage with her.

verses.ar_he: וְעַדִּיאַת בִּלְהָה וִילִידַת לְיַעֲקֹב בַּר
verses.ar_en: Bilhah conceived and bore Yaakov a son.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמֶרֶת רָחֵל דְּנַנִּי יְיָ וְאַף קַבִּיל צְלוֹתִי וִיהַב לִי בַּר עַל כֵּן קְרַת שְׁמֵהּ דָּן
verses.ar_en: Rochel said, Elohim has judged me. He has also heard my voice [accepted my prayer], and has given me a son. She therefore named him Don.

verses.ar_he: וְעַדִּיאַת עוֹד וִילִידַת בִּלְהָה אַמְתָא דְרָחֵל בָּר תִּנְיָן לְיַעֲקֹב
verses.ar_en: She conceived again, and Bilhah, Rochel’s handmaid, bore a second son to Yaakov.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמֶרֶת רָחֵל קַבִּיל יְיָ בָּעוּתִי בְּאִתְחַנָּנוּתִי בִּצְלוֹתִי חֲמֵידַת דִּיהֵי לִי וְלַד כַּאֲחָתִי אַף אִתְיְהִיב לִי וּקְרַת שְׁמֵהּ נַפְתָּלִי
verses.ar_en: Rochel said, With Elohim’s bonds, I have been joined to my sister, and I have also prevailed [Elohim accepted my request, when I pleaded in my prayer, I desired that I would have offspring like my sister, it was also given to me]. She [therefore] called him Naftali.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲזַת לֵּאָה אֲרֵי קָמַת מִלְּמֵילַד וּדְבָרַת יָת זִלְפָּה אַמְתַהּ וִיהָבַת יָתַהּ לְיַעֲקֹב לְאִנְתּוּ
verses.ar_en: Leah realized that she was no longer bearing children. She [therefore] took Zilpah, her handmaid, and gave her to Yaakov as a wife.

verses.ar_he: וִילִידַת זִלְפָּה אַמְתָא דְלֵאָה לְיַעֲקֹב בָּר
verses.ar_en: Zilpah, Leah’s handmaid, bore Yaakov a son.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמֶרֶת לֵאָה אֲתָא גָד וּקְרַת יָת שְׁמֵהּ גָּד
verses.ar_en: Leah said, Unexpected success has come, and she named him Gad.

verses.ar_he: וִילִידַת זִלְפָּה אַמְתָא דְלֵאָה בָּר תִּנְיָן לְיַעֲקֹב
verses.ar_en: Zilpah, Leah’s handmaid bore a second son to Yaakov.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמֶרֶת לֵאָה תֻּשְׁבַּחְתָּא הֲוַת לִי אֲרֵי בְכֵן יְשַׁבְּחֻנַּנִּי נְשַׁיָּא וּקְרַת יָת שְׁמֵהּ אָשֵׁר
verses.ar_en: Leah said, It is in my good fortune that daughters [women] will consider me fortunate. [Praise is mine, because women will praise me from now.] She named him Asher.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲזַל רְאוּבֵן בְּיוֹמֵי חֲצַד חִטִּין וְאַשְׁכַּח יַבְרוּחִין בְּחַקְלָא וְאַיְתִי יָתְהוֹן לְלֵאָה אִמֵּהּ וַאֲמֶרֶת רָחֵל לְלֵאָה הָבִי כְעַן לִי מִיַּבְרוּחֵי דִּבְרִיךְ
verses.ar_en: Reuvein went in the days of the wheat harvest, and found jasmine flowers in the field. He brought them to Leah, his mother. Rochel said to Leah, Please [Now] give me some of your son’s jasmine flowers.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמֶרֶת לַהּ הַזְעֵיר דִּדְבַרְתְּ יָת בַּעְלִי וְתִסְּבִין אַף יָת יַבְרוּחֵי דִּבְרִי וַאֲמֶרֶת רָחֵל בְּכֵן יִשְׁכּוּב עִמָּךְ בְּלֵילְיָא חֳלַף יַבְרוּחֵי דִּבְרִיךְ
verses.ar_en: She [Leah] said to her, Isn’t it enough that you took my husband? Would you also take my son’s jasmine flowers? Rochel said, Therefore, he shall be with you tonight in exchange for your son’s jasmine flowers.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲתָא (נ''י וְעַל) יַעֲקֹב מִן חַקְלָא בְּרַמְשָׁא וּנְפָקַת לֵאָה לְקַדָּמוּתֵהּ וַאֲמֶרֶת לְוָתִי תֵיעוֹל אֲרֵי מֵיגַר אֲגַרְתִּיךְ בְּיַבְרוּחֵי דִּבְרִי וּשְׁכִיב עִמַּהּ בְּלֵילְיָא הוּא
verses.ar_en: Yaakov came from the field in the evening, and Leah went out to meet him. She said, You will come to me, for I have hired you with my son’s jasmine flowers, and he was with her at night.

verses.ar_he: וְקַבִּיל יְיָ צְלוֹתַהּ דְּלֵאָה וְעַדִּיאַת וִילִידַת לְיַעֲקֹב בַּר חֲמִישָׁאֵי
verses.ar_en: Elohim perceived [accepted] Leah’s [wish] [prayer]. She conceived and bore [her] fifth son to Yaakov.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמֶרֶת לֵאָה יְהַב יְיָ אַגְרִי דִּי יְהָבִית אַמְתִי לְבַעְלִי וּקְרַת שְׁמֵהּ יִשָּׂשׂכָר
verses.ar_en: Leah said, Elohim has given me my reward because I gave my handmaid to my husband. She named him Yissachar.

verses.ar_he: וְעַדִּיאַת עוֹד לֵאָה וִילִידַת בַּר שְׁתִיתָאֵי לְיַעֲקֹב
verses.ar_en: Leah conceived again and bore [her] sixth son to Yaakov.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמֶרֶת לֵאָה יְהַב יְיָ יָתֵהּ לִי חָלַק טַב הָדָא זִמְנָא יְהֵי מְדוֹרֵהּ דְּבַעְלִי לְוָתִי אֲרֵי יְלֵידִית לֵהּ שִׁתָּא בְנִין וּקְרַת יָת שְׁמֵהּ זְבֻלוּן
verses.ar_en: Leah said, Elohim has given [me] a goodly portion. Now my husband will make his [main] home with me, for I have borne him six sons. She named him Zevulun.

verses.ar_he: וּבָתַר כֵּן יְלִידַת בְּרַתָּא וּקְרַת יָת שְׁמַהּ דִּינָה
verses.ar_en: Afterwards she gave birth to a daughter, and named her Deenah.

verses.ar_he: וְעַל דּוּכְרָנָא דְרָחֵל קֳדָם יְיָ וְקַבִּיל צְלוֹתַהּ יְיָ וִיהַב לַהּ עִדּוּי
verses.ar_en: Elohim remembered Rochel [The remembrance of Rochel came before Elohim, and Elohim perceived her plight] [accepted her prayer] and opened her womb [allowed her to conceive].

verses.ar_he: וְעַדִּיאַת וִילִידַת בָּר וַאֲמֶרֶת כְּנַשׁ יְיָ יָת חִסּוּדִי
verses.ar_en: She conceived and gave birth to a son. She said, Elohim has removed my shame.

verses.ar_he: וּקְרַת יָת שְׁמֵהּ יוֹסֵף לְמֵימָר יוֹסֵף יְיָ לִי בַּר אָחֳרָן
verses.ar_en: She named him Yoseif, saying, May Adonoy add to me another son.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה כַּד יְלִידַת רָחֵל יָת יוֹסֵף וַאֲמַר יַעֲקֹב לְלָבָן שַׁלְּחַנִּי וְאֵיהַךְ לְאַתְרִי וּלְאַרְעִי
verses.ar_en: When Rochel had given birth to Yoseif, Yaakov said to Lavan, Send me on my way, and I will go to my own place and to my homeland.

verses.ar_he: הַב יָת נְשַׁי וְיָת בְּנַי דִּי פְלָחִית יָתָךְ בְּהֵן וְאֵזִיל אֲרֵי אַתְּ יְדַעְתָּ יָת פָּלְחָנִי דִּי פְלָחִתָּךְ
verses.ar_en: Give me [permission to take] my wives and my children, for whom I worked for you, and I will go; for you know my work that I did for you.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לֵהּ לָבָן אִם כְּעַן אַשְׁכָּחִית רַחֲמִין קֳדָמָךְ נַסֵּיתִי וּבָרְכַנִי יְיָ בְּדִילָךְ
verses.ar_en: Lavan said to him, If [now] I have found favor in your eyes, I have divined [determined] that Adonoy has blessed me because of you.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמָר פָּרֵישׁ אַגְרָךְ עֲלַי וְאֶתֵּן
verses.ar_en: He said, Set your wage for me, and I will give it.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לֵהּ אַתְּ יְדַעְתָּ יָת דִּי פְלָחִתָּךְ וְיָת דַּהֲוָה בְעִירָךְ עִמִּי
verses.ar_en: He [Yaakov] said to him, You know how I worked for you, and how your livestock were with me.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי זְעֵיר דִּי הֲוָה לָךְ קֳדָמַי וּתְקֵיף לְמִסְגֵּי וּבְרִיךְ יְיָ יָתָךְ בְּדִילִי וּכְעַן אֵימָתַי אֶעְבֵּיד אַף אֲנָא לְבֵיתִי
verses.ar_en: For the little you had before I came here has increased and has become a multitude. Adonoy has blessed you with my coming [for my sake]. Now when will I also do something for my own house?

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר מָה אֶתֵּן לָךְ וַאֲמַר יַעֲקֹב לָא תִתֶּן לִי מִדַּעַם אִם תַּעְבֶּד לִי פִּתְגָּמָא הָדֵין אֱתוּב אֶרְעֵי עָנָךְ אֶטָּר
verses.ar_en: He [Lavan] said, What shall I give you? Yaakov said, Do not give me anything—if you do this thing for me. I will continue to tend your flock and guard it.

verses.ar_he: אֶעְבַּר בְּכָל עָנָךְ יוֹמָא דֵּין הַעֲדֵי (נ''י אַעְדִּי) מִתַּמָּן כָּל אִמָּר נְמוֹר וּרְקוֹעַ וְכָל אִמָּר שְׁחוּם בְּאִמְרַיָא וּרְקוֹעַ וּנְמוֹר בְּעִזַיָא וִיהֵי אַגְרִי
verses.ar_en: I will go through all your flocks this day. I will remove from them every lamb that is speckled, or spotted, and every dark one among the sheep, and every goat that is spotted and speckled. That [kind] will be my wage.

verses.ar_he: וְתַסְהֵד בִּי זָכוּתִי בְּיוֹם דִּמְחָר אֲרֵי תֵיעוֹל עַל אַגְרִי קֳדָמָךְ כֹּל דִּי לֵיתוֹהִי נְמוֹר וּרְקוֹעַ בְּעִזַּיָּא וּשְׁחוּם בְּאִמְרַיָא גְּנוּבָא הוּא עִמִּי
verses.ar_en: My righteousness shall testify for me in the future when it comes before you regarding my wage. Any goat which is not speckled or spotted, and any sheep that is [not] dark, is stolen [if it is] in my possession.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לָבָן בְּרַם לְוַי יְהֵי כְפִתְגָּמָךְ
verses.ar_en: Lavan said, Agreed, may it be as you say.

verses.ar_he: וְאַעְדִּי בְיוֹמָא הַהוּא יָת תְּיָשַׁיָא רְגוֹלַיָא וּרְקוֹעַיָא וְיָת כָּל עִזַּיָא נְמוֹרְתָא וּרְקוֹעֲתָא כֹּל דִּי חִוָּר בֵּהּ וְכָל דִּשְׁחוּם בְּאִמְּרַיָּא וִיהַב בְּיַד בְּנוֹהִי
verses.ar_en: That day he [Lavan] removed the he-goats that were ringed and spotted, and all the she-goats that were speckled and spotted, everyone that had white in it, and all the dark ones among the sheep; and he gave them to his sons.

verses.ar_he: וְשַׁוִּי מַהֲלַךְ תְּלָתָא יוֹמִין בֵּינוֹהִי וּבֵין יַעֲקֹב וְיַעֲקֹב רָעֵי יָת עָנָא דְלָבָן דְּאִשְׁתָּאֳרָן
verses.ar_en: He placed a three days journey between himself and Yaakov. Yaakov tended Lavan’s remaining flocks.

verses.ar_he: וּנְסִיב לֵהּ יַעֲקֹב חוּטְרִין דִּלְבָן רַטִּיבִין וִּדְלוּז וְדִדְלוּף וְקַלִּיף בְּהוֹן קִלְפִין חִוָּרִין קִלּוּף חִוָּר דִּי עַל חוּטְרַיָּא
verses.ar_en: Yaakov took rods of poplar that were fresh, hazel and chestnut [trees], and peeled white stripes in them by uncovering the white which is in the rods.

verses.ar_he: וְדָעִיץ יָת חוּטְרַיָּא דִּי קַלִּיף בִּרְהָטַיָּא אֲתַר בֵּית שַׁקְיָא דְמַיָּא אֲתַר דְּאָתָן (נ''י דְּאָתְיָן) עָנָא לְמִשְׁתֵּי לְקִבְלֵיהוֹן דְּעָנָא וּמִתְיַחֲמָן בְּמֵיתֵיהוֹן לְמִשְׁתֵּי
verses.ar_en: He stuck [inserted] the rods that he had peeled into the ducts of the [place of the] watering troughs [the place] where the flock [ewes] came to drink, facing the flock [rams]; that they should become heated when they came to drink.

verses.ar_he: וְאִתְיַחֲמָא עָנָא בְּחוּטְרַיָּא וִילִידָא עָנָא רְגוֹלִין נְמוֹרִין וּרְקוֹעִין
verses.ar_en: The flock [sheep] became heated [and mated] before the rods, and the flock [sheep] gave birth to ringed, speckled and spotted [offspring].

verses.ar_he: וְאִמְּרַיָּא אַפְרֵשׁ יַעֲקֹב וִיהַב בְּרֵישׁ עָנָא כָּל דִּרְגוֹל וְכָל דִּשְׁחוּם בְּעָנָא דְלָבָן וְשַׁוִּי לֵהּ עֶדְרִין בִּלְחוֹדוֹהִי וְלָא עֲרֵבִנּוּן עִם עָנָא דְלָבָן
verses.ar_en: Yaakov separated the lambs. He set the faces [at the head] of the flock [sheep] toward [all] the ringed ones and all the dark ones; [he did so] with Lavan’s flocks. He formed separate flocks of his own, and did not set [mix] them with Lavan’s flocks.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוֵי בְּכָל עִדַּן דְּמִתְיַחֲמָן עָנָא מְבַכַּרְתָּא וּמְשַׁוִּי יַעֲקֹב יָת חוּטְרַיָּא לְעֵינֵי עָנָא בִּרְהָטַיָּא לְיַחָמוּתְהוֹן בְּחוּטְרַיָּא
verses.ar_en: When the early-bearing flock [sheep] were heated [to mate], Yaakov placed the rods before the flock’s [sheep’s] eyes at the ducts, so they would be in heat among the rods.

verses.ar_he: וּבְלַקִּישׁוּת עָנָא לָא מְשַׁוֵּי וַהֲווֹ לַקִּישָׁא לְלָבָן וּבַכִּירַיָּא לְיַעֲקֹב
verses.ar_en: But when the flock [sheep] were late-bearing, he did not place [the rods before them]. Thus the late-bearing ones were Lavan’s, and the early-bearing ones became the possession of Yaakov.

verses.ar_he: וּתְקֵיף גַּבְרָא לַחֲדָא לַחֲדָא וַהֲווֹ לֵהּ עָן סַגִּיאָן וְאַמְהָן וְעַבְדִּין וְגַמְלִין וַחֲמָרִין
verses.ar_en: The man became tremendously prosperous. He had multipying flocks, female slaves and male slaves, camels and donkeys.

verses.ar_he: וּשְׁמַע יָת פִתְגָּמֵי בְנֵי לָבָן דְּאָמְרִין נְסִיב יַעֲקֹב יָת כָּל דִּי לְאָבוּנָא וּמִדִּי לְאָבוּנָא קְנָא יָת כָּל נִכְסַיָּא הָדֵין
