verses.ar_en: But the land of the priests he did not buy, because the priests had an allotment from Pharaoh. They ate the allotment that Pharaoh gave them, and therefore they did not sell their land.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יוֹסֵף לְעַמָּא הָא זְבֵנִית יָתְכוֹן יוֹמָא דֵּין וְיָת אַרְעֲכוֹן לְפַרְעֹה הֵא לְכוֹן בַּר זַרְעָא וְתִזְרְעוּן יָת אַרְעָא
verses.ar_en: Yoseif said to the people, Behold, I have today purchased you and your lands for Pharaoh. Here is seed, plant [it in] the soil.

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי בְּאָעוֹלֵי עֲלַלְתָּא וְתִתְּנוּן חַד מִן חַמְשָׁא לְפַרְעֹה וְאַרְבַּע חֳלָקִין יְהֵא לְכוֹן לְבַר זְרַע חַקְלָא וּלְמֵיכַלְכוֹן וְלֶאֱנַשׁ בָתֵּיכוֹן וּלְמֵיכַל לְטַפְלְכוֹן
verses.ar_en: When it produces [the produce is gathered] you must give a fifth to Pharaoh. Four parts shall be yours for seed for your fields and for your food, and for those [the people] of your households, and for food for your little ones.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמָרוּ קַיִּמְתָּנָא נִשְׁכַּח רַחֲמִין בְּעֵינֵי רִבּוֹנִי וּנְהֵי עַבְדִּין לְפַרְעֹה
verses.ar_en: They said, You have saved our lives. May we find favor in the eyes of my master, and we will be slaves to Pharaoh.

verses.ar_he: וְשַׁוִּי יָתַהּ יוֹסֵף לִגְזֵרָא עַד יוֹמָא הָדֵין עַל אַרְעָא דְמִצְרַיִם דִּיהוֹן יָהֲבִין חַד מִן חַמְשָׁא לְפַרְעֹה לְחוֹד אַרְעָא דְכֻמָּרַיָּא בִּלְחוֹדֵיהוֹן לָא הֲוַת לְפַרְעֹה
verses.ar_en: Yoseif enacted a statute over the land of Egypt to this day, that a fifth belongs [they should give a fifth] to Pharaoh. Except the land of the priests alone, did not belong to Pharaoh.

verses.ar_he: וִיתֵיב יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּאַרְעָא דְמִצְרַיִם בְּאַרְעָא דְגשֶׁן וְאַחֲסִינוּ בַהּ וּנְפִישׁוּ וּסְגִיאוּ לַחֲדָא
verses.ar_en: Yisrael lived in the land of Egypt, in the land of Goshen. They acquired property there. They were fruitful and [their population] increased greatly.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲיָא יַעֲקֹב בְּאַרְעָא דְמִצְרַיִם שְׁבַע עֶשְׂרֵי שְׁנִין וַהֲווֹ יוֹמֵי יַעֲקֹב שְׁנֵי חַיוֹהִי מְאָה וְאַרְבְּעִין וּשְׁבַע שְׁנִין
verses.ar_en: Yaakov lived in the land of Egypt seventeen years. The days of Yaakov, the years of his life were one hundred and forty seven years.

verses.ar_he: וּקְרִיבוּ יוֹמֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לִמְמַת וּקְרָא לִבְרֵהּ לְיוֹסֵף וַאֲמַר לֵהּ אִם כְּעַן אַשְׁכָּחִית רַחֲמִין בְּעֵינָיךְ שַׁוִּי כְעַן יְדָךְ תְּחוֹת יַרְכִּי וְתַעְבֵּד עִמִּי טִיבוּ וּקְשׁוֹט לָא כְעַן תִּקְבְּרִנַּנִי בְּמִצְרַיִם
verses.ar_en: The days of Yisrael’s death drew near, and he called for his son Yoseif, and said to him, If I have found favor in your eyes, please [now], place your hand under my thigh; that you will deal kindly [with goodness] and truthfully with me. Please [Now], do not bury me in Egypt.

verses.ar_he: וְאִשְׁכּוּב עִם אֲבָהָתַי וְתִטְּלִנַנִּי מִמִּצְרַיִם וְתִקְבְּרִנַנִּי בִּקְבֻרְתְּהוֹן וַאֲמַר אֲנָא אֶעְבַּד כְּפִתְגָּמָךְ
verses.ar_en: For I will lie with my fathers. Carry me out of Egypt, and bury me in their grave. He [Yoseif said], I will do as you say.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר קַיֵּם לִי וְקַיִים לֵהּ וּסְגִיד יִשְׂרָאֵל עַל רֵישׁ עַרְסָא
verses.ar_en: He [Yaakov] said, Swear to me, and he swore to him. Yisrael prostrated himself at the head of the bed.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה בָּתַר פִּתְגָּמַיָּא הָאִלֵּין וַאֲמַר לְיוֹסֵף הָא אֲבוּךְ שְׁכִיב מְרָע וּדְבַר יָת תְּרֵין בְּנוֹהִי עִמֵּהּ יָת מְנַשֶּׁה וְיָת אֶפְרָיִם
verses.ar_en: After these events, someone said to Yoseif, Behold your father is [lying] ill. He took his two sons with him, Menasheh and Ephraim.

verses.ar_he: וְחַוִּי לְיַעֲקֹב וַאֲמַר הָא בְּרָךְ יוֹסֵף אֲתָא לְוָתָךְ וְאִתַּקַף יִשְׂרָאֵל וִיתֵיב עַל עַרְסָא
verses.ar_en: It was told to Yaakov, saying, Behold, your son, Yoseif, has come to you. Yisrael gathered his strength and sat up in bed.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יַעֲקֹב לְיוֹסֵף אֵל שַׁדַּי אִתְגְּלִי לִי בְלוּז בְּאַרְעָא דִכְנָעַן וּבָרִיךְ יָתִי
verses.ar_en: Yaakov said to Yoseif, Almighty Shaddai appeared [became revealed] to me in Luz, in the land of Canaan, and He blessed me.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לִי הָא אֲנָא מַפְשִׁינָךְ וְאַסְגִּנָּךְ וְאֶתְּנִנָּךְ לְכִנְשַׁת שִׁבְטִין וְאֶתֵּן יָת אַרְעָא הָדָא לִבְנָיךְ בַּתְרָךְ אַחֲסָנַת עֲלָם
verses.ar_en: He said to me, Behold, I will make you fruitful and numerous, and I will make you into an assembly of nations [tribes]. I will give this land to your descendants after you for an everlasting possession.

verses.ar_he: וּכְעַן תְּרֵין בְּנָיךְ דְּאִתְיְלִידוּ לָךְ בְּאַרְעָא דְמִצְרַיִם עַד מֵיתִי לְוָתָךְ לְמִצְרַיִם דִּילִי אִנּוּן אֶפְרַיִם וּמְנַשֶּׁה כִּרְאוּבֵן וְשִׁמְעוֹן יְהוֹן קֳדָמָי
verses.ar_en: And now your two sons, who were born to you in the land of Egypt before I came to you to Egypt, are mine. Ephraim and Menasheh, like Reuvein and Shimon, shall be mine [before me].

verses.ar_he: וּבְנָיךְ דִּי תוֹלִיד בַּתְרֵיהוֹן דִּילָךְ יְהוֹן עַל שׁוּם אֲחוּהוֹן יִתְקְרוּן בְּאַחֲסַנְתְּהוֹן
verses.ar_en: But your progeny that will be born after them shall be yours. They shall be called by their brother’s name with regard to their inheritance.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲנָא בְּמֵיתִי מִפַּדָן מִיתַת עָלַי רָחֵל בְּאַרְעָא דִּכְנַעַן בְּאָרְחָא בְּעוֹד כְּרוּבָא דְאַרְעָא לְמֵיעַל לְאֶפְרָת וּקְבָרִתַּהּ תַּמָּן בְּאֹרַח אֶפְרָת הִיא בֵּית לָחֶם
verses.ar_en: And I, when I came from Padan, Rochel died unto me in the land of Canaan, on the road, when there was yet a stretch of land, before coming to Ephros. I buried her there on the road to Ephros, which is Beis Lechem.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲזָא יִשְׂרָאֵל יָת בְּנֵי יוֹסֵף וַאֲמַר מַן אִלֵּין
verses.ar_en: Yisrael saw Yoseif’s sons, and he said, Who are these?

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יוֹסֵף לַאֲבוּהִי בְּנַי אִנּוּן דִּי יְהַב לִי יְיָ הָכָא וַאֲמַר קָרֵבִנּוּן כְּעַן לְוָתִי וְאֵבָרֵכִנּוּן
verses.ar_en: Yoseif said to his father, These are my sons, whom Elohim has given me in this [place] [here]. He [Yaakov] said, Please Take [Now bring] them [near] to me, and I will bless them.

verses.ar_he: וְעֵינֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל יְקָרָן מִסֵּיבוּ לָא יִכּוּל לְמֶחֱזֵי וְקָרִיב יָתְהוֹן לְוָתֵהּ וְנַשִּׁיק לְהוֹן וְגַפִּיף לְהוֹן
verses.ar_en: Yisrael’s eyes were heavy with age, and he could not see. He [Yoseif] brought them near to him, and he kissed them and hugged them.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יִשְׂרָאֵל לְיוֹסֵף לְמֶחֱזֵי אַפָיךְ לָא סְבָרִית וְהָא אַחֲזִי יָתִי יְיָ אַף יָת בְּנָיךְ
verses.ar_en: Yisrael said to Yoseif, I have never thought to see your face, and behold Elohim has even allowed me to see your offspring.

verses.ar_he: וְאַפֵּיק יוֹסֵף יָתְהוֹן מִן קֳדָמוֹהִי וּסְגִיד עַל אַפּוֹהִי עַל אַרְעָא
verses.ar_en: Yoseif brought them out from between his knees [before him], and he prostrated himself with his face to the ground.

verses.ar_he: וּדְבַר יוֹסֵף יָת תַּרְוֵיהוֹן יָת אֶפְרַיִם בִּימִינֵהּ מִשְׂמָאלָא דְיִשְׂרָאֵל וְיָת מְנַשֶּׁה בִשְׂמָאלֵהּ מִימִינָא דְיִשְׂרָאֵל וְקָרֵיב לְוָתֵהּ
verses.ar_en: Yoseif took the two [of them]—Ephraim in his right [hand], toward Yisrael’s left, and Menasheh in his left, toward Yisrael’s right—and he brought them near to him.

verses.ar_he: וְאוֹשִׁיט יִשְׂרָאֵל יָת יְמִינֵהּ וְשַׁוִּי עַל רֵישָׁא דְאֶפְרַיִם וְהוּא זְעֵירָא וְיָת שְׂמָאלֵהּ עַל רֵישָׁא דִּמְנַשֶּׁה אַחְכִּמִינּוּן לִידוֹהִי אֲרֵי מְנַשֶּׁה בּוּכְרָא
verses.ar_en: Yisrael stretched out his right [hand] and placed it on the head of Ephraim, [although] he was the younger, and his left [hand] on the head of Menasheh. He deliberately placed his hands so, even though Menasheh was the firstborn.

verses.ar_he: וּבְרִיךְ יָת יוֹסֵף וַאֲמָר יְיָ דִי פְלָחוּ אֲבָהָתַי קֳדָמוֹהִי אַבְרָהָם וְיִצְחָק יְיָ דְזַן יָתִי מִדְאִיתָנִי עַד יוֹמָא הָדֵין
verses.ar_en: He blessed Yoseif and said, Elohim before whom my fathers walked [served], Avraham, and Yitzchok, Elohim who was my shepherd [sustainer] from my inception until this day—

verses.ar_he: מַלְאָכָא דִי פְרַק יָתִי מִכָּל בִּישָׁא יְבָרֵךְ יָת עוּלֵמַיָּא וְיִתְקְרֵי בְהוֹן שְׁמִי וְשׁוּם אֲבָהָתַי אַבְרָהָם וְיִצְחָק וּכְנוּנֵי יַמָּא יִסְגוּן בְּגוֹ בְנֵי אֱנָשָׁא עַל אַרְעָא
verses.ar_en: The Angel who redeemed me from all evil, should bless the lads, and let my name be called on them, together with the name of my fathers, Avraham and Yitzchok. May they be like fish [of the sea], multiplying within [amongst people upon] the land.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲזָא יוֹסֵף אֲרֵי שַׁוִּי אָבוּהִי יַד יְמִינֵהּ עַל רֵישָׁא דְאֶפְרַיִם וּבְאֵישׁ בְּעֵינוֹהִי וְסָעֵד יְדָא דְאָבוּהִי לְאַעֲדָאָה יָתַהּ מֵעַל רֵישָׁא דְאֶפְרַיִם לְאַנָחוּתַהּ עַל רֵישָׁא דִמְנַשֶּׁה
verses.ar_en: Yoseif saw that his father placed his right hand on Ephraim’s head, and it was bad in his eyes. He held up his fathers hand, to remove it from Ephraim’s head [and to place it] on Menasheh’s head.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יוֹסֵף לְאָבוּהִי לָא כֵן אַבָּא אֲרֵי דֵין בּוּכְרָא שַׁו יְמִינָךְ עַל רֵישֵׁהּ
verses.ar_en: Yoseif said to his father, Not so, my father, for this one is the firstborn, place your right hand on his head.

verses.ar_he: וְסָרֵיב אָבוּהִי וַאֲמַר יְדַעְנָא בְרִי יְדַעְנָא אַף הוּא יְהֵי לְעַמָּא וְאַף הוּא יִסְגֵּי וּבְרַם אָחוּהִי זְעִירָא יִסְגֵּי מִנֵּהּ וּבְנוֹהִי יְהוֹן שַׁלִּיטִין בְּעַמְמַיָּא
verses.ar_en: His father refused, and he said, I know my son, I know. He too will become a people, he too will become great; however his younger brother will be greater than he, and [the fame] of his descendants will fill [rule] the nations.

verses.ar_he: וּבְרֵיכִנּוּן בְּיוֹמָא הַהוּא לְמֵימַר בָּךְ יְבָרֵךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל לְמֵימַר יְשַׁוִּינָךְ יְיָ כְּאֶפְרַיִם וְכִמְנַשֶּׁה וְשַׁוִּי יָת אֶפְרַיִם קֳדָם מְנַשֶּׁה
verses.ar_en: He blessed them on that day saying: Through you shall [the People of] Israel bless saying; May Elohim make you as Ephraim and Menasheh. He placed Ephraim ahead of Menasheh.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יִשְׂרָאֵל לְיוֹסֵף הָא אֲנָא מָאִית וִיהֵי מֵימְרָא דַיְיָ בְּסַעְדְכוֹן וְיָתֵיב יָתְכוֹן לְאַרְעָא דַאֲבָהַתְכוֹן
verses.ar_en: Yisrael said to Yoseif, Behold I am dying. [The Word of] Elohim will be with you [your support], and He will bring you back to the land of your fathers.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲנָא יְהָבִית לָךְ חוּלַק חַד יַתִּיר עַל אַחָיךְ דִּי נְסֵיבִית מִידָא דֶאֱמוֹרָאָה בִּצְלוֹתִי וּבְבָעוּתִי
verses.ar_en: I have given you one share more than your brothers, which I took from the hand of the Amorite with my sword [prayer] and with my bow [plea].

verses.ar_he: וּקְרָא יַעֲקֹב לִבְנוֹהִי וַאֲמַר אִתְכַּנָשׁוּ וַאֲחַוֵּי לְכוֹן יָת דִּי יְעָרַע יָתְכוֹן בְּסוֹף יוֹמַיָּא
verses.ar_en: Yaakov called for his sons and said, Gather around and I will tell you what will happen to you in latter days.

verses.ar_he: אִתְכַּנָּשׁוּ וּשְׁמָעוּ בְּנֵי יַעֲקֹב וְקַבִּילוּ אוּלְפַן מִן יִשְׂרָאֵל אֲבוּכוֹן
verses.ar_en: Come together and listen, sons of Yaakov; listen to [accept chastisement from] Yisrael, your father.

verses.ar_he: רְאוּבֵן בּוּכְרִי אַתְּ חֵילִי וְרֵישׁ תָּקְפִּי לָךְ הֲוָה חָזֵי לְמִסַּב תְּלָתָא חוּלָקִין בְּכֵירוּתָא כְּהֻנְתָּא וּמַלְכוּתָא
verses.ar_en: Reuvein, you are my firstborn, you are my strength, and the beginning of my manhood [power]; superior in rank and superior in power [it would have been right for you to take three portions—the birthright, the priesthood, and the kingship].

verses.ar_he: עַל דַאֲזַלְתָּא לָקֳבֵל אַפָּיךְ הָא כְמַיָּא בְּרַם לָא אַהֲנֵיתָא חוֹלָק יַתִּיר לָא תִסַּב אֲרֵי סְלֶקְתָּא בֵּית מִשְׁכָּבֵי אָבוּךְ בְּכֵן אֲחֶלְתָּא לְשִׁוּוּיִי בְּרִי סְלֶקְתָּא
verses.ar_en: Unstable as water, you shall no longer be superior, [However, because you went towards your anger like flowing water, you will not benefit, you will not receive an additional portion,] for you have gone up [to the place of] your father’s bed. You profaned He Who went up on my couch[, my son, you went up].

verses.ar_he: שִׁמְעוֹן וְלֵוִי אַחִין גַּבְרִין גִּבָּרִין בְּאַרַע תּוֹתָבוּתְהוֹן עֲבָדוּ גְּבוּרָא
verses.ar_en: Shimon and Levi are brothers[, mighty men]. Instruments of violence are their wares. [In the land of their residence they did mighty deeds.]

verses.ar_he: בְּרָזְהוֹן לָא הֲוַת נַפְשִׁי בְּאִתְכַּנְשֵׁהוֹן לִמְהַךְ לָא נְחָתִית מִן יְקָרִי אֲרֵי בְרָגְזְהוֹן קְטָלוּ קְטוֹל וּבִרְעוּתְהוֹן תַּרָעוּ שׁוּר סַנְּאָה
verses.ar_en: My soul will not enter [was not in] their secret council, let my honor not be identified with their assembly [when they gathered to go to war against Shechem I did not descend from my honor and join them]. For in their anger they killed a [”dead”] man, and through their willfulness they maimed an ox [demolished the enemy’s wall].

verses.ar_he: לִיט רָגְזְהוֹן אֲרֵי תַקִיף וְחֵמַתְהוֹן אֲרֵי קַשְׁיָא אֲפַלְגִנוּן בְּיַעֲקֹב וְאֵבַדָרִנוּן בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל
verses.ar_en: Cursed be their anger for it is powerful, and their fury for it is cruel. I will divid them throughout Yaakov and scatter them throughout [the land of] Israel.

verses.ar_he: יְהוּדָה אַתְּ אוֹדֵיתָא וְלָא בְהֵיתְתָא בָּךְ יוֹדוּן אַחָיךְ יְדָךְ תִּתְקֵף עַל בַּעֲלֵי דְבָבָךְ יִתְבַּדְרוּן סַנְאָךְ יְהוֹן מְחַזְרִין קְדַּל קֳדָמָךְ וִיְהוֹן מְקַדְמִין לְמִשְׁאַל בִּשְׁלָמָךְ בְּנֵי אָבוּךְ
verses.ar_en: Yehudah, your brothers will praise you [you confessed, and you were not ashamed. Your brothers will acknowledge you.] Your hand will be on the neck of [overpower] your enemies. [Your haters will be dispersed. They will turn the back of their necks to you.] Your father’s sons will prostrate themselves to you [greet you first].

verses.ar_he: שִׁלְטוֹן יְהֵי בְשֵׁרוּיָא וּבְסוֹפָא יִתְרַבָּא מַלְכָּא מִדְבֵית יְהוּדָה אֲרֵי מִדִין קַטְלָא בְּרִי נַפְשָׁךְ סְלֶקְתָּא יְנוּחַ יִשְׁרֵי בִתְקוֹף כְּאַרְיָא וּכְלֵיתָא וְלֵית מַלְכוּ דִתְזַעְזְעִנֵהּ
verses.ar_en: Yehudah is like a young lion. [He will be a ruler at the beginning, and at the end, a king will be anointed from the house of Yehudah.] You have risen above plunder my son. [For from the judgment of death, my son, you removed yourself.] He crouches, rests like a lion, [He will rest and dwell in strength like a lion.] like an awesome lion, who will rouse him? [there is no kingdom that can make him tremble.]

verses.ar_he: לָא יַעֲדֵי עָבֵד שָׁלְטַן מִדְבֵית יְהוּדָה וְסַפְרָא מִבְּנֵי בְנוֹהִי עַד עָלְמָא עַד דְיֵיתֵי מְשִׁיחָא דְדִילֵהּ הִיא מַלְכוּתָא וְלֵהּ יִשְׁתַּמְעוּן עַמְמַיָּא
verses.ar_en: The rod [of the ruler] will not depart from [the house of] Yehudah, nor a law-enforcer from between his feet [nor a scribe from his children’s children forever], until Shiloh Comes [the Moshiach will come, for his is the kingship], and to him shall be an assembly of nations [nations will listen].

verses.ar_he: יַסְחַר יִשְׂרָאֵל לְקַרְתֵּהּ עַמָּא יִבְנוּן הֵיכְלֵהּ יְהוֹן צַדִּיקַיָּא סְחוֹר סְחוֹר לֵהּ וְעָבְדֵי אוֹרַיְתָא בְּאוּלְפַן עִמֵּהּ יְהֵי אַרְגְוָן טַב לְבוּשׁוֹהִי כְּסוּתֵהּ מֵילָא מֵילָא צְבַע זְהוֹרִי וְצִבְעוֹנִין
verses.ar_en: He loads his young donkey with grapes of a vine, and his she-donkey’s foal with a vine-branch. [He will bring Israel from all around to his city, the nation who will build his Temple. / The righteous will congregate around the Moshiach, and those who engage in Torah will study with him.] He washes his clothes in wine, [May his garments be of fine purple cloth,] and his cloak in the blood of grapes [and his clothes of fine wool colored in scarlet and other colors].

verses.ar_he: ??? יְסַמְקוּן טּוּרוֹהִי בְּכַרְמוֹהִי יְטוּפוּן נַעֲווֹהִי בַּחֲמָר יְחַוְרָן בִּקְעֲתֵהּ בְּעִיבוּר וּבְעֶדְרֵי עָנָא
verses.ar_en: His eyes are red from wine, [His mountains will become red with his vineyards, / His winepresses will be flowing with wine,] and his teeth are white [from an abundance of] milk [His valleys will appear white from the abundance of grain and sheep].

verses.ar_he: זְבוּלֻן עַל סְפַר יַמְמַיָּא יִשְׁרֵי וְהוּא יְכַבֵּשׁ מְחוֹזִין בִּסְפִינַן וְטוּב יַמָּא יֵיכוּל וּתְחוּמֵהּ יְהֵי מָטֵי עַל צִידוֹן
verses.ar_en: Zevulun will settle on seashores, he will be a harbor for ships [conquer the borders with ships]; [he will consume the best of the sea] his border will reach to Sidon.

verses.ar_he: יִשָּׂשׂכָר עַתִּיר בְּנִכְסִין וְאַחֲסַנְתֵּהּ בֵּין תְּחוּמַיָּא
verses.ar_en: Yissachar is a bony donkey [rich in property], crouching [and his inheritance is] between the borders.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲזָא חוּלָקָא אֲרֵי טַב וְיָת אַרְעָא אֲרֵי מְעַבְּדָא פֵירִין וִיכַבֵּשׁ מָחוֹזֵי עַמְמַיָּא וִישֵׁיצֵי יָת דַּיָרֵיהוֹן וּדְאִשְׁתַּאֲרוּן בְּהוֹן יְהוֹן לֵהּ פַּלְחִין וּמַסְּקֵי מַסִּין
verses.ar_en: He saw that rest [his portion] is good, and that the land is pleasant [produces fruit]; he bent his shoulder to bear the burden [and he will conquer territories of peoples and destroy their inhabitants]; and became a servant to pay the tribute [and those that remain will become workers to him and bring taxes].

verses.ar_he: מִדְּבֵית דָּן יִתְבְּחַר וִיקוּם גַּבְרָא בְּיוֹמוֹהִי יִתְפְּרֵק עַמֵּהּ וּבִשְׁנוֹהִי יְנוּחוּן כַּחֲדָא שִׁבְטַּיָּא דְיִשְׂרָאֵל
verses.ar_en: Dan will avenge his people [From the house of Dan a man will be chosen and will arise, in his day his people will be delivered], as one of the tribes of Israel [and in his years the tribes of Israel will rest together].

verses.ar_he: יְהֵי גַבְרָא דְיִתְבְּחַר וִיקוּם מִדְּבֵית דָּן אֵימְתֵהּ תִּתְרְמֵי עַל עַמְמַיָּא וּמְחָתֵהּ תִּתְקֵף בִּפְלִשְׁתָּאֵי כְּחִיוֵי חוּרְמָן יִשְׁרֵי עַל אָרְחָא וּכְפִתְנָא יִכְמוֹן עַל שְׁבִילָא יְקַטֵּיל גִּבָּרֵי מַשִׁרְיַת פְּלִשְׁתָּאֵי פָּרָשִׁין עִם רַגְלָאִין יְעַקֵר סוּסָוָן וּרְתִכִּין וִימַגֵּר רוֹכְבֵיהוֹן לַאֲחוֹרָא
verses.ar_en: Dan will be a serpent on the road, [The man that will be chosen and will arise from the house of Dan û his terror will fall upon the peoples, and his smiting will be strong against the Pelishtim. Like a viper he will lie on the way,] a viper on the path [and like an old snake he will ambush on the path], that bites the horse’s heel [He will kill the mighty of the camp of the Plishtim / the horsemen with the infantry / He will uproot the horses and chariots] so that the rider falls backward [and he will cause their riders to fall backward].

verses.ar_he: לְפוּרְקָנָךְ סַבָּרִית יְיָ
verses.ar_en: For your deliverance, I wait, Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: מִדְבֵית גָד מַשִׁרְיַת מְזַיְנִין כַּד יַעַבְרוּן יָת יַרְדְנָא קֳדָם אֲחֵיהוֹן לִקְרָבָא וּבְנִכְסִין סַגִּיאִין יְתוּבוּן לְאַרְעֲהוֹן
verses.ar_en: [From the house of] Gad will be an assailing [armed] troop[s will pass over the Jordan before their brothers to war]; he will be a troop at their heels [and they will return to their land with much property].

verses.ar_he: דְאָשֵׁר טָבָא אַרְעֵהּ וְהוּא מְרַבְיָא בְּתַפְנוּקֵי מַלְכִין
verses.ar_en: From Asher will come oily food [The land of Asher is good], he will provide [it produces] delicacies for the king.

verses.ar_he: נַפְתָּלִי בְּאַרַע טָבָא יִתְרְמֵי עַדְבֵהּ וְאַחְסַנְתֵּהּ תְּהֵי מְעַבְּדָא פֵירִין יְהוֹן מוֹדַן וּמְבָרְכִין עֲלֵיהוֹן
verses.ar_en: Naftali is a gazelle-like messenger, [The lot of Naftali will fall on a good land. His inheritance will yield fruit,] he delivers pleasant Sayings [they will give thanks and blessings over them].

verses.ar_he: בְּרִי דְיִסְגֵּי יוֹסֵף בְּרִי דְיִתְבָּרַךְ כְּגֹפֶן דִּנְצִב עַל עֵינָא דְמַיָּא תְּרֵין שִׁבְטִין יִפְּקוּן מִבְּנוֹהִי יְקַבְּלוּן חוּלָקָא וְאַחֲסַנְתָּא
verses.ar_en: A fruitful son is Yoseif, [Yoseif is a son who will increase,] a fruitful son at the well [source] [a son who will be blessed like a vine planted by a spring of water]. Daughters tread on the wall. [Two tribes will emerge from his sons, they will receive a portion and an inheritance.]

verses.ar_he: וְאִתְמַרְרוּ יָתֵהּ וְנַקְמוֹהִי וְאָעִיקוּ לֵהּ גֻבְרִין גִּבָּרִין בַּעֲלֵי פַלְגוּתָא
verses.ar_en: They made him bitter and quarreled with him [they avenged themselves on him]. Expert bowmen with hatred made him their target. [Mighty men, those who have half, afflicted him.]

verses.ar_he: וְתָבַת בְּהוֹן נְבִיאוּתֵהּ עַל דְּקַיֵּם אוֹרַיְתָא בְּסִתְרָא וְשַׁוִּי בְתוּקְפָא רוֹחֲצָנֵהּ בְּכֵן יִתְרְמָא דְהַב עַל דְּרָעוֹהִי וְאַחֲסִין מַלְכוּתָא וּתְקֵיף דָּא הֲוַת לֵהּ מִן קֳדָם אֵל תַּקִיפָא דְיַעֲקֹב דִּי בְמֵימְרֵהּ זַן אֲבָהָן וּבְנִין זַרְעָא דְיִשְׂרָאֵל
verses.ar_en: His bow remained in strength, [His prophecy was fulfilled in them, because he secretly kept the Torah. He placed his trust in the Almighty,] his arms were bedecked with gold, [therefore, gold was placed on his arms / and he inherited kingship and power.] by the hand of Mighty One of Yaakov [This was for him from before the Mighty God of Yaakov]; from there he became the shepherd [the provider], [who by His Word sustained] the stone of Israel [the fathers and sons of the seed of Israel].

verses.ar_he: מֵימַר אֱלָהָא דְאָבוּךְ יְהֵי בְסַעְדָךְ וְיָת שַׁדַּי וִיבָרְכִנָּךְ בִּרְכַן דְּנַחֲתָן מִטַּלָּא דִשְׁמַיָּא מִלְעֵלָא בִּרְכַן דְנַגְדַן מִמַעֲמַקֵי אַרְעָא מִלְרָע בִּרְכְּתָא דְאָבוּךְ וּדְאִמָּךְ
verses.ar_en: From the Almighty [The Word of the God] of your father and He will help you [will be your support], and Shaddai Who will bless you with the blessings of [that descend from the dew of the] heaven from above, blessings [that flow] of [from] the depths [of the earth] that lie below, blessings of seed and womb [your father and your mother].

verses.ar_he: בִּרְכְּתָא דְאָבוּךְ יִתּוֹסְפָן עַל בִּרְכְּתָא דִילִי בָּרִיכוּ אֲבָהָתַי דַחֲמִידוּ לְהֶן רַבְרְבַיָּא דְמִן עָלְמָא יֶהֶוְיַן כָּל אִלֵּין לְרֵישָׁא דְיוֹסֵף וּלְגַבְרָא פָּרִישָׁא דַאֲחוֹהִי
verses.ar_en: The blessings that [of] your father [received] are stronger than [will be in addition to] the blessings [with which] my forebears [received] [blessed me] even to the boundaries of the eternal hills [for which the righteous of the earth longed]; they [all these] shall be on Yoseif’s head, on the crown of him who is a Nazirite among his brothers [and on the man who was separated from his brothers].

verses.ar_he: בִּנְיָמִין בְּאַרְעֵהּ תִּשְׁרֵי שְׁכִנְתָּא וּבְאַחֲסַנְתֵּהּ יִתְבְּנֵי מַקְדְשָׁא בְּצַפְרָא וּבְפַנְיָא יְהוֹן מְקָרְבִין כַּהֲנַיָּא קָרְבָּנָא וּבְעִדַּן רַמְשָׁא יְהוֹן מְפַלְגִין מוֹתַר חוּלְקְהוֹן מִשְׁאַר קָדְשַׁיָּא
verses.ar_en: Binyamin is like a wolf that preys. [: the Shechina will dwell in his land, and in his inheritance the Temple will be built.] In the morning [and towards evening] he will eat a portion, [the Cohanim will offer sacrifices,] and in the evening he will divide the spoil [and in the evening-time they will divide their left over share from other sacred things].

verses.ar_he: כָּל אִלֵּין שִׁבְטַיָּא דְיִשְׂרָאֵל תְּרֵין עֲסַר וְדָא דְמַלֵּיל לְהוֹן אֲבוּהוֹן וּבָרִיךְ יָתְהוֹן גְבַר דִּי כְבִרְכְּתֵהּ בָּרֵךְ יָתְהוֹן
verses.ar_en: All these are tribes of Israel, twelve [of them]; and this is what their father spoke to them and he blessed them. He blessed them each with his own unique blessing.

verses.ar_he: וּפַקֵד יָתְהוֹן וַאֲמַר לְהוֹן אֲנָא מִתְכְּנֵשׁ לְעַמִּי קְבָרוּ יָתִי לְוַת אֲבָהָתִי בִּמְעַרְתָּא דִי בַחֲקַל עֶפְרוֹן חִתָּאָה
verses.ar_en: He commanded them, and said to them, I shall be gathered to my people; bring me for burial to my fathers, to the cave that is in the field of Ephron the Chittite.

verses.ar_he: בִּמְעַרְתָּא דִי בַחֲקַל כָּפֶלְתָּא דִי עַל אַפֵּי מַמְרֵא בְּאַרְעָא דִכְנָעַן דִי זְבַן אַבְרָהָם יָת חַקְלָא מִן עֶפְרֹן חִתָּאָה לְאַחֲסָנַת קְבוּרָא
verses.ar_en: In the cave that is in the field of Machpeilah, which faces Mamrei in the land of Canaan; which Avraham bought, along with the field, from Ephron, the Chittite, for a possession as a burial place.

verses.ar_he: תַּמָּן קְבָרוּ יָת אַבְרָהָם וְיָת שָׂרָה אִתְּתֵהּ תַּמָּן קְבָרוּ יָת יִצְחָק וְיָת רִבְקָה אִתְּתֵהּ וְתַמָּן קְבָרִית יָת לֵאָה
verses.ar_en: There they buried Avraham and Sarah, his wife, there they buried Yitzchok and Rivkah, his wife, and there I buried Leah.

verses.ar_he: זְבִינֵי חַקְלָא וּמְעַרְתָּא דִי בֵהּ מִן בְּנֵי חִתָּאָהּ
verses.ar_en: The purchase of the field and the cave that is in it was made from the sons of Cheis.

verses.ar_he: וְשֵׁיצֵי יַעֲקֹב לְפַקָּדָא יָת בְּנוֹהִי וּכְנַשׁ רַגְלוֹהִי לְעַרְסָא וְאִתְנְגִיד וְאִתְכְּנִישׁ לְעַמֵּהּ
verses.ar_en: Yaakov concluded his commands to his sons, and he gathered up his feet, to the bed. He expired and was gathered to his people.

verses.ar_he: וּנְפַל יוֹסֵף עַל אַפֵּי אָבוּהִי וּבְכָא עֲלוֹהִי וּנְשַׁק לֵהּ
verses.ar_en: Yoseif fell on the face of his father, and wept over him and kissed him.

verses.ar_he: וּפַקֵּיד יוֹסֵף יָת עַבְדוֹהִי יָת אַסְוָתָא לְמֶחְנַט יָת אָבוּהִי וְחָנְטוּ אַסְוָתָא יָת יִשְׂרָאֵל
verses.ar_en: Yoseif commanded his servants, the physicians, to embalm his father and the physicians embalmed Yisrael.

verses.ar_he: וּשְׁלִימוּ לֵהּ אַרְבְּעִין יוֹמִין אֲרֵי כֵּן שְׁלִימוּ יוֹמֵי חֲנִיטַיָּא וּבְכוֹ יָתֵהּ מִצְרָאֵי שַׁבְעִין יוֹמִין
verses.ar_en: They completed forty days [of embalmment] for him, for that is the number of days required for embalming. The Egyptians wept for him seventy days.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבָרוּ יוֹמֵי בְכִיתֵהּ וּמַלִיל יוֹסֵף עִם בֵּית פַּרְעֹה לְמֵימָר אִם כְּעַן אַשְׁכָּחִית רַחֲמִין בְּעֵינֵיכוֹן מַלִּילוּ כְעַן קֳדָם פַּרְעֹה לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: [When] the days of weeping were over, Yoseif spoke to the house of Pharaoh saying, If I have found favor in your eyes, please [now] speak in [before] Pharaoh’s ears, saying.

verses.ar_he: אַבָּא קַיֵּים עָלַי לְמֵימָר הָא אֲנָא מָאִית בְּקִבְרִי דְאַתְקֵנִית לִי בְּאַרְעָא דִכְנָעַן תַּמָּן תִּקְבְּרִנָנִי וּכְעַן אֶסַּק כְּעַן וְאֶקְבַּר יָת אַבָּא וְאֵ יתוּב
verses.ar_en: My father made me swear [an oath] saying, Behold I am dying. In my grave that I have prepared for myself in the land of Canaan, there you shall bury me. Now therefore, please [now], I would go up and bury my father, and then I will return.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר פַּרְעֹה סַק וּקְבוֹר יָת אֲבוּךְ כְּמָא דְקַיֵּים עֲלָךְ
verses.ar_en: Pharaoh said, Go up and bury your father, just as he made you swear.

verses.ar_he: וּסְלֵיק יוֹסֵף לְמִקְבַּר יָת אָבוּהִי וּסְלִיקוּ עִמֵּהּ כָּל עַבְדֵי פַרְעֹה סָבֵי בֵיתֵהּ וְכֹל סָבֵי אַרְעָא דְמִצְרָיִם
verses.ar_en: Yoseif went up to bury his father; and with him went up all Pharaohs servant’s, the elders of this house, and all the elders of the land of Egypt,

verses.ar_he: וְכֹל בֵּית יוֹסֵף וַאֲחוֹהִי וּבֵית אָבוּהִי לְחוֹד טַפְלְהוֹן וְעָנְהוֹן וְתוֹרֵיהוֹן שְׁבָקוּ בְּאַרְעָא דְגשֶׁן
verses.ar_en: And all Yoseif’s household, his brothers and his father’s household. Only their little ones, their sheep and their cattle did they leave behind in the land of Goshen.

verses.ar_he: וּסְלִיקוּ עִמֵּהּ אַף רְתִכִּין אַף פָּרָשִׁין וַהֲוָה מַשְׁרִיתָא סַגִּיאָה לַחֲדָא
verses.ar_en: With him also went up chariots and horsemen. It was a very imposing camp.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲתוֹ עַד בֵּית אִדְרֵי דְאָטָד דִּי בְּעִבְרָא דְיַרְדְנָא וּסְפָדוּ תַמָּן מִסְפֵּד רַב וְתַקִּיף לַחֲדָא וְעָבַד לַאֲבוּהִי אֶבְלָא שַׁבְעָא יוֹמִין
verses.ar_en: They came to the threshing place of Atad, which is on the other side of the Jordan, and there they eulogized [him and held] a very great and imposing funeral. He [Yoseif] made seven days of mourning for his father.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲזָא יָתֵב אַרְעָא כְנַעֲנָאָה יָת אֶבְלָא בְּבֵית אִדְרֵי דְאָטָד וַאֲמָרוּ אָבֵל תַּקִּיף דֵּין לְמִצְרָאֵי עַל כֵּן קְרָא שְׁמַהּ אָבֵל מִצְרַיִם דִּי בְּעִבְרָא דְיַרְדְנָא
verses.ar_en: The Canaanites who lived in the land saw the mourning in the threshing place of Atad, and they said, This is heavy mourning for Egypt. It was therefore named Egypt’s Mourning, which is on the other side of the Jordan.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבָדוּ בְּנוֹהִי לֵהּ כֵּן כְּמָא דִי פַּקֵדִנּוּן
verses.ar_en: His sons did for him as he commanded them.

verses.ar_he: וּנְטָלוּ יָתֵהּ בְּנוֹהִי לְאַרְעָא דִכְנַעַן וּקְבָרוּ יָתֵהּ בִּמְעָרַת חֲקַל כָּפֶלְתָּא דִי זְבַן אַבְרָהָם יָת חַקְלָא לְאַחֲסָנַת קְבוּרָא מִן עֶפְרֹן חִתָּאָה עַל אַפֵּי מַמְרֵא
verses.ar_en: His sons carried him to the land of Canaan, and buried him in the cave of the field of Machpeilah, which Avraham purchased along with the field, for a possession as a burial place, from Ephron, the Chittite, facing Mamrei.

verses.ar_he: וְתַב יוֹסֵף לְמִצְרַיִם הוּא וַאֲחוֹהִי וְכָל דִּסְלִיקוּ עִמֵּהּ לְמִקְבַּר יָת אָבוּהִי בָּתַר דִּקְבַר יָת אָבוּהִי
verses.ar_en: Yoseif returned to Egypt, he and his brothers, and all those who went with him, to bury his father, after he had buried his father.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲזוֹ אֲחֵי יוֹסֵף אֲרֵי מִית אֲבוּהוֹן וַאֲמָרוּ דִּלְמָא יִטַּר לָנָא דְבָבוּ יוֹסֵף וְאֲתָבָא יָתֵיב לָנָא יָת כָּל בִּישְׁתָא דִי גְמַלְנָא יָתֵהּ
verses.ar_en: Yoseif’s brothers saw that their father was dead, and they said, Perhaps Yoseif still bears a grudge against us. He will then certainly repay us for all the evil that we did him.

verses.ar_he: וּפַקִידוּ לְוַת יוֹסֵף לְמֵימָר אָבוּךְ פַּקֵּד קֳדָם מוֹתֵהּ לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: They sent a command to Yoseif saying, Your father issued a command before his death, saying,

verses.ar_he: כְּדֵין תֵּימְרוּן לְיוֹסֵף בְּבָעוּ שְׁבוֹק כְּעַן לְחוֹבָא אַחָיךְ וְלַחֲטָאֵהוֹן אֲרֵי בִישְׁתָא גְמָלוּךְ וּכְעַן שְׁבוֹק כְּעַן לְחוֹבָא עַבְדֵי אֱלָהָא דְאָבוּךְ וּבְכָא יוֹסֵף בְּמַלָלוּתְהוֹן עִמֵּהּ
verses.ar_en: This is what you should say to Yoseif, Please forgive the transgression of your brothers and their sin, for they did evil to you. And now please forgive [now] the transgr ession of the servants of the God of your father. Yoseif wept as his brothers spoke to him.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲזָלוּ אַף אֲחוֹהִי וּנְפָלוּ קֳדָמוֹהִי וַאֲמָרוּ הָא אֲנַחְנָא לָךְ לְעַבְדִין
verses.ar_en: His brothers also went and threw themselves down before him, and they said, Behold, we are your slaves.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לְהוֹן יוֹסֵף לָא תִדַחֲלוּן אֲרֵי דַחֲלָא דַּיְיָ אֲנָא
verses.ar_en: Yoseif said to them, Fear not. For am I in place of Elohim? [For I am one who fears Elohim]

verses.ar_he: וְאַתּוּן חֲשַׁבְתּוּן עֲלַי בִּישָׁא מִן קֳדָם יְיָ אִתְחַשְׁבַת לְטָבָא בְּדִיל לְמֶעְבַּד כְּיוֹמָא הָדֵין לְקַיָּמָא עַם סַגִּי
verses.ar_en: You meant to do evil to me, but [from before] Elohim [it was meant] meant it for good, in order to do as it is today, to preserve the lives of a great people.

verses.ar_he: וּכְעַן לָא תִדַחֲלוּן אֲנָא אֵזוּן יָתְכוֹן וְיָת טַפְלְכוֹן וְנַחֵם יָתְהוֹן וּמַלֵּיל תַּנְחוּמִין עַל לִבְּהוֹן
verses.ar_en: And now, fear not. I will provide for you and your little ones. He comforted them and spoke [words of consolation] to their hearts.

verses.ar_he: וִיתֵיב יוֹסֵף בְּמִצְרַיִם הוּא וּבֵית אָבוּהִי וַחֲיָא יוֹסֵף מְאָה וַעֲסַר שְׁנִין
verses.ar_en: Yoseif lived in Egypt, he and his father’s household. Yoseif lived one hundred and ten years.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲזָא יוֹסֵף לְאֶפְרַיִם בְּנִין תְּלִיתָאִין אַף בְּנֵי מָכִיר בַּר מְנַשֶּׁה אִתְיְלִידוּ וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵף
verses.ar_en: Yoseif saw Ephraim’s children of the third generations. The children of Machir, Menasheh’s son, were born [and Yoseif rasied them] on Yoseif’s knees.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יוֹסֵף לַאֲחוֹהִי אֲנָא מָאִית וַיְיָ מִדְכַּר דְּכִיר יָתְכוֹן וְיִסַק יָתְכוֹן מִן אַרְעָא הָדָא לְאַרְעָא דִי קַיִים לְאַבְרָהָם לְיִצְחָק וּלְיַעֲקֹב
verses.ar_en: Yoseif said to his brothers, I will die, and Elohim will surely consider you and bring you up out of this land, to the land which He swore to Avraham, Yitzchok and to Yaakov.

verses.ar_he: וְאוֹמֵי יוֹסֵף יָת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לְמֵימָר מִדְכַּר דְּכִיר יְיָ יָתְכוֹן וְתַסְקוּן יָת גַּרְמַי מִכָּא
verses.ar_en: Yoseif made the sons of Yisrael swear, saying, Elohim will surely consider you, and you shall bring my bones up from here.

verses.ar_he: וּמִית יוֹסֵף בַּר מְאָה וַעֲסַר שְׁנִין וַחֲנָטוּ יָתֵהּ וְשָׂמוּהִי בָאֳרוֹנָא בְּמִצְרָיִם
verses.ar_en: Yoseif died being a hundred and ten years old. They embalmed him and he was placed in a coffin in Egypt. Chazak
